loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em K. is a 28-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is married to Hornten, age 32. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have two school-aged children. Em K. says that the roof of her house was cracked by water during a period of heavy rainfall. She is looking for a loan to replace her roof.

loans.use: to replace her damaged roof

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, 56, has a hog raising business. She started this business in 2006.  Now she is requesting a loan of 15,000 Php from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to fill the needs of her piggery.

Rosa is a widow and has 10 children. Providing for the needs of her family is not easy for her as she does not have a husband anymore on whom she can depend. She strives hard to make her business productive so she can earn more. She wants the best for her children and is determined to sustain her family so they can be together.

loans.use: To buy pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 36 years old. She is married and has two children who are both in school. She lives with her children and her husband in a rented apartment in Axim, which is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Most people in Axim are involved in the fishing business.

Janet has been a seamstress by profession for thirteen years. She has six apprentices who she is in the process of training. In order to expand her seamstress business and to provide a better service to her client base, she is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,075 to purchase different kinds of fabrics and other sewing accessories.

loans.use: To expand and improve her seamstress business by purchasing sewing accessories and different fabrics.

loans.name: Abigirl

texts.en:
Abigirl, age 40, sells cream, drinks, and groceries to provide for the needs of her family. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is married and has four children, ages 11, 14, 17, and 20. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

To meet the demand of her customers, Abigirl is requesting a loan in the amount of N60,000 in order to purchase more cream and groceries to sell.

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Carmen Esther

texts.es:
En un pequeño barrio de Soledad de solo 4 manzanas llamado Bella Murillo, vive Carmen S., mujer comerciante de productos variados, especialmente cosméticos,  casada y con 2 hijos, que se inicia  como empleada de una confección donde trabajó por muchos años y de la que debió renunciar, debido a que su hijo presentó por un largo tiempo problemas de salud, que le impedían el cumplimiento de horarios laborales. 

Desde esta época, buscó oportunidades para trabajar como independiente para poder generar ingresos que le permitieran estar al cuidado de su hijo; fue así como comenzó   ella sola confeccionando vestidos por mucho tiempo,  lo cual le causó agotamiento; por eso aprovechando el conocimiento en el manejo de la clientela, decidió convertirse en comerciante y desde hace 7 años vende a través de guías especializadas de productos,  para poder continuar apoyando el ingreso familiar en unión de su esposo que también es comerciante de productos desechables y de farmacia.

Su pequeño e incipiente capital fue fortalecido desde el principio por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con más de 6 créditos gradualmente aumentados al terminar de cancelarlos; ella considera que al recibir un financiamiento debe administrarlo con cautela, esto es, dirigirlos a la inversión de mercancías para reproducir su capital de trabajo, tal como lo ha venido haciendo durante todo este tiempo; con los financiamientos que ha recibido se siente muy satisfecha porque se ajustan a las mensualidades que ella puede pagar, al plazo requerido y negociado previamente en la visita preliminar al crédito realizada por el asesor y porque puede apoyar mucho su hogar principalmente.

En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 el cual utilizará para obtener descuentos al cancelar facturas anticipadamente y para la compra de mercancías que le han requerido sus clientes.

Sus principales metas están relacionadas con cambiarse de barrio, comprando una casa en una zona más central, donde se encuentran sus principales clientes los cuales son empleados pero tiene trabajadores independientes, con todos ellos es muy selectiva y otorga pequeños cupos de crédito con una cuota inicial cuando se inician como sus clientes.
texts.en:
In a small neighborhood of Soledad, called Bella Murilo, measuring just 4 manzanas, lives Carmen S., a woman merchant who sells varied products, especially cosmetics. She is married with 2 children. Carmen began as a manufacturing employee and worked for many years but had to resign, due to her child's long-term health problems which impeded her from complying with work hours. Since that time, she has looked for opportunities to work independently, for a way to generate income that will permit her to care for her son. This is how she came to make dresses for a long time, which wore her out. For this reason, and knowing how to handle customers, she decided to become a merchant. For the last 7 years she has sold products, using specialized guides to products, in order to continue to add to the family income, in union with her husband. He is also a merchant, selling disposable products and operating a pharmacy. Her small beginning capital was fortified from the start by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with more than 6 loans, each gradually increasing as the last was paid off. She believed that each loan should be administered cautiously, that is, directing them towards investing in merchandise to reproduce her working capital, which she has been doing all this time. She is very satisfied with the loans she has received; her monthly payments have been negotiated by the assessor during the first visit at payable amounts and desirable periods that would benefit her family. Presently, she is applying for a loan of $2,000,000 (Colombian pesos) to be used to obtain discounts in paying off previous invoices early, and to buy merchandise requested by her customers. Her principle goals are related to changing neighborhoods; buying a house in a more central zone where she will be close to her principle customers, who are employees and independent workers. She is very selective in granting small amounts of credit, with an initial quota set when each begins as a customer.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE AND OBTAIN DISCOUNTS BY PAYING BILLS EARLY

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel G. O. is twenty-seven years old, married, and has one child. His wife is a housewife and they hope to give their child a very good education.

Daniel’s business is located by the roadside at Manyatta Estate in Kisumu. He sells goods like sugar, cooking fat, detergents, bread, milk, etc., to the local people. He has been engaged in this business for the last three years and he works very hard, from early morning to late evening, to ensure continuity of his business in a market where there are many people doing the same business as his.

Daniel is using his loan to restock his business to expand it and hopes to open a bigger retail shop. He also dreams of building a permanent house and also giving his child a good education.

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of sugar, 10 cartons of bar soap, milk and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a taxi-moto

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen Cecilia C. M. se dedica a tender el Negocio de la Pulpería desde la 7am a 6pm el cual con este negocio sustenta las necesidades de la familia esta señora tiene 15 año de trabajar en esta actividad.  

Este crédito que solicito es para ampliar su inventario de su negocio y su plan de  inversión es Compra de producto de la canasta básica , licores y golosina.
texts.en:
Carmen Cecilia C. M. has a local store and works from 7am to 6pm. This business sustains the family's needs. She has spent 15 years working in this business. This loan that she is asking for is to increase her stock and her investment plan is to purchase basic food products, alcohol and candy.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic food products, alcohol and candy

loans.name: Rwakahurwa Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
B. Peninah, is shown in the small photo and she also appears in the big group photo. She is the leader of her lending group in Rukungiri. She is 42 years old and a widow with five children, with only one in vocational training while the others finished secondary level.

Peninah has been involved in poultry farming in Rwakahurwa village for over two years and one of her biggest challenges is the lack of funds to restock more birds and buy more feed. She keeps the chickens for local consumption and she is able to make 63,000/= as weekly profits.

Peninah has a dream of breeding more birds for commercial farming as well as having a family that is respected in the village. She needs a loan to be able to buy more feed for her farm.

loans.use: To buy more feed for her chickens

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Mrs. S., 43, is a seller. She sells desserts and fruit to people who are her nearby villagers, in the capital of Phnom Penh. She has been engaged in her business since 2005. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. One of her daughters is now married and works in the garment industry. In addition to her current business, her husband farms crops, which he will sell when they are mature. Mrs. S. will be using her first loan to increase the financial capital of her business. She will use any remaining money from the loan to decorate her shop in order to attract her customers. (Mrs. S.'s husband is in the photo).

loans.use: To increase the financial capital of her business.

loans.name: Mr. Art Om Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-two people who live in Srae Ampil Village in Kandal Province are part of a village bank loan. Mr. Art O. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. He and his wife are farmers who own one hectare of land to cultivate rice for supporting their family. As rice farmers, they have a problem because their field is ready for farming, but they did not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mr. Art O. decided to ask for a loan to do farming this year. Through this activity, this couple supports two children, one of whO. is a laborE., while the othE. is a farmE..

loans.use: To do farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dried bush meat.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina T. is from the village of New Campostela, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 53 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling coconut shell charcoal in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2009, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase more coconut shells and working capital. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Cristina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Ihuriro Women's Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
Very hardworking M. Jowelia has been operating a produce-sales business from Ihuriro cell, Ntungamo, for a period of nine years. Looking back, this happily married mother of six children recalls how her business flourished at the start.

Times have changed, however, as the business now is showing diminishing returns due to hard financial times. Jowelia now makes 120,000 Ugandan shillings in a month. This is in contrast to what she was making at the beginning.

There is always a story associated with people in western Uganda who, despite laboring under such tough times, find a way of educating their children. Jowelia is no exception to this. She has not given up despite this and it’s partly the reason why she is still in business.

What Jowelia is looking forward to now is the prospect of enhancing her business by buying more maize, beans, rice, millet, cassava and other crops with the assistance of this loan. This will help improve her revenue and also put her in a better position to pay her children’s school dues in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for resale

loans.name: Gregoria Maria

texts.en:
Gregoria Maria has her own tailoring business “Marina Confecciones Cárdenas” which she has run for the past 30 years. As a divorced woman raising three children, having her own business has given her the income and flexibility she needed to be be sole bread-winner and care-giver for her family.

Through FMSD's collaboration, Gregoria Maria has had the honor of participating in numerous design fairs and other special events including Colombia Tex in Medellin, Niña World International competition in Colombia, and in other beauty and talent contests where her designs have adorned prize winning candidates. Gregoria also won FMSD's prize for excellence in 2004, being named Woman Entrepreneur of the Year. 

Through FMSD Gregoria Maria also participated in a mission to Europe where she attended training sessions to learn new design techniques and meet other Colombians involved in the textiles industry. Those connections have paid dividends, leading to some recent contracts with some of the nicest hotels in Barranquilla to make table cloths and upholster chairs as well uniforms for employees at special events.

Through her efforts, Gregoria has greatly improved her family's quality of life. She's a woman who doesn't rest easily.  In addition to her business, she works several nights a week as a guard at a local school (soon she'll be able to retire and collect a pension).  

She wants to continue generating employment opportunities for others through her business, and for that reason she has acquired 12 sewing machines and also subcontracted to others when she receives large contracts. 

Her greatest dream is to start exporting her work to other countries, though the barriers and start up costs are great.  Gregoria Maria would especially like to send her work to Europe.  Her personal philosophy is to not be bothered by problems and complications, because she knows she can overcome anything.  From time to time she's had to confront clients as well as sub-contractors who didn't deliver, but she's always risen above.

Gregoria Maria is a positive woman who is working hard to grow her business, a business that has enabled her to put two children through college,  buy her own home, get a car, and employ several women.  She's asked for this loan from Kiva through FMSD to help pay for her youngest son's university studies. 


[EN ESPANOL]

Gregoria Cárdenas, propietaria de “Marina Confecciones Cárdenas” tiene este negocio, desde que decidió mejorar su calidad de vida hace ya 30 años, cuando sola con la responsabilidad de sus 3 hijos, emprendió la hoy microempresa dedicada a fabricar prendas de vestir en todas las  líneas  conocidas, porque conoce muy bien su arte y gradualmente lo ha perfeccionada con el tiempo y de la mano de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, quien la ha impulsado aprovechando su gran potencial de crecimiento como persona, como mujer y como empresaria. Gracias a este apoyo ha participado en ferias importantes de la confección, como en Colombia Tex en Medellín, en el certamen niña Word de Colombia, y en jornadas de belleza y talento donde ha ganado premios. Gregoria cuenta, como al mismo tiempo que la Fundación ganó el premio a la excelencia, ella en ese mismo año también le otorgaron el premio a la mujer empresaria del año 2004 y también como, a través de esta organización participo  en la Misión a Europa, donde mediante jornadas formativas aprendió nuevas técnicas y la actualización de diseños y consiguió muchas amistades del mismo sector de la confección en Colombia, lo que  la ha  llevado a obtener contratos en los hoteles mas importantes de Barranquilla, a quienes hoy en día les confecciona los manteles, viste también las sillas de las mesas y eventos importantes y fabrica la ropa de sus empleados. 
Gregoria Marina con grandes esfuerzos de trabajo ha sacado a su familia adelante,  porque es una mujer que no se queda quieta, pues así como tiene su negocio de confecciones, también trabaja en la noche en un colegio como secretaria,  donde está próxima a recibir su pensión por jubilación.  Su deseo siempre es generar empleo por eso además de poner a funcionar sus 12 maquinas de confección, también trabaja mediante talleres satélites cuando consigue los buenos contratos de los que siempre esta en su búsqueda. Ahora sueña con exportar, pero le parecen muy dispendioso los requisitos y costos para hacerlo le gustaría que fuera a Europa  porque ganaría en euros,  En su filosofía no  plantea  el termino problemas, porque siempre logra lo que quiere, pero cree que lo mas difícil es  cuando los clientes no pagan a tiempo y ella necesita responder a sus operarias y a la producción. De todas maneras es una mujer feliz porque sus hijos son profesionales y el último está en la universidad, siendo justamente la solicitud  de crédito que hace a la Fundación para pagarle su semestre. Gregoria Marina se manifiesta como una mujer prospera y exitosa, que con su esfuerzo   tiene una casa que ha adecuado como ha querido, un carro nuevo para transportarse, un importante taller de confección  que produce y genera empleo  y una maravillosa familia que también avanza con pasos firmes.

loans.use: Pay for son's university studies.

loans.name: Altimie

texts.en:
Altimie M. is from the village of Poblacion, Valencia City. She is 31 years old. Altimie is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Altimie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing a motorsikad services and her husband as the driver to local community members. Altimie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Altimie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Altimie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Altimie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Altimie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Thlong

texts.en: Mrs. Thlong Y. is a professional rice farmer who has spent her entire life cultivating crops on her own land, a skill she learned from her grandparent. She also harvests the crops for the dual propose of eating and selling. Thlong Y. is now married and has five children. Three of the children are already married and live independently. The other two are single. Her husband frequently works in the fields along side her. Growing rice is an annual operation with which she has had great success for several years. Thlong Y. hopes to plant the next rice crop since the farming season is coming, but she doesn’t have capital to use on her farm. So, she decided to borrow a loan from Kiva to buy farm supplies in order to grow rice.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies in order to grow rice

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel A. de 47 años tiene una larga trayectoria como costurera, hace 25 años cuando inició, trabajaba sola en una máquina de coser cacera; hoy en día tiene 3 trabajadores en máquinas industriales, además de la que ella misma usa y recibe pedidos para la fabricación al por mayor de uniformes escolares, deportivos y hasta folklóricos por parte de los ballets más famosos de Nicaragua. Su sueño es poder algún día convertir su fábrica de ropa en una gran empresa de la industria de las confecciones.
texts.en:
María Isabel A., 47, has a great career as a seamstress. When she began 25 years ago she worked alone with a domestic sewing machine; today she has 3 employees who work with industrial sewing machines. María herself also receives orders to make large quantities of school uniforms, sports uniforms and folklore outfits for the some of the most famous ballets in Nicaragua. Her dream is to be able to one day convert her clothes factory into a large company in the dress-making industry.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase materials

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Christine has had a business selling charcoal for four years.  Christine generates additional income through her side business roasting maize.  

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more bags of charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Christine hopes to buy an airplane, own a car and a house.  Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by socializing with other young women and reading books. 


Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Yesica Lorena

texts.es:
Yesica es conviviente y tiene 2 hijo que estudian, Yesica vende ropa variada a pedido, tiene clientes a quienes ofrece sus productos, la ropa lo compra en la ciudad de Lima de almacenes grandes, la mayor parte de sus ventas son al crédito. Además Yesica vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Yesica es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de polos, casacas.
Los sueños de Yesica son tener una tienda y tener casa propia pues vive en casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Yesica is in a common-law marriage and has two children in school. She sells a variety of clothing upon request and has customers to whom she offers her products. Yesica buys the clothing at large department stores in the city of Lima. Most of her sales are made on credit. In addition, she sells cosmetics through catalogs.

Yesica is a member of the Communal Bank “Cielo” (Heaven) and requests a loan of 2000 PEN to buy polo shirts and jackets. She dreams of having a store and owning a home since she lives at the house of her in-laws.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase polo shirts & jackets

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda D. is from the village of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests coconut for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and beer and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and bags of charcoal to sell.  Rose is 25 years old and her husband is in the military. She has no children yet.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer and bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: La Cabañita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "La cabañita", decidieron ponerle este nombre por que se reúnen en la cabañita que tiene la representante del grupo en su casa, es por eso que eligieron este nombre, esta historia es acerca de la señora Natividad G. G., ya que es la representante de dicho grupo, tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Porfirio con el cual tiene 2 hijos José Alberto y Karen Arlet, de los cuales los dos están estudiando la primaria, uno sexto y la otra cuarto año, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva apenas de 4 años.

Ella eligió esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos económicos y la educación de sus hijos y para mejor su calidad de vida aparte de que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, es por eso que decidió empezar con este negocio, con el préstamo que recibió va a continuar invirtiendo en se tienda en la compra de mas mercancía como son: sal, azúcar, arroz, fríjol, sopas, refrescos, aguas, jugos, huevos, aceite, jabón, papel higiénico, veladoras y muchos otros productos que le hacen falta para tener mas variedad y tener muy bien surtida su tienda..

Su negocio le esta sirviendo de mucho, ya que de las ganancias obtenidas, esta sacando para continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios e ir mejorando cada vez mas su calidad de vida, además de que esta ahorrando para comprarles una computadora a sus hijos para que hagan sus tareas. 

Doña Nati dice que su meta  es la de hacer que su negocio crezca empresarialmente, ya que quiere construir un local más grande, por que lo que quiere es hacerlo crecer mucho mas para convertirlo en una abarroteria y de esta forma tenerlo muy bien surtido y así obtener más y mejores ganancias, también esta pensando en poner una farmacia ya que en su comunidad no hay ningún negocio de estos.  

Ella dice que conoce muy bien a sus compañeros y nos comenta que son personas muy responsables, gente trabajadora, confiable que tienen ganas de salir adelante y superarse y por lo mismo en ninguna ocasión se han atrasado o fallado con los pagos de su crédito

Da las gracias a los prestatarios de kiva, por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella, puesto que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener un mejor futuro.

Los integrantes del grupo de la cabañita y las actividades que realizan son:
Isabel L. M.-venta de frutas y verduras
Honorina V. V.-venta de frutas y verduras
Leticia M. R.-venta de frutas y verduras
Jeammy G. R.-venta de refrescos
Elvis S. G.-venta de frutas y verduras
Natividad G. G.-tienda de abarrotes
Maria Félix G. M.-venta de dulces
Yurivia G. L.-venta de dulces
Hortensia M. ZaM.-venta de pollos
Elena V. M.-tienda de abarrotes
Adelina G. O.-venta de frutas y verduras
Crisanta R. B.-venta de frutas y verduras
Carmela A. M.-venta de frutas y verduras
Adelina G. O.-venta de perfumes
Cipriana R. M.-venta de dulces
Carmen B. R.-venta de frutas y verduras
***La señora sentada de blusa color amarillo con una niña en brazos, no forma parte del grupo****
texts.en:
This group is called “The Little Cabin”.  They decided to give it this name because they meet in a small cabin at the group representative’s house.  This story is about Ms. Natividad G. G., since she is the representative of the group.

She is 37 years old, married to Porfirio, with whom she has 2 children: José Alberto and Karen Arlet.  Both children are in primary school, one in sixth grade and the other in fourth grade.  She has had a grocery store for 4 years.

She chose this activity because she had to find a way to help her husband with the household expenses and their children’s education.  She also wanted to improve their standard of living and, the fact that the business is a good income producer, is the reason she decided on this type of enterprise.  

She plans to use the loan she received to continue investing in her store.  She would like to purchase additional merchandise such as: salt, sugar, rice, beans, soups, beverages, waters, juices, eggs, oil, soap, toilet paper, candles, and many other products that she’s missing, in order to have a good variety of merchandise and a well-supplied store.

Her business is serving her well, as her earnings allow her to support her children in their studies as well as to improve their quality of life.  In addition, she is saving to buy a computer for her children so they can use it to do their homework. 

Nati states that her goal is to expand her business, and she would like to build a larger locale in order to grow much more and convert it into a store that is well-stocked and generates more income for her.  She is also thinking about installing a pharmacy, as there are none in her community.

She states that she knows her associates very well, and comments that they are very responsible, hard-working and trustworthy people who have a great desire to get ahead and succeed.  Likewise, at no point have they defaulted or been late with their loan payments.

She gives thanks to the lenders on Kiva, for giving her this opportunity and their trust but most of all, for believing in her.  Thanks to their help, she can invest in her business and look forward to a brighter future.  

The members of the group and the activities they carry out are:

Isabel L. M. – Fruits and vegetable sales
Honorina V. V. – Fruits and vegetable sales
Leticia M. R. – Fruits and vegetable sales
Jeammy G. R. – Beverage sales 
Elvis S. G. - Fruits and vegetable sales
Natividad G. G. – Grocery store 
Maria Félix G. M. – Candy sales 
Yurivia G. L. – Candy sales 
Hortensia M. ZaM. – Poultry sales 
Elena V. M. – Grocery store 
Adelina G. O. - Fruits and vegetable sales
Crisanta R. B. - Fruits and vegetable sales
Carmela A. M. - Fruits and vegetable sales
Adelina G. O. – Perfume sales 
Cipriana R. M. – Candy sales 
Carmen B. R. - Fruits and vegetable sales

***The woman in the yellow blouse, seated and holding a little girl, is not part of the group****


Da las gracias a los prestatarios de kiva, por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella, puesto que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener un mejor futuro.

Los integrantes del grupo de la cabañita y las actividades que realizan son:
Isabel L. M.-venta de frutas y verduras
Honorina V. V.-venta de frutas y verduras
Leticia M. R.-venta de frutas y verduras
Jeammy G. R.-venta de refrescos
Elvis S. G.-venta de frutas y verduras
Natividad G. G.-tienda de abarrotes
Maria Félix G. M.-venta de dulces
Yurivia G. L.-venta de dulces
Hortensia M. ZaM.-venta de pollos
Elena V. M.-tienda de abarrotes
Adelina G. O.-venta de frutas y verduras
Crisanta R. B.-venta de frutas y verduras
Carmela A. M.-venta de frutas y verduras
Adelina G. O.-venta de perfumes
Cipriana R. M.-venta de dulces
Carmen B. R.-venta de frutas y verduras
***La señora sentada de blusa color amarillo con una niña en brazos, no forma parte del grupo****

loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise such as:  milk, rice, beans, cookies, oil, beverages, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Blanca O. de Rodríguez tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada desde hace tiempo con el señor Salustiano Rodríguez, tienen hijos pequeños que dependen aun económicamente de ellos. Viven en su propia casa situada en Barrio Santa Miguel Cambyreta.

La señora Blanca y el señor Salustiano poseen en su domicilio una amplia despensa desde hace bastante tiempo, la misma es atendida contantemente por uno de ellos. Además de esta actividad la señora Blanca es docente y se dedica a la enseñanza particular desde su casa. Gracias a esta actividad ellos pueden mantener su hogar y solventar todos los gastos e imprevistos que se les presente.

Ellos han solicitado este crédito para la compra de más mercaderías para la temporada de fin de año, especialmente bebidas como vinos, sidras, gaseosa, y otras como carne, frutas, verduras, azúcar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca O. de Rodriguez is 36 years old, and has been married for some time to Mr. Salustiano Rodriguez. They have young children who are still economically dependent on them. They live in their own house in Barrio Santa Miguel Cambyreta.

Blanca and Salustiano have been operating a grocery store in their home for quite some time, and one of them is always in attendance. In addition to this activity, Blanca is a teacher and gives private tutoring at her home. Thanks to these activities they can maintain their home and handle all expenses and contingencies that may occur.

They have requested this loan to buy more merchandise for the year-end season, especially beverages such as wine, cider, soft drinks, and others such as meat, fruit, vegetables and sugar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as wine, cider, soft drinks, vegetables, fruit, meat, pasta, sugar and others.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

She operates a business selling natural fresh juices. In addition, she has been selling handbags and fresh water from home for over two years, which adds to her other source of income. Her major customers are neighbors and passersby. Halima faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase a water tank for selling fresh water. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business and her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank for selling fresh water.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is doing commercial agriculture, which he has done for the last six years. However, he faces a problem of price fluctuations. He would like a loan to purchase land. 

Charle's ambitions are to invest in modern farming, build a permanent house and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land

loans.name: Kibaale Traders Sacco Group

texts.en: K. Yusufu, in the pink shirt, is the leader of Kibaale Traders savings and credit group in Mubende. He is 45 years old and married with 8 children. He has a retail store and is also a farmer in Kibaale LC 1. He is a very honest and loyal man for the 25 years that he has been in business. Farming was his first business and then he turned to retail as well. Now he needs a loan to buy general merchandise for his shop. As a result of taking loans, he has been able to buy a plot of land and a few cows. He hopes to increase the number of cows that he keeps.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more merchandise.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana does sewing for her neighboring clients to help her family financially. She started this business a few years ago because her husband’s earning was not enough to fulfill the basic needs of the family.

Her husband is a tailor master. He is an expert in sewing men’s clothes and operates his tailoring shop in the nearby market.

Rukhsana is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her elder son works in a factory for a low income while her elder daughter operates her beauty parlor at home. Her remaining children are getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in expanding his tailoring business. With the loan, he will buy a new sewing machine and will hire a worker, which will help him completing his orders on time and earn extra income. She is a new loan user of Asasah. She is hopeful that an investment will make her husband’s business more profitable.

She is the resident of a city named Gujranwala which is a mid-sized city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its rice industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for more than 24 years.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for tailoring business

loans.name: Carla Creisayda

texts.es:
Carla es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza, tiene 20 años y es soltera. Carla es feriante viaja a las ferias de Niño Bamba los días viernes, los sábados a la feria de Paccha y los domingos a la feria de Huamanguilla. Carla antes vendía helados en las ferias y decidió vender especerías porque es mas rentable, está en Finca desde hace mas de un año, le gusta por la capacitaciones que recibe, le enseñan a como trabajar, a conocer sus derechos, le dan créditos puede ahorrar y sus ahorros ganan intereses. 
Carla solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en surtir su mercadería como: canela, orégano, clavo, detergentes, jabones, etc.
El sueño de Carla es poder tener una bodega en su casa y ya no viajar a las ferias, terminar sus estudios de computación y poder seguir sus estudios universitarios de contabilidad.
texts.en:
Carla is a member of the communal bank named Granito de Mostaza (meaning Little Grain of Mustard). She is 20 years old and she is single. Carla is a merchant who travels to the various fairs in Nino Bamba on Fridays. On Saturdays she travels to the fair in Paccha and on Sundays to the fair in Huamanguilla. Carla used to sell icecreams at the fairs but she decided to sell spices instead because it was more profitable. She has been a member of this group for more than a year and she enjoys taking part for the training she receives. She can learn how to manage their businesses, to know their rights, and they are granted loans and given the ability to save money. Their savings earn interest. 

Carla requuests a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as: cinnamon, oregano, cloves, detergents, soaps, etc. 

Carla's dream is to set up a convenience store in her house so that she will no longer need to travel to the fairs. She dreams of completing her studies in computers and to keep up her university studies in accounting.

loans.use: To purchase spices and soaps.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 42-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: pig fattening, general store and food vending. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her pig fattening, general store and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20000. Josephine is borrowing PHP 29500 so that she can fund operations of her business ventures. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Josephine aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corn to make food for sale

loans.name: Teobalda

texts.es: Teobalda, de 25 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo César de 28 años y de sus dos pequeños hijos. Desde hace cinco años, esta emprendedora mujer instaló su tienda de comestibles en una pieza de su casa. Dice que empezó con este negocio pues su esposo no quería que descuide a sus hijos y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien pues por donde vive no tiene competencia cercana y sus vecinos le compran sus productos durante todo el día, pues ella atiende desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Además paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca y  en su misma tienda instaló una pequeña vitrina donde ofrece sus productos a sus compradores y de vez en cuando ellos se animan a pedirle algún producto pues los ofrece a crédito. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar aún más su negocio ya que quiere mejorar  sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Teobalda tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una vitrina exhibidora para que sus clientes observen la variedad de sus productos; además desea comprar algo de mercadería para surtir mejor su tienda.
texts.en: Teobalda, 25 years old, lives in her own house with her husband Cesar, 28 years old, and her two young children.  Five years ago, this entrepreneurial woman installed a grocery store in part of her house.  She says she started this business since her husband did not want her to neglect the children. Since then it has gone very well for her, since where she lives there is no competition nearby, and her neighbors buy her products all day long, since she is open from 9am to 9pm.  At the same time, she also sells beauty products from a well-known brand.  She put a small display case in her store where she offers her products to her customers, and sometimes when they ask her for a product, she gives it to them on credit.  Since she is an entrepreneurial woman, for the future she plans to expand her business even more, since she wants to increase her earnings.  This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to pay on schedule, since she does not want the people who made possible the money that will allow her to continue working in search of progress to think badly of her.  Teobalda plans to use the loan to purchase a display case so her customers can see the variety of her products. She also wants to buy some merchandise to better supply her store.

loans.use: to buy a display case

loans.name: Batrentsen

texts.en:
Batrentsen, 34, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. They have a decent standard of living. His wife is self-employed and his older daughter attends a local primary school. 

Batrentsen began selling consumer goods in 2006. He purchases clothing from China and sells from a rented stall at the market. He began his business with working capital of 1,000,000 MNT and his current working capital exceeds 3,700,000 MNT. Now he operates two stalls. He has been one of our reliable customers since 2007. Batrentsen is a hardworking and honest person. He is requesting a loan of 3,600,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for his business .

loans.use: to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Hanan

texts.ar: حنان عمرها 52 سنة متزوحة ولها ولد تعمل في محل لبيع الادوات المنزلية والاكسسوار لها في عملها 7 سنوات تحب عملها وتستطيع من خلاله ان تعيل عائلته زوجها وولدها تريد دائما تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي لها ولعائلتها فهي تسعى الى تكبير عملها وتطويره حتى يصبح باستطاعتها تعليم ابنها بافضل الاماكن هي طموحة محبة للحياة والعمل تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل وتقوية المصلحة وهي تتميز بالمحيط بالانفراد في عملها والتمييز بالبضاعة لها احلام كثيرة تتمنى ان تتحق من خلال تقوية عملها
texts.en: Hanan is 52 years old and married with a son. She works in a shop selling household goods and accessories and has 7 years experience in this. She loves her work. It allows her to support her husband and son and she is constantly seeking ways to improve her family's financial and social situation as well as her own. She aspires to expand and develop her business so that she can support her son's education. Hanan is ambitious and loves life and work. With this loan she wants to purchase new stock for her shop. Her business and stock is unique in her locality and she has many dreams that she hopes to realise through the strengthening of her business.

loans.use: to purchase new stock for her household goods shop.

loans.name: Andry Paola

texts.es:
Andry Paola a sus 19 años es una joven emprendedora e independiente que habita y es propietaria de un peluquería ubicada  en la ciudadela 20 de Julio, barrio muy alegre y popular donde interactúan escenarios recreativos,   residenciales y productivos, en los cuales trabajan en un ambiente formal e informal  sus habitantes y los de sus alrededores.  Andry  tiene como negocio el mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional de hombres, mujeres, jóvenes, adultos,  niñas y niños,  mediante la oferta de sus   servicios de corte de cabello, manicure, pedicure, peinados y maquillaje,  además de vender productos de belleza, a partir de los cuales ofrece su conocimiento mediante asesorías en la aplicación de cada producto,  adaptado al perfil y las características de su clientela.
Este negocio lo inició desde el año 2009 cuando trabajaba con su mamá en un horario de 10 horas de lunes a jueves,  y de 12 horas de viernes a domingos; Andry es una joven muy trabajadora que aunque maneja una competencia muy fuerte, su alegría, juventud y capacidad de servicio, acompañado de precios justos y un espacio locativo confortable,  siempre han sido su estrategia para captar clientes rentables. 
Su sueño es terminar la carrera de cosmetología y estética,  para perfeccionar su oficio y diversificar su oferta.  Mientras esto ocurre Andry continua trabajando persistentemente y con un capital de trabajo aún insuficiente,  para adquirir productos de belleza en volumen y rotarlos rápidamente; esta es justamente la necesidad que tiene de  aplicar a su primer  financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues con una parte del dinero quiere ganar descuentos por compra un mayor volumen de productos de belleza  y abrir ampliamente su oferta y con la otra parte hacer adecuaciones locativas.
texts.en:
Andry Paola, age 19, is a young, independent entrepreneur who owns a beauty salon in the "20 de Julio" neighborhood, where she lives.  It is a cheerful neighborhood, with recreational, residential and manufacturing areas bringing its inhabitants together in a formal and informal environment.  Andry's business is personal and professional style consulting for men, women, youth, adults, and children.  She offers services such as hair cuts, manicure, pedicure, hairstyling and makeup.  She also sells beauty products and offers advice on how to use the products depending on each customer's characteristics.

She established her business in 2009 when she was working with her mother for 10 hours on Monday through Thursday, and 12 hours on Friday and Sunday.  Andry is a very hard worker who, despite being up against tough competition, has been able to capture good customers through her strategy of being cheerful, young and service oriented.

Her dream is to finish her cosmetology and estheticienne degree so she can improve her skill and diversify her services.  Meanwhile, Andry continues to work constantly to acquire beauty products in larger volumes to increase turnover, although her working capital is insufficient for now.  For this reason she applied for a loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She plans to use part of the money to buy larger volumes of products for the huge discounts.  She'll use the rest of the loan to make improvements in her salon.

loans.use: To buy a larger volume of beauty products

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
el joven Javier E. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el barrio el Estruendo de la ciudad de Choluteca y tiene un taller de carpinteria, Javier distribuye sus productos en diferentes casa comerciales de la ciudad de
Choluteca, asi tambien a muchas personas particulares, tiene muchos clientes ya que los diseños y acabados son de muy buena calidad. Javier todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para empezar a trabajar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de sus muebles.
su meta es formar una bonita familia.
texts.en:
The young Javier E. is 23 years old and lives in the neighborhood of El Estruendo in the city of Choluteca. He has a carpentry workshop and distributes his products in different stores in Choluteca as well as to many individuals. He has many customers since his designs and finished products are of very good quality. Javier gets up very early every day to start work.

The loan will be used to buy materials to make furniture. His goal is to create a beautiful family.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue, mirrors, latchkeys, bolts, varnish and paint

loans.name: Andres Jose

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 44  años de edad,  es un padre de familia que vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, en una comunidad pequeña pero con deseos de superarse.

Andrés desde hace 3 años cuenta con una bodega en el interior de su domicilio. Esta bodega es una de las más surtidas de la zona y por ello tiene gran demanda. 

Andrés se siente satisfecho con su actividad y por ello invierte en ella ya que esto le trae mayores ganancias. Andrés vende toda clase de abarrotes (arroz, harina, azúcar, leche, huevos,  aceite, etc.) así como productos de higiene personal (papel higiénico, pañales, shampoo, etc.) y golosinas.

Andrés solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para la compra de abarrotes para su tienda. Esto le permitirá seguir desarrollando su negocio satisfactoriamente. 

Andrés tiene buenas referencias personales y se le conoce por ser un hombre trabajador y devoto a su familia.
texts.en:
Andres is 44 years old. He is the father of a family and he lives together with his wife and their two children in the rural district of Lambayeque in a small community. But he has dreams of improvement.

Andres has had a grocery store in his house for the past 3 years. This grocery store is has one of the best selections in the region which is why it is in such high demand. 

Andres is satisfied with his activity and for this reason he invests in it to bring in greater earnings. Andres sells all types of groceries (rice, flour, sugar, milk, eggs, cooking oil, etc.) as well as person hygiene products (bathroom tissue, diapers, shampoo, etc.) and snacks.

Andres requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to use in the purchase of grocery products for his store. This will permit him to keep developing his business with satisfaction.

Andres has good personal references and he is known to be a hardworking man who is devoted to his family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for his store.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea, a local farmer, is a low-income person in Siem Reap Province where he plants crops on his own farm. He has five years' experience in the farming business. Besides this, he often burns firewood in a coal oven to produce charcoal for selling. From these occupations, he can make an average of US$5 a day which is used to pay expenses. His wife assists him in the same business and they currently live with six single children. Because of deficient money, Chea is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase seed potatoes for planting as it is the good season, the rainy season, for all kinds of crops to be planted.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes for planting.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 27-year old single woman and has been the owner of a clothing shop since 2007. She started her business to make a good source for living and to have a good career to develop. She worked hard to improve and succeed, and with the help of Al Majmoua and her family's and friends' support, she has succeeded and is working hard on her continuity.

She has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles. Her previous loan helped a lot in achieving part of her goals, and now she's requesting another loan in order to increase her summer season collection. Most of her customers are relatives, friends and passersby. She stated that through the new collection's income, she'll be able to increase her autumn/winter collection.

Zeinab is working hard on expanding her business, and she's willing to open a bigger shop with men's, women's and children's wear.

loans.use: to increase her summer collection.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is 40 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena. She is married with 5 children.  To earn a living, Paulina has a fish selling business. She earns about PHP 4000 each month doing this type of work. Paulina has a requested a loan for 20,000 to purchase housing materials.  Paulina has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials

loans.name: Ma.elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, 46, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, a mechanic, and father to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Elena is a mineral water distributor. What she basically does is bU. mineral water in containers from wholesalers, sells them per container (5 gallons per container) with a profit. She also earns additional income by selling personal products like Avon, Natasha and other direct-sell products to her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to bU. more stocks of mineral water and other merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elena dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional mineral water containers and other personal products she needs in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a little cart to sell tacos.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La Sra. Sandra es  una persona  muy trabajadora,  ella  actualmente   tiene  una tienda de abarrotes  en su domicilio la cual atiende  personalmente   y  le permite   sacar  adelante  día  con día a  su  familia, ella  se  preocupa  por  ofertarles  a sus  clientes  un excelente  servicio  así como  también una  gran  variedad de  productos,  es  por  ello  que  ella  necesita  realizar  la  compra  de mercancía para   contar   con inventario  suficiente  para  ofrecer  a  sus  clientes, ve  en el  crédito la  posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio , además  de  atraer  a  un mayor  numero de  clientes los  cuales  le permitirán   generar  mayores  ingresos, agradece  el  apoyo    brindado para  la  realización de   su proyecto.
texts.en: Sandra is a very hardworking person. She has a small grocery store in her home that she runs personally. It allows her to get her family ahead day by day. She is concerned with giving her customers excellent service as well as a variety of products. That is why she needs to buy merchandise to have enough inventory to offer her customers. She sees in the loan the possibility of growing her business, as well as attracting more customers which will allow her to generate more income. SHe is grateful for the support offered for this project.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Armeda

texts.en:
Armeda is 72 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Armeda has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for 42 years. She requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy green bananas & coconuts to sell.

Armeda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Armeda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green bananas & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Lidia Estebana

texts.es:
Lidia, administra un molino y venta D. granos básicos y artículos D. primera necesidad, ella vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella administra el negocio que le ha permitido tener ingresos para la familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. frijoles, arroz, café, azúcar, para el negocio, también comprara abono para los cultivos D. su esposo, el préstamo le ayudara para estabilizar la tienda y además para poder cuidar del cultivo.
La aspiración D. Lidia es tener buenas referencias D. este préstamo, que le permita tener acceso a más para poder apoyarse y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Lidia manages a mill, and sale of basic grains and goods.  She lives with her husband and a son.  She handles the business, which has allowed her to have income for the family.
She is currently requesting a loan to purchase beans, rice, coffee, sugar, and for her business she will also buy fertilizer for her husband’s crops.  The loan will help her set up the store, and also to take care of crops.
Lidia aspires to have good references with this loan, which will give her access to more, so as to have support and expand financially.

loans.use: buy beans, rice, coffee, sugar.

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en:
Sherlyn, age 29, raises pigs to earn a living. She is a high school graduate, but she was not able to enter college due to the poverty of her parents. She and her husband have three small children. None of them are yet studying, but Sherlyn is driven to work hard so as to be able to support their education. She is determined to provide for them to be educated beyond the high school level.

Since she wants to save for her children, she is asking for additional working capital amounting to PhP 5,000 in order to buy piglets and feed. She is confident that this will allow her to earn a higher profit during the selling season and set more funds aside for future use. 

Sherlyn's children are her inspiration and her motivation for working hard. She is determined to uplift the family's living conditions and to provide herself and her children with a better life.

loans.use: to buy pigletS and feed

loans.name: Denis Ignacio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica Departamento de León el señor Denis , se dedica arduamente a la labor Agrícola desde hace 15 años, es casado no tiene hijos. Son solo él y su esposa con la que trabaja para tener mejores condiciones  necesarias para desarrollarse.

Una de las necesidades que el señor Denis atraviesa hoy en día es de financiamiento para compra de  insumos como urea  y gradeo para poder sembrar y ejercer su actividad, ya que es la manera de trabajo propio, por eso tomó la decisión acertada de visitar la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de lo antes mencionado ya que del resultado de la cosecha brindará mejores condiciones a su esposa y su hogar mismo.

Cabe mencionar que debido a esta actividad le proporcionara condiciones necesarias al desarrollo del hogar.
texts.en:
In the town of Telica, in the department of León, Denis has worked arduously at agriculture for fifteen years. He is married and has no children, only he and his wife with whom he works to have improved conditions necessary for development. 

One of the necessities that Dennis is going through today is financing in order to buy supplies such as Urea and harrowing to be able to sow and practice his trade, which is how he makes a living. That is why he made the fitting decision to visit Ceprodel's offices to ask for a loan to buy the previously mentioned items. As a result, the harvest will bring about better conditions for his wife and their home. There is room to mention that owing to this activity he will be provided with necessary conditions to develop his home.

loans.use: to buy urea and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
La señora es socia del banco comunal Las Triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, solo dos de ellos están a su cargo.
Lleva recién 4 ciclos trabajando con los  préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de comida en una de las calles del centro d la ciudad y lo hace desde el medio día, está cerca de una universidad y los alumnos son sus principales clientes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 fuentes de fierro enlozado,  2  cucharas para servir, 5 manteles  de tela, 1 balde refresquero, 3 banquitos de madera, 1.5 metros de mantel de plástico.
A pesar que tiene que salir de su casa para trabajar lo hace con mucho gusto porque es parte de su trabajo y le gusta lo que hace, gracias a ese negocio mantiene y educa a sus dos hijos, no cuenta con ayuda de nadie.
Por ahora se siente tranquila porque cuenta con la ayuda de Manuela Ramos para ir implementando su negocio y mejorar cada dia.
texts.en:
Aquilina is a member of the Las Triunfadoras comunal bank in the Calleria district, Ucayali department.  She is 48 years old and single.  She has four children; only two of them are under her care.  She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for four cycles.  She sells food on one of the streets in the center of the city.  She starts at noon.  It is close to a university, and the students are her primary customers.

She will use her new loan for 1,200 soles to buy three kettles, two serving spoons, five cloth tablecloths, one ice chest, three small wooden stools, and a plastic tablecloth measuring 1.5 meters.

In spite of the fact that she has to leave her house to work, she does so with great pleasure.  This is part of her work, and she likes what she does.  Thanks to this business she supports and educates her two children.  She does not have help from anyone.

At the present time she feels at peace because she has the help from Manuela Ramos to continue carrying out her business and improving every day.

loans.use: to buy kettles and other cooking utensils.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 44-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in the maize flour business for three years. She started with 200,000 shillings and now has 1,800,000 shillings. Her hardships are seasonal weather, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. Her personal goal is to educate her children. Her business goal is to diversify her businesses. Jackline needs the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 7 months to 13 years. She describes herself as humble and honest. She operates a shoe sales business, where she sells shoes to the local people. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a shopping center. 

Florence describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her inventory of shoes. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of shoes.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo's goal in life is to provide a progressive living for his family. He is 33 years old and he has been cultivating rice as a source of his income for almost five years. He goes down to the field every day to ensure good crops. Farming is quite difiicult as source of income, but Danilo is a patient man who sacrifices a lot for his family. He wants to improve his income because he usually pays PHP5,000 for tuition fees and allowances for his two children. 

Danilo aims to strengthen his business so he is asking for a loan of PHP18,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

In the future, Danilo would like to keep generating abundant harvests in his rice field and someday improve his living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Sapiyakhan

texts.ru: Сапияхан 58 лет, замужем, воспитала трех детей.   Муж работает таксистом. С 2008 года Сапияхан занимается откормом и перепродажей скота и полеводством. Упорный труд и настойчивость в делах позволили развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день семь дойных коров и двадцать баранов.  В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Сапияхан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительной скотины. Доходы от кредита Сапияхан планирует вложить в закуп стройматериалов для постройки дома.
texts.en: Sapiyakhan is 58 years old, married and raised three children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  Since 2008, Sapiyakhan has been involved in fattening up and reselling livestock and agriculture.  Hard work and persistence in business helped her grow her farm that now contains seven dairy cows and twenty sheep.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Sapiyakhan requested a loan in the sum of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional livestock.  Sapiyakhan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a purchase of construction materials to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
As a responsible father, Noel has been cultivating their farm lots by planting onions and other vegetables for sale. His wife is his only partner in managing their farm. Despite the hardships in farming, they tolerate them and pursue the business. They want to earn and save to support the education of their three children. They want the children to earn a degree so that they will find a good job someday. 

In this regard, Noel planned to expand his onion plantation to ensure a high yield. He is asking for an additional capital of PHP35,000 to buy the needed fertilizers and insecticides for the onion production. He believes that his patience and sacrifices will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy the needed fertilizers and insecticides for onion production.

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Vien's Group

texts.en:
Vien is 41-years-old with 2 children who are school age. Being a farmer, she grows rice, vegetable and also focuses on livestock raising. She's had this business for 5 years and the total income from this activity  is considerable. Being a client of our credit program, she is always in good repayment status. Currently, she   wants to have a loan of 4,256,000 Vietnam dong  to buy food for  pigs. She  hopes to  build a bio gas system
 

Bang is 44-years-old. She is is a boss for providing constructional service. She wants to borrow a  loan of 4,256,000  Vietnam dong to invest in buying more construtional tool that serve for her business

loans.use: to buy food for  pigs. She  hopes to  build a bio gas system.

loans.name: Anuar

texts.en:
Anuar is a 35-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. For the past year, she has had a business selling food from a stall in Bor, South Sudan.

Anuar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans

loans.name: Miguel Mariano

texts.es: Miguel con 53 años de edad es separado y padre de 3 hijos. Toda su vida fue criado en el campo, donde ha realizado actividades agropecuarias la myor parte de su vida.  Actualmente posee cultivos de manzanilla y complementa con la producción de leche, de varias vacas que son de su propiedad, tanto la cosecha de manzanilla, como los litros de leche que ordeña a diarios, son vendidos en el mercado de la región donde reside, así logra obtener los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Miguel es un hombre serio, responsable, comprometido con su familia y su trabajo, por ello siempre quiere seguir avanzando es busca de un futuro mejor, por esta razón solicita su primer ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas) con el fin de continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y poder sacar una cosecha en óptimas condiciones para poderla vender a un mejor precio en el mercado y obtener más ganancias; todo esto le ayudará a seguir adelante, mejorando poco a poco su nivel de vida y el de sus hijos, a los cuales les podrá ofrecer mejor educación para que tengan un futuro próspero y lleno de éxitos.
texts.en: Miguel is 53 years old.  He is separated and the father of three children.  All his life, he was raised in the country, where he spent most of his life farming.  Now, he has chamomile plants and complements this activity with milk production from various cows that he owns.  He sells both the chamomile harvest and the liters of milk that he milks daily in a regional market where he lives.  In this way, he is able to obtain enough resources to take home the daily sustenance.  Miguel is a serious, responsible man, committed to his family and his job.  For this reason, he always wants to continue moving forward and looking for a better future.  He is in his first loan cycle and is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs (manure, fertilizer, pesticides) with the goal of continuing with the care of his crops and being able to obtain a harvest in optimum conditions so that he can sell it at a better price at the market and earn higher profits.  All of this will help him continue moving ahead, gradually improving his standard of living and that of his children.  In addition, he will be able to offer his children a better education so that they will have a prosperous future filled with success.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs (manure, fertilizer, pesticides).

loans.name: Umatkul

texts.en: Umatkul is 52 years old. He is an entrepreneur from north Tajikistan. Umatkul is careful father of 3 children. His wife is lovely woman who always helps him with agricultural activity. Umatkul has been busy with growing agricultural products more than 20 years. Also he has animal husbandry business. Umatkul feeds cows. He has a big cowshed in his house. His wife and children help him with managing business. Umatkul grows feeds for cattle in his land. He is going to increase the number of cattle he feeds. He is asking for a loan of 6000 Somoni to buy cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Millicent wants to buy sacks of maize, sugar, packs of soaps, salt and breads

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: "Mama Augustina" is a 45-year-old woman with 7 children. She sells secondhand clothing and other items like towels, bed spreads, curtains etc. in her own shed in the market. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to enable her buy more bales of clothing.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothing

loans.name: Yaver

texts.en:
Yaver is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, Kurdmakhmudlu village. He is married and has a child.
He previously borrowed a loan of $400, bought a cow, and has run this business for 6 years.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 2 calves.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Celida

texts.en:
Celida E. C. and her husband Victor have eight children and 14 grandchildren. Her small grocery store, named "Colmado Anaceli” after her second daughter, sells food staples, household items and cooking ingredients to her neighborhood of La Pacuala in the northern peninsula of Samana. She would like this loan to continue to restock her store with rice, salt, sugar, filtered water packets, etc. She puts everything that she saves back into the store and she hopes to expand with this loan to increase profits and therefore savings to provide better for her family.

NOTE: Celida is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

loans.use: Celida would like to purchase rice, salt, sugar and filtered water packets for her store.

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en: "I started benefiting from LAPO loan in 1999," says Isoken A.. She is 37 years old and is the secretary of a LAPO union and she is from Benin City. She sells drinks to the community and is the married mother of three (3) children. She needs the loan to boost her business and buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks for sale

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: Mrs. Apolonia E. is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Asaba town in Delta State. She is married and has two children. She started her business in 1988. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more foodstuffs for her store. She has been with LAPO for five years as a leader of her union.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 45 years old, a widow with 5 children. She hails from Okoko town in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells bread to most of the shops in her community. She has been in this business since 1999.  She needs the loan to enable her to buy more bread for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bread

loans.name: Flora Cirila's Group

texts.es:
Flora, Margoth and Julia have belonged to the Alegria Huamanga Communal Bank since they were 4, 1, and 1 respectively. They mention that at their Communal Bank they learned the values of saving, how to prevent sicknesses and how to care for their children. Flora is married, she is 47 and has 5 children, she works at the fair and sells groceries and fruits. At the fairs she buys grains and processes them, converting them into hulled wheat and flour products that are sold in the Nery Garcia market, an activity that she began 30 years ago. On the other hand, Margoth is single and is 21. Margoth works as a waitress in a seafood restaurant and also helps her mother in her business of selling fruits. While Julia is married, she is 48 and has 7 children. Julia has sold vegetables traveling in the April 12 Market for 30 years and furthermore, together with her husband and children makes beautiful weavings on the loom, products they sell in the Santa Clara market and bring to Lima. Flora, Margoth and Julia need loans of 1000 soles, 400 soles, 400 soles, that they will invest in the purchase of broad beans, peas, barley, peach, banana, orange, apple, grape, rice, sugar, noodles, thread, wool, carrots, onion. Their savings they will utilize to increase their capital and settle the expenses of their children’s studies. The dreams of Flora, Margoth and Julia are to have a bigger business that their children will be professionals, finalize their studies and have their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.
