Flora, Margoth y Julia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga desD. hace 4, 1, 1 año respectivamente. Ellas mencionan que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron los valores, a ahorrar, a prevenir enfermedades y cómo cuidar a los hijos. Flora es casada, tiene 47 años y 5 hijos, y además es feriante y venD. abarrotes y frutas. En las ferias compra cereales y los procesa, convirtiéndolos en morón, trigo partido, harina, productos que son vendidos en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza desD. hace 30 años. Por otro lado Margoth es soltera y tiene 21 años. Margot trabaja como mesera en una cebichería y además ayuda a su mamá en su negocio D. venta D. frutas. Mientras que Julia es casada, tiene 48 años y 7 hijos. Julia venD. verduras en forma ambulatoria en el mercado 12 D. abril desD. hace 30 años y, además, junto a su esposo e hijos hacen bellos tejidos en telar como frazadas, pasadizos; productos que venD. en el mercado Santa Clara y lleva a Lima. Flora, Margoth y Julia necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 400 soles, 400 soles, que serán invertidos en la compra haba, arveja, papa, cebada, durazno, plátano, naranja, manzana, uva, arroz, azúcar, fideo, hilo, lana, zanahoria, cebolla. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para incrementar su capital y solventar los gastos D. estudio D. sus hijos. Los sueños D. Flora, Margoth y Julia son tener un negocio más granD., que sus hijos sean profesionales, finalizar sus estudios y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Flora, Margoth and Julia need loans of 1000 soles, 400 soles, 400 soles, that they will invest in the purchase of broad beans, peas, barley, peach, banana, orange, apple, grape, rice, sugar, noodles, thread, wool, carrots, onion.

loans.name: Ruon

texts.en: Mrs. Ruon S. N., 62, has four children and lives with her husband in Batambong province, Cambodia. She runs a stand at a local market where she earns about $3 a day selling food and groceries. She hopes to use this loan to expand the inventory of items she has to sell. (In the photograph, we see one of Mrs. Ruon S. N.'s daughters because she was unavailable when the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to sell from a food stall.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
For over 5 years, Richard, a resident of Mukono, has been buying charcoal and firewood from Masindi and selling them in Kampala. He is the same person who won the tender of supplying these fuel sources to Uganda Christian University in Mukono and this is the third year he is running the tender.

Richard is 39 years old and married with a two-year-old daughter, having lost his 10-year-old son last November. He also has one nephew in his care.

Before the loans, Richard could not run the tender whose payments are not instant as well as supplying Kampala but now business is smooth. His dream is to buy his own truck for transportation as well as to build a house on the plot he bought recently. At least most of the materials for construction are on his site. He is really thankful.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Madina Nabaka’S Group

texts.en:
Madina N., age 27, is the leader of this group. Madina is married with three children, ages3, 7, and 8. Two children are in school but at times she faces a challenge meeting their school fees.

Madina runs a small hotel in Nakulabye, a suburb outside of Kampala, where she also sells food. Her clients are mainly Boda-Boda cyclists, builders, and taxi drivers. Madina's main challenges in her hotel business are heavy rains that lead to the roof leaking, and too much demand for her services that she cannot fill, and limited capital. The loan will enable Madina to buy scholastic material for her children, pay hotel rent, provide a good diet for her family, and expand her business.

loans.use: Buy food to sell at the local hotel

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with 2 children, ages 12 and 7. Grace sells clothing, a business she started in 2002. Every day she works from 7 A.M. to 7 P.M., and she earns a monthly profit of about $300.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is 38 years old, is single, and has two school-aged children.

Graciela is a hard working women, and since she was very young, worked in domestic labor, raising her children alone and making great sacrifices. She has sold food for business events.

Five years ago she started a small business selling clothing, that has been growing thanks to the loan credits from the Foundation, and she is struggling so that her children finish their education.

Now Graciela is hoping for a loan to buy winter clothing that her clients have been requesting.

Translated by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Graciela tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, todos ellos en edad escolar.

La Sra. Graciela es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde muy joven trabajó como empleada domestica, crió a sus hijos sola y con mucho sacrificio,y tambien empezó a veneder cosas comestibles en las fiestas patronales.

Hace 5 años montó un pequeño negocio de venta de ropas que con el tiempo fue creciendo gracias a los creditos que le otorgó la Fundacion y esta luchando para que sus hijos concluyan el colegio pose casda propia.

En esta ocación ella desea un crédito para comprar ropas de temporada invierno que sus clientes ya le han solicitado.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheak T., 26, and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Phi, 27, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1999 and have two children, a son and a daughter, both of whom are in local school.

Mrs. Sopheak has been selling grocery items for four years. She buys them from the market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in front of the house. Bunthoeun is a construction worker who also also fishes and raises cows. Sopheak is requesting a loan of $500 to expand her grocery store and repair her kitchen.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store and repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen is a mother with noble wishes of overcoming adversity for the wellbeing of her children. As a result, in the mornings, she sells juices from a tricycle in one of her area's main streets. She began this business five years ago on the advice of a friend who dared her to take more risks and helped her locate an area in which to sell. This business allows Carmen to get the daily financial support that she needs. In the afternoons and evenings, she sells coffee and pancakes from her home. Her efforts help supplement her husband's salary. Carmen's dream is to have her own shop, and for this, she continues to work hard. Every weekend, she acquires fresh fruit to sell later as juice. Right now, she is requesting a loan which will be invested in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen es una madre con nobles deseos de superación en bienestar de sus hijos, por ello se dedica (por las mañanas) a la venta de jugos en un triciclo en una de las calles principales de su localidad. Inició este negocio hace 5 años, por del consejo de una amiga, quien la animó a ser arriesgada y le ayudó a ubicar la zona donde vender. Este negocio, le permite a Carmen, conseguir el sustento diario que necesita, por la tardes, y al anochecer ella vende en la puerta de su casa panqueques y cafés. Este esfuerzos lo realiza para complementar el sueldo de su esposo. El sueño de Carmen es tener su tienda, por ello se sigue esforzando, cada fin de semana adquiere fruta fresca para luego salir a vender sus jugos. Ahora solicita un préstamo que invertirá netamente en su negocio.

loans.use: More capital for her juice business.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory C. sells weavons and hair extensions. She has been in this business since 2006. Glory lives in Badagry, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 23 years old and married with a child. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $425 to buy more weavons and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more weavons and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita nació el 10 D. Junio D. 1951, en la actualidad tiene 57 años D. edad, es madre D. siete hijos (04 mujeres y 03 varones), sólo estudió hasta el primer año D. primaria y a los 40 años D. edad quedó V.. Vive en el Centro Poblado D. Acari, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo.

DesD. que se formó el Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” del Centro Poblado D. Acari, Yunguyo viene trabajando hasta la fecha. Con su primer crédito D. S/.300 Nuevos Soles aumentó el capital y compró 01 cabeza D. ganado vacuno con S/.500. DesD. los 17 años D. edad empezó a dedicarse al negocio en la compra y venta D. mantas, sombreros, chompas. Compraba en Desaguadero y lo vendía en la ciudad D. Juliaca. En la actualidad se dedica al engorD. D. porcinos y a la venta D. ají.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 02 porcinos a un precio D. S/.100 y D. S/.150 cada uno y la diferencia lo invertirá en 04 sacos D. ají, cada saco está valorizado a S/.400.

Su mayor sueño es tener un pequeño establo D. ganado vacuno y que sus seis hijos continúen con el negocio D. confección y venta D. casacas en la ciudad D. Lima. Uno D. sus hijos vive en la comunidad D. Cuturapi Yunguyo.
texts.en:
Margarita was born Juno 10, 1951, and is now 57 years old. She is a mother of seven children (four girls, three boys). She only had one year of elementary school education and was widowed at 40. She lives in Centro Pablado D. Acari, and since the Faith and Joy Community Bank was formed she has been working. With her first loan she raised capital to buy one head of cattle. Since she was 17 years old she maD. a living buying and selling traditional blankets, hats and sweaters. She bought her products in Desaguadero and sold them in the city of Juliaca. Currently, she makes a living raising pigs and selling chili peppers. With the loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within three months, she will purchase two pigs and invest the rest in the purchase of chilis (four sacks' worth). Her biggest dream is to have a small stable of cattle and for six of her children to continue their frock coat business in Lima. One of her kids lives in the community of Cuturapi Yunguyo.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two pigs and four sacks of chili peppers

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Тоджева Мавжуда жительница города Вахдат.Возраст 36 лет,замужем,имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей женской одежды и нижнего белья.Имеет торговую точку на рынке « Хайр «.Имеет  опыт в бизнесе 10 лет.Доход от торговли помогает ее семье иметь все необходимое из продуктов питания.На кредит Мавжуда  хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mavjuda T. lives in Vahdat. She is 36, married, and has three children. She has a high school education. The client works buying and selling women’s clothes and underwear. She has a shop in Hire Market. She has ten years of business experience. The income from her sales helps her family have enough to eat. By taking out a loan, Mavjuda wants to increase the variety of goods she offers. She plans to pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase variety in inventory

loans.name: Jahongul

texts.ru: Бобокалонова Джахонгул жительница района Хуросон. Проживает  со своей семьей в одном из отдаленных кишлаков района. Имеет магазин рядом с домом. Торгует продуктами питания , а так же различными промышленными товарами. Ее торговый магазин помогает населению покупать продукты в любое время , не выезжая за приделы кишлака. Хочет увеличить товарооборот, для того, чтобы завезти некоторые виды одежды. Это даст возможность привлечь новых клиентов , а так же поможет населению приобретать одежду прямо у себя в кишлаке. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jahongul B. lives in the Khuroson district. She and her family live in one of the district's remote villages. She has a store next to her house, where she sells foods as well as various commercial goods. Her store helps residents by providing constant access to these goods within the village. She wants to expand sales volume by bringing in a few types of clothing. This will attract new customers and also allow the village's residents to buy clothes right in their village. The repayment term is 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales. Purchase refrigerator.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.fr:
Agé de 32 ans, Monsieur A. Gilbert est né au Bénin et réside actuellement à Kpémé. Marié, il a à sa charge sept (07) personnes. Mécanicien chauffeur, Monsieur A. Gilbert conduit son propre taxi depuis sept ans. Mais aujourd’hui, pour cause du vieillissement du moteur, il est confronté à des pannes permanentes. Ce qui à un effet sur son revenu journalier. Ainsi il n’arrive plus à dégager des revenus lui permettant de s’occuper de sa famille. 
Pour y remédier il voudrait s’acheter un autre moteur pour son taxi de transport. Mais faute de moyens financiers, il sollicite un financement à cette fin.
texts.en:
Mr Gilbert A. is 32 years old. He was born in Benin and now lives in Kpeme. He is married and has seven (7) dependents. Mr. Gilbert is a mechanic and taxi driver, and has driven his own taxi for the past seven years. Today, because of the age of the taxi's motor, he is confronted with major repairs. This is having an effect on his daily income. He is no longer able to earn sufficient income to meet the needs of his family. To remedy this, he would like to purchase a new motor for his taxi. He is requesting a small loan to achieve this.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new motor for his taxi

loans.name: Osioda A - 2 Group

texts.en:
A. Sarah (front, far right) represents the Osioda A-2 group. She is very hardworking and social. She is 28 years of age and sells clothes, shoes, bags, suitcases and other items. She travels to Kampala twice a month to purchase her stock, and has been in business for 3 years. This loan will enable Sarah to purchase trendy products for her customers, including dresses, suitcases, shoes and bags.

Sarah is a widow with two children who are both in school. Her ambition is to open a shop outlet in the neighboring town. She also hopes to build a house for her family.The other members of Sarah’s group are involved in various business activities like selling cereals, clothes, and fish.

loans.use: Purchase dresses, suitcases, shoes and bags.

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid was born in 1964. He is married and lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Galagan. Seven years ago, he started his business. Now he is requesting a loan to expand his car-washing facility.

loans.use: To expand his car-washing facility

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael O. is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She sells sarongs. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Fawzi

texts.en:
Fawzi, 67 years old, lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife. Fawzi has owned a home product shop for seven years.  Fawzi has not faced many difficulties since he started his business because he knows how to adapt himself depending on the season and on people’s needs. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region.  Fawzi began his business because he wanted to improve his financiA. situation. In the future, he plans on improving his business and diversifying his merchandise. 

He is requesting a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise for his shop. He wants to get souvenirs and home gifts since Mother’s day is coming soon. This is the first time that Fawzi has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for shop

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
el Sr. Lorenzo L. tiene 57 años de edad y vive en la aldea del Guayabo desde hace 12 años , esta casado con la sra. Olga Nunez y tiene bajo su responsabilidad 2 hijos de los cuales uno esta en la escuela.
el sr L. se dedica a la venta de leña y maiz desde hace 2 años para el es un negocio muy bueno ya que le deja muy buenas utilidades, el sale a comprar la leña y la transporta en su carro pickup asi el se ahorra mucho en gastos de transporte, y el lo cobra cuando la va a dejar lejos la leña,  el maiz lo va comprando por varias comunidades , el sale en su carro a comprar y luego al final de dia viene cargado de maiz y lo vende en una bodega. 
el necesita dinero para comprar mas mercaderia ya que la que esta comprando es muy poca y se queda sin vender producto muy rapido
texts.en:
Lorenzo L. is 57 years old and has lived in Guayabo village for 12 years. He is married to Olga Nunez and has 2 children in his care, one of whom goes to school. Mr. L. has been selling firewood and corn for the last 2 years, a business that has proved very lucrative. He goes out to buy firewood and carries it around in his pickup truck, saving a lot of money on freight charges and collecting for it when dropping the wood off in remote locations. He visits several different communities in his pickup to buy corn and, after loading up on stock, sells it at a store at the end of the day. He needs funds to buy more goods as he is only able to buy small amounts and runs out very quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of firewood and corn

loans.name: Gulchin

texts.ru: Катабекова Гульчин проживает в городе Яван. Разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Работает парикмахером и косметологом в свадебном салоне. Обратилась к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить инструменты , необходимые для работы.Современный инвентарь даст возможность улучшить качество обслуживания. Этим она сможет привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Gulchin K. lives in the city of Yavan. She is divorced and has one child. She works as a hairdresser and cosmetologist at a wedding salon. She has turned to us for credit in order to purchase tools necessary for her work. Modern inventory will allow her to improve the quality of her services. This way she will be able to attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase necessary tools

loans.name: Fautino

texts.es:
el sr. Fautino P. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, esta actividad es muy buena ya que mucha gente de escasos recuroso comprar este tipo de producto ya que es muy barato y la calidad es buena, el tiene su negocio en el mayoreo de esta ciudad, los domingos sales a vender su ropa a diferentes caserios y localidades cercanas a la ciudad de danli, el tiene muchos años de experiencia en las ventas, el es de origen nicaraguense pero desde la guerra de nicaragua se traslado a vivir a honduras y desde entonces dice que el siempre vivira en Honduras. 
este negocio le genera ingresos para cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas fardos de ropa y asi poder ofrecerle mas variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fautino P. makes a good living selling second-hand clothing; many low income people buy this type of product because it is very cheap and of good quality. His business is located in Danli’s wholesale market. On Sundays, he goes out and sells his clothing in various villages and towns nearby. He has many years of sales experience.

Fautino is originally from Nicaragua, but ever since the war started there he has lived and has said he will always live in Honduras.

His business generates enough income to cover household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy more bales of clothing so that he can offer his customers greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bales of clothing

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes Gómez P. tiene la edad de 28 años, ella es una mujer casada. María tiene 2 hijos y todavía no asisten a una escuela. María tiene la actividad económica de la venta de ropa y calzado. Dio inicio a este negocio de una manera muy humilde, por que la cantidad con la que inicio fue muy poca, esto no le impidió salir adelante. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que su mayor propósito es mantener este negocio para sacar adelante a su familia. los sueños de María son de establecer un local mas amplio para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
María Mercedes Gómez P. is 28 years old and married. She has two children who still aren't school age. María makes a living selling clothing and footwear. She started this business very humbly with few items to sell, but this did not stop her from making headway and she has now 10 years of experience. Her main goal is to stay with the business and keep pushing ahead for her family. Her dream is to set up a larger store in order to provide a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en: Jennet sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks.  Jennet's shop is open from 7am to 11pm Mondays through Sundays. Jennet is 37 years old and married with 3 children. Jennet hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando M. is 31 years old and runs his own motorcycle repair shop in El Seybo, a medium-sized town in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic. With seventeen years of experience working with motorcycles, and three years in the motorcycle repair business, Armando brings a wealth of skills and expertise to his trade. In a community where most people get around on their own motorcycle (here just called a "motor") or by hiring a motorcycle driver (called a "motoconcho"), Armando's business has no want of customers. 

Yet, Armando is not quite like any of the other motorcycle repairmen in the city. At 8 months old, Armando suffered a terrible fall off of a bed, and has since been unable to walk without the help of leg braces and prosthetics. Despite these constraints, Armando maintains a sunny outlook on life, which makes him very popular in the neighborhood of Ginandiana where he lives and works. Armando also has dreams for his business: he says that he hopes to expand his workshop over time, and he aspires to someday be a great businessman.

This is Armando's first loan from Kiva and Esperanza International, and he intends to invest the loan in his business and buy additional motorcycle replacement parts for his shop. Revenues from Armando's workshop constitute his primary source of income. He currently lives with his mother and younger sister. Here he is pictured in his workshop with some of his merchandise.

loans.use: To buy new replacement parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 40 años, es natural de la ciudad de Lima, vive con sus hijos Deivi de 19 años, Kevin de 14 y Neyeli de 6 añitos. Ella tuvo que trabajar en varios oficios para sacar adelante a su familia, teniendo en mente que todo sacrificio es por sus hijos. Es así que desde hace 14 años, a base de mucho esfuerzo pudo implementar en su casa una pequeña ferretería. Su negocio va progresando poco a poco y ella espera muy pronto poder expandirlo, ya que cada día obtiene más clientela incrementando sus ganancias. Lo que le gusta a Carmen de su trabajo es que gracias a él puede ser independiente y lograr mantener las necesidades de su familia. Su trabajo es durante todo el día y aunque le resulta muy cansado permanecer durante bastante tiempo con el intenso frió de esta época, aún así trabaja con muchas ganas de progresar. Este es su cuarto préstamo don MFP, ella es parte del banco comunal denominado “Estrella azul”, donde se siente muy feliz con su grupo, puesto que todos son muy cumplidos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de artículos para abastecer mejor su ferretería e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old, native to the city of Lima. She lives with her children, 19 year old Deivi, 14 year old Kevin, and 6 year old Neyeli. Carmen has had to work various jobs to support her family, knowing that all her sacrifices have been for her children. 14 years ago, after much effort, she was able to set up a small hardware store in her house. Her business has been growing little by little and Carmen hopes to be able to expand it soon, since every day she gains more customers and earns more income. What Carmen likes about her work is that thanks to her business she can be independent and provide for her family. She works all day and although it leaves her tired to work such long hours in the intense cold during this time of year, Carmen continues working with a lot of motivation to make progress. This is her fourth loan with MFP. Carmen is part of "Estrella Azul" (Blue Star) community bank, and is very happy with her group, as the members are all very responsible. With the money she is requesting she will buy a greater quantity of items to better stock her hardware store and thus increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a member of the Mbagala east borrower group,she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 12,10, and 8 years.

Asha started her own food business selling bites 2 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tsh.

This is Asha`s first loan from BRAC,she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Wheat,sugar,cooking oil etc for her business.

With additional profit she get from the use of this loan Asha hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat,sugar,cooking oil.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco E. reside en San Juan Opico, en el departamento de La Libertad. Francisco tiene 46 años de edad se encuentra casado con Doña Lilian de E. quien se dedica  cuidar de sus hijos Juan de 14 años y Jorge de 11 años de edad, ambos niños se encuentran estudiando básica en la escuela. Francisco vela económicamente de su familia por medio de su taller, donde elaboran todo tipo de calzado, cuenta con un inventario económico de $325 US, el cual pretende aumentar por medio de este crédito que le permitirá comprar mas cuero, hormas para zapatos y pega , de esta manera su producción al igual que sus ventas lograran crecer.
texts.en:
Francisco E. lives in San Juan Opico, which is located in the district of La Libertad. He is 46 years old and married to Doña Lilian de E., who takes care of their sons Juan (age 14) and Jorge (age 11). Both children are enrolled in school.

Francisco supports his family financially by manufacturing all types of footwear out of his workshop. His current inventory is valued at $325 USD. He hopes to increase his inventory with this loan by purchasing more leather, shoetrees, and adhesives. These materials will help increase his production and result in larger sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 34 years old and married with four children. She sells cooked foods and drinks. She also sells shoes made by her husband that give her additional income.

Evelyn is requesting a loan of 90,000 NGN to buy food and drinks to sell. She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more food and drinks to sell

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen Elena D. A. de 38 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa y su hija. Ella posee desde hace un año una venta de productos para la elaboración de pan, productos como harina, azúcar, levadura, entre otros productos más. Carmen solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio y surtirlo más, ya que espera mejorar sus ventas, debido a que su hijo mayor estudia en el extranjero, ella desea obtener más ganancias y poder ayudarle más a su hijo, así mismo poder contribuir junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Carmen Elena D. A., 38, lives in Lourdes Colón in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband and daughter. For a year she has been selling products like flour, sugar, leavening, and more for making bread. Carmen is asking for a loan to invest in her business and get more stock. She hopes to improve her sales. Her oldest son is studying abroad. She hopes to get more earnings to be able to help her son more and to be able to contribute, with her husband, to the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Americo

texts.en:
Americo is a 30-year-old father of two from Cusco who lives in Santiago.  He is a client of Asociación Arariwa, and is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco.  The group is called El Amanecer, which means "daybreak" in Spanish.

Americo sells quail eggs in the Molino market.  He will use this loan to buy more quails to raise and more feed to give them.  He buys his quails from Lima.  He makes approximately 80 Peruvian soles, or $30 US, a day.

Americo appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more quails to raise and food to feed them

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta S. is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 35 years old, married, and has five school-aged children.

Violeta is a food vendor and has been engaged in this business for six years, earning approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

On January 12, 2009, Violeta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Violeta is now requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP as additional capital for her business. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to support the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional meat and ingredients

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años y es madre D. 03 hijos,  ya independientes.

Lucia, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, se inicio desD. muy joven por iniciativa propia y hoy lleva 18 años aun ejerciendo este tipo D. actividad, se encuentra ubicada, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, donD. atienD. a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados. 

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, venD. en las mañanas y tardes. Es ella quien personalmente atienD. a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos como: arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos D. papa, pollos en javas, verduras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra D. utensilios para remplazar a sus utensilios antiguos, así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Lucia, se siente llena D. vida y con ganas D. seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar más su restaurante al mismo tiempo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia belongs to the Communal Bank “El Tiempo es Oro” (Time is Gold), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children who are independent.

As a young woman, Lucia started selling prepared meals and has been in business for the past 18 years. Her business can be found at a location that is well-equipped for accommodating her customers. She says that her daily sales have been good due in part to the rich flavor of her dishes.

Lucia continues to manage her business. She is very pleased with the work that she accomplishes day after day, both in the mornings and afternoons. Lucia personally welcomes her customers with her charismatic personality.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy supplies for her daily food preparation such as rice by the kilo, sugar, oil by the gallon, sacks of potatoes, cases of chicken, and vegetables. Part of the money will be used to buy replacement utensils so that she can proviD. better service to her customers.

Lucia is full of life and eager to move forward. She has many dreams and goals in life, such as expanding her restaurant. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & utensils

loans.name: Soutra Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Soutra sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Bablena, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. 
Ces femmes ont intégré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire  et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé. 
Avec ce  nouveau prêt elles comptent acheter, plusieurs paires de volailles, des sacs de tubercules, dans les environs et une grande quantité d’habits sur le marché de Dioïla. 
Les articles sont ensuite revendus sur place dans le village et au marché de Dioïla à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 17.500FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont repartis entre l’activité proprement dite et les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The members of the Soutra group are married women who are, on average, 40 years old with 3 children. With their husband and children, they live in large traditional households in the village of Bablena, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. They know each other through neighbourhood and familial relations. These women joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of making their lucrative businesses more profitable. They are on their second solidarity (group) loan, and the previous loan was repaid properly. With this new loan, they intend to buy several pairs of chickens, bags of tubers from the area, and a large quantity of clothes from the market in Dioïla. These items are then resold on-the-spot in the village and at the market in Dioïla to a clientele composed of women and men. They foresee realizing a monthly profit of 17,500 FCFA per person. The profit will be shared between the above-mentioned business and family expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poultry, tubers, and clothing

loans.name: Apeke

texts.en: Apeke is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. She is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She sells plantains, which she buys from the nearby village market to sell in retail and wholesale. She lives in Ibadan Oyo state Nigeria. She assists her husband in supporting the family. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more plantains to sell, as the demand is high.  She enjoys the business because of the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She says a big 'thank you' to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains to sell.

loans.name: Loung's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Loung N. is 57 years old. She is a village bank president of a group that consists of 17 people, all located in Chong Kaoh village, Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. N. Roeung are farmers who own a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice. They now face some problems because the field is infertile and they do not have enough water to water the plants. Thus, Mrs. Loung N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. Mrs. Loung N. is a mother of three children. One of her children is a farmer and the other two are laborers for a private company.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a husband and the father of four daughters and three sons. He is an employee of the government and his current job is not a fulfillment of his dream of working in his own business nor an answer to big family expenses.

Over the last year Muhammad purchased fifteen sheep to raise and sell. His aim behind taking a loan from FATEN is to increase the number of sheep he has to increase the income from selling them.

Muhammad's future plan is to establish a big farm with different types of livestock and to move from raising and selling them to breeding them and selling sheep products.

loans.use: To increase his number of sheep

loans.name: Fazliddin

texts.en:
Fazliddin has a responsibility that makes him work hard for improvement. He is farmer. He grows potatoes and maize, work that he hopes makes progress and provides what is necessary for his family. For that reason, he wants to invest in his production, expand his crop fields and improve the quality of his products. Fazliddin knows that if he takes care of his land and works diligently he will reap excellent products that will have a better reception in the marketplace. The request Fazliddin makes is to purchase fertilizers necessary for his land. Support this hardworking man so his effort is worthwhile.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Miriam De Jesús

texts.es: La señora López V., es profesora de primaria, cuenta con más de 25 años de ser educadora, el esposo es de oficio chofer de camiones, sus hijos son mayores de edad, pero tiene a su cargo dos nietos, el préstamo lo necesita para realizarle una reparación del techo de la cocina da la casa, para protegerse del invierno que empieza en los próximos dos meses. Con los préstamos que se le han atendido en CEPRODEL, ha venido mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. López V. is an elementary school teacher and has more than 25 years of experience as an educator. Her husband works as a truck driver. They have two adult children who take care of their two grandchildren.

She is requesting a loan to repair the roof above her kitchen so that it will be protected during the winter, which begins within the next two months. With her loans from CEPRODEL, she has improved her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof above her kitchen

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mr. R., 39, is married to That, 31, and they are military police officers. In addition, R. and his wife plant some vegetables at home for sale. They are good parents caring for two school-aged kids. 

R. finds it hard travellng to his work location or anywhere else because he has no vehicle. Thus, he pursues a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL. He will buy an old motorcycle for commuting proposes. R. was not available when the photo taken, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy an old motorcycle

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam T. D., a 42-year-old married mother of three children, has sold fruit in the market for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. A member of SEDA for two years, Tam has repaid her loans punctually. She would now like to borrow 8.288.000 VND more (450 USD) to invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao B., 29, is married and resides with his wife and one-year-old child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. He sells drinking water for an income of about USD $10 per day. His wife is employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of USD $2 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

B. has requested a loan of USD $1200 to purchase a truck to transport drinking water for sale. In the future, he would like to use any additional profits to make repairs to his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva Field Partner in Cambodia. B. is pictured with his family here.

loans.use: To buy a truck to transport drinking water

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 48 years old, married and has three children between the ages of 35 and 22 years.  Joel runs Musimamo Tailoring Shop and has two employees.  He has been in this business since 1979.  He has also been practicing dairy farming for a living.  

He joined Nyamu group in Faulu Kenya, and since then he has been able to buy a dairy cow.  This is because he previously took out a loan from Faulu Kenya and was guaranteed by the group members. 

He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to buy a sewing machine and fabric.  He hopes to become financially stable and own a piece of land in the future.  He says that he is determined to achieve his dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Aminata C.

texts.en:
Pictured above is Aminata C. S., an entrepreneur in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Aminata has applied for a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to keep expanding her business. In her stall, right at the center of town, Aminata sells market foodstuffs like rice, beans, flour, sugar, oil, bulgur wheat, pepper, etc. 

Aminata has been doing business for more than fifteen years now. With the help of her previous SMT/Kiva lenders' loan, Aminata has realized a vast improvement in her business and personal life. With the help of this new loan, she will buy the above-mentioned goods wholesale to further expand her business.

loans.use: Buy market foodstuffs like rice, beans, flour, sugar, oil, bulgur wheat, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en:
Mouna is a 46-year-old borrower from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and their six children; the oldest is 25 years old and the youngest is 10 years old. 

For nine years now, Mouna has owned a book and stationery shop. She sells all types of school stationery like pens, pencils, papers; she also has a printer, newspapers, books and much more. She notes that when she first started, she faced some challenges in securing sufficient financing for her business. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to improve her family's financial situation, and she thought that it was needed in her region.     

Today, Mouna has requested a loan of 1500 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. She plans to purchase merchandise for her shop to prepare herself for the school year, and she also wants to make some décor changes in her house. She hopes to further expand and enhance her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Camino De Victoria 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Edermira is the coordinator of her group, Camino de Victoria 1 y 2 (Victory Road), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Edermira’s group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure being a single mom with three children.

Edermira is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza to invest in her fried food stand, improving her business and enabling a better quality of life with her children. She plans to use this loan to buy foods like cheese, chicken, flour, oil and some vegetables with which she will make fried food named empanada (made of flour and stuffed with meat, chicken, cheese or vegetables).

Edermira will use the profits to continue investing in her business, with the long-term goal of saving towards purchasing her own home. She believes that with the loans she will make this dream come true. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more flour, oil, butter, cheese, chicken and other ingredients

loans.name: Catalino

texts.en:
Catalino P. is from the village of Burgos. He is 52 years old. Catalino is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Catalino owns & operates a business raising pigs to fatten and sell. Catalino has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Catalino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catalino is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Catalino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Sope Serigne Touba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE TOUB. est créé depuis 6 mois. Il est composé de 24 femmes issues du même village. Ce sont des femmes qui ont évolué depuis leur jeune âge. C’est ainsi qu’elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de BOFFEL

Madame FAMA S. debout à droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mère de 4 enfants en charge, elle a aussi la charge de sa petite fille. 

Elle fait de l’embouche ovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis une décennie. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 3 mouton et de l’aliment de bétail. Elle va les engraisser pendant 5 mois avant de les vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité.

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels, de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et de constituer une bonne épargne.
texts.en:
The Sope Serigne TouB. solidarity group was established six months ago. It is made up of 24 women who come from the same village. These women have grown close from an early age and formed the group as friends or neighbors. The solidarity group is part of the Banc Villageois in Boffel. Mrs. Fama S., who is standing at the right of the photo is in charge of the group. She is 48 years old and is mother to four children in her care; she also takes care of her granddaughter. She has a sheep fattening activity and has been carrying out this business for around ten years. Her new loan will allow her to buy three sheep and food for the livestock. She will fatten up the sheep for five months before selling them in the weekly markets in her town. Her goal is to provide for her personal needs, to contribute to an improvement in her family's living conditions and to build up a healthy level of savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase three sheep

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca O. M.   es una señora  de 40  años de edad quien vive con sus 2 hijos en una comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semi montañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio. 
Desde hace 2 años Doña Francisca decidió crear si propio negocio. Una soda (Pequeño restaurante con comidas caseras) en la cual ella vende todo tipo de platillos tradicionales, muy ricos y a precios muy accesibles. La idea de Doña Francisca es que su negocio sea cada vez mas grande, es por eso que necesita un préstamo de ¢604.000 (seiscientos cuatro mil colones) para  comprar 2 congeladores que necesita para poder tener más  mercadería y así ofrecer mas variedad de comidas.
Ella    es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. Ella espera ser una gran microempresaria.
texts.en:
Francisca O. M. is 40 years old and lives with her two sons in a community called Canalete, located in Upala in the province of Alajuela. It is a hilly region where the principal economic activities revolve around agriculture and raising livestock. Upala is a community with a great opportunity for the development of micro businesses, in agriculture as well as commerce. Two years ago, Francisca decided to launch her own business and opened a small restaurant where she serves all kinds of traditional dishes, delicious and reasonably priced. Francisca's objective is to continue to grow this business. She is requesting a loan to purchase 2 freezers which she needs to keep more ingredients in stock and offer more variety to her customers. Francisca is a member of the communal bank of Canalete, one of the hundreds of organizations associated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her third loan and she hopes to continue to grow her business and improve her economic situation. Francisco wants to be a successful businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 freezers so that she can keep more ingredients in stock and offer more variety to her customers in her small restaurant.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson has his membership with Baraka Ukweli group in Faulu Kenya.  He joined the group as an entrepreneur who does welding and metal fabrication and has run the business for two years.  He makes grill doors, windows and metallic chairs.  He gets customers from his neighborhood.  He wants to invest in the business so as to get enough income to build himself a stone house in the future.  Benson’s first loan from Faulu Kenya will be 20,000 KES.  He will use the money to buy metals.

loans.use: To buy metals

loans.name: May Jane

texts.en:
May Jane B., a married woman living in Prk Riverside, Brgy Rafaela Barrera, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband, Benjie B., 37, works as a teacher, and they have three children ranging in age from one week to eleven years old.

May Jane joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, May Jane has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stock so that she can continue to save up for her family's future needs and home improvements. May Jane B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe A. is from the village of Punta, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He is 59 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a transport service. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Felipe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for his business. 

Felipe is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories for his motorcycle. This will be his 2nd loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long T. N. is 52 years old and has 1 child. She has been running a grocery shop in the local market for 6 years. Her shop is not big but it generates a reasonable income. With this income she she can manage her family life and save money for a motor for her child who is going to go to work. Since joining our credit program in 2004, she has been a good repayer. Currently, she wants a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy more products to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more products to meet customer demand

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy rice, oil, soap, sardines, pepper, beans and other items

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth operates a milling business in a highly populated area. She mills and sells maize flour for ugali (a staple food) and millet and sorghum flour for uji (porridge). She is requesting a loan of KES 60,000 to increase her stock of maize, millet and sorghum.

Ruth, 34 years old, is married and a mother to four children who are in school. She describes herself as stable and hopes to open more posho mill outlets in the future. Her five year plan is to buy a minibus for her business. Faulu Kenya has helped Ruth to build a home in the village.

loans.use: to increase her stock of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina lives in Kasur, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan famous for its tannery industry. She lives in the Chaki Piaray Lal area in a three-room brick house with her husband, two sons and daughter. Her daughter is studying while her sons have not yet started their education. Her husband is a government employee on a meager income and Rubina operates a thread-selling business. She gets thread from used sweaters and sells it to thread retailers for a profit.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her thread-selling business. She will use the loan to buy a large stock of used sweaters. This will help her make more thread which she can then sell to retailers for a good price and increase her household income. She has been doing this for five years and is hopeful that a loan investment will help her to become more profitable.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she proved herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy used sweaters for a thread-making business.

loans.name: Isrrael

texts.es:
El Sr. Isrrael está casado, tiene una hija mayor de edad.
Él se dedica a la venta de Harina de Maíz  de forma ambulante  por la zona de Minga Guazú, la misma cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposa y su hija  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario en sus emprendimientos.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de gran cantidad de maíz, ya que habrá mucha venta
texts.en:
Isrrael is married and has a grown-up daughter.  He sells corn flour as a street trader in Minga Guazú district.  His business is growing and it is making him good profits.

With the help of his wife and daughter, he is getting ahead through a lot of sacrifice and hard work.  Isrrael has shown himself to be a responsible and honest person in his commitments which means that we must provide him with the support he needs in his undertakings.

Isrrael is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of corn since he will have a lot of sales.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio E. works in his family trade of photography.  His grandfather’s interest in photography began when he was a young man living in Campeche, Mexico and he passed this interest on to his children and grandchildren.  When Sergio immigrated to the United States from Mexico, he brought the passion and history of his family photography business with him to El Paso.  He opened his first studio under the family name, Hernandez Photography Studio, in 2006.  He runs the business with his wife and the couple supports their four children with the business. 
   
Sergio is proud that the business is still operating strongly during the economic crisis and looks forward to expanding to a new location in the future.  This loan is the second that Sergio has received from ACCION Texas-Louisiana.  The first helped him remodel his studio and this loan is going to give him working capital to buy equipment.  Sergio found out about ACCION because a representative was a customer of his.  Without this loan, Sergio would not be able to reach his goals of expanding and improving his business.   

Feel free to check out his website:  www.hdezphotography.com

loans.use: To buy new equipment

loans.name: Fashamwenewanyu Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco N. est un commerçant âgé de 28 ans qui habite la localité de Kibimba de la Province de Gitega. Il fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme le haricot, le riz et autres denrées depuis 13ans. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’école primaire en 6e année. Il est marié et père de 1enfant de 3mois. Il arrive au 10e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires afin d’ouvrir une boutique et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Il espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, il sera un grand commercant dans le futur. 

Il est  un des membres  du groupe  Communautaire« Fashamwenewanyu»
texts.en:
Jean Bosco N. is a 28-year old merchant who lives in the city of Kibimba, in the province of Gitega. He has sold food products such as green beans, rice, and other items for the past 13 years. He has a grade 6 education. He is married and he is the father of a 3-month old baby. He is on his 10th loan cycle with the Turame communal bank (Kiva Field Partner). 

He requests a loan to supplement his capital funds with the goal of purchasing large quantities of food products. His goal is to set up a store and to increase his earnings. He hopes that with the profits earned with the help of this loan he will be able to develop his business

He is a member of the group named "Fashamwenewanyu".

loans.use: To purchase food products to open a store.

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es:
Don Nelson P., tiene 40 anos de edad, vive en la comarca Palo Verde, en Pueblo Nuevo, Jinotega; casado con 2 hijos; su educacion es muy elemental, ya que solamente aprobo 1er grado de primaria.
Joven emigro a nuesro pais hermano de Costa Rica, ahorro un poco de dinero y decidio regresar a su pais, para dedicarse a la siembra de hortalizas y de granos basicos.
El comenzo con esfuerzos propios, ha sido siempre muy trabajador y muy esforzado.
El solicito este credito, para compra de Insumos y pago de mano de obra en la siembra de tomates; es decir que es para capital de trabajo.
Desea seguir dedicandose a la siembra de hortalizas y poco a poco mejorar su vivienda, ya que es muy humilde actualmente.
Todo lo que el hace es para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia,y es algo que siempre ha hecho.
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson Ponzo is 40 years old and he lives in the community of Palo Verde in Pueblo Nuevo, Jinotega. He is married and he has 2 children. His education is very basic; he only passed grade 1. 

As a young man he immigrated our neighbor country of Costa Rica. He saved some money and decided to return to his homeland to cultivate vegetables and basic grains. 

He started out on his own, and he has always been hard working and willing to expend every effort.

He requested this loan to purchase materials and to hire help to maintain his tomato plantation. That is to say, his loan will be used as working capital. 

He wishes to keep up with his vegetable plantations and to slowly improve his house. It is a very humble house. 

Everything that he does is done to improve the quality of life for his family. It is something that he has always done.

loans.use: To cultivate tomatoes.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For over ten years, Amina has been operating a clothing business, selling from her home to passersby. Amina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the loan for 40,000 Kshs, Amina wants to purchase bundles of shoes and cloth materials for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of its empowerment of entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and cloth materials for resale

loans.name: Mahmadkul

texts.en:
Y. Mahmadkul is 28 years old. He is married and has three children. From the time he was young, Mahmadkul was learning to work in the small business of cattle breeding. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifices, and seeing his family progressing more and more. His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children. He would like to see his children become professional, ethical and hardworking. For this reason, Mahmadkul is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy additional livestock. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle and the small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and agrochemicals for his rice and corn crops

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children, three of whom are in school. Rose has a business of selling vegetables. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days out of every week. Rose has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to purchase more bunches of sweet and yellow bananas and avocados to sell. 

The main business challenge for Rose is seasonality. Her goal is to boost her business and earn more profits. Rose lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas and avocados to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, soaps, sardines, biscuits, etc. in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn J., from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan for 8000 PHP to purchase additional products including perfume, body massage lotion and shampoo for sale, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products including perfume, body massage lotion and shampoo for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Divino Niño se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de ocho años que estudia en la escuela. El marido es comerciante. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la responsabilidad de sus compañeras y de la institución ya que esta es muy puntual con lo que prometen.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para ayudar de alguna forma a su esposo con los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito para que el invierta en su negocio, el  compra y vende accesorios de teléfonos y controles remotos de todas las marcas, su forma de venta es ambulante, el recorre toda la ciudad vendiendo sus productos, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, nos cuenta que su esposo lleva cerca de 10 años que se dedica al comercio, a veces trabaja con ropa y ahora con estos artículos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar accesorios de teléfono y controles remotos.

 Su sueño  tener un buen bazar.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Divine Child" meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a very commercialized region, for its traditional fairs of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the contentedness of the people.

Here we meet Rosa. She is 23 years old, married common-law, and she has an eight-year old boy who is in school. Her husband is a merchant. She is the founder of the communal bank and she appreciates the responsibility of her colleagues and of the organization, especially for being very committed to their promises.

She is a very good mother and housewife and to help her husband in some way with the household expenses she has requested a loan to invest in her business. She buys and sells telephone accessories and remote controls of all brand names. She sells itinerantly, traveling throughout the city selling her products. She works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She says that her husband has been a merchant for close to 10 years, sometimes selling clothing but now he carries these articles.

This loan will be used to purchase telephone accessories and remote controls.

Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to purchase telephone accessories and remote controls.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio  vive en Pérez Zeledón  específicamente en la comunidad de Pilas. Es una persona con experiencia en la agricultura y ama lo que hace.
El tiene su propia finca, y desea empezar a sembrar frijoles y maíz para la venta, aprovechando el clima y la demanda propia de época. Para eso el desea un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de abonos y Insecticidas, necesarios para la producción de estos granos.
El desea aumentar su producción y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
El  es  socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal La Danta S.A una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Dionisio lives in Pérez Zeledón, specifically the community of Pilas. He is an experienced farmer who enjoys his job.

Dionisio has his own farm and wants to begin planting beans and corn to sell. He hopes to take advantage of the weather and the demand that exists for this season. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 CRC in order to buy compost and insecticides, necessary supplies for producing these crops.

His wishes include increasing his production and improving the quality of life for his family. Dionisio is a member of La Danta Communal Credit Enterprise, S.A., which is one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase compost and insecticides.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 30 years old and single. She is from the village of Mialen Clarin Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Ivy owns and operates a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ivy has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Ivy joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as rice and corn grits to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ivy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve her general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Sergio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Mocambique é casado e pai de 2 filhos,de 6 meses e 2 anos de idade. Fez 10a classe e parou quando foi incorporado ao serviço  militar obrigatorio,onde foi levado ate Cabo delgado. vive numa casa de aluguer com a sua familia e sustenta o seu cunhado que vive com ele.   
Saiu de cabo delgado para Maputo a procura de melhores condiçoes de vida, é funcionario permanente no ministerio da defesa nacional ha mais de 7 anos onde tem um salario de  6.815.59mt  por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem são clientes desta instituiçao e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, cimento, ferro, areia e outros) para construir a sua residencia.
Esta confiante que vai pagar de acordo com o calendario e o seu sonho é concluir a sua obra para sair da casa de aluguer e iniciar um negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Born in Maputo city, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique, he is married with two children, ages 6 months and 2 years old. He stopped attending school himself in the 10th grade when he joined the military, and was assigned to service in Cabo Delgado. He lives in a rental home with his family and also supports his brother who lives with him.

He left Cabo Delgado for Maputo in search of better living conditions for himself.  He is an enlisted member of the ministry of national defense for over 7 years now.  He has a monthly salary of 6.815.59mt, which he applies to household expenses and also manages to save some in his bank BIM account [Banco Internacional de Mocambique].

He has never borrowed from other banks.  He became familiar with the Hluvuku agency through friends who are also loan recipients of this institution.  This is his first loan in the amount of 15.000.00mt with which he will buy construction materials (corrugated iron, cement, iron, sand etc.) to build his home.

He is confident that he will repay the loan as scheduled.  His dream is to finish constructing his in order to leave the rental house and start a business, for such, he hopes to request additional loans from the Hluvuku agency.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (corrugated iron, cement, iron, sand etc. ) to build his home.

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan (in the photo), 41, is a widowed mother with two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. The family lives in a village along National Road number five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhan sells fish. She buys fish from Prek Phnao market and carries them by bicycle to sell them in her village. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to build a restroom and to fill up the land under her house.

loans.use: to build a restroom and to fill up the land under her house.

loans.name: Davron

texts.en:
Davron is a hardworking man. He is married and the father of four children. His wife works as a teacher.

Davron has been a farmer for seven years and has much business experience. Davron cultivates onions, carrots, tomatoes and watermelon. His wife helps him in the business, and during the harvest season he hires additional help.

Davron would like a loan of $1,500 to purchase mineral fertilizers and to pay his workers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Paulo Mata Hernandez

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Paulo le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior y elaborar la bardal alrededor de su casa.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comparar el material para la constricción que es cemento, pintura, block, arena y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. Don Paulo no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la construcción y le preocupa la seguridad y protección de su esposa y sus cuatro hijos.  
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe como chofer de un taxi, es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para darles lo mejor a su familia.
