texts.en: Paulo’s house still needs the finishing touches to the exterior and a perimeter wall around it.  He’s asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies for this construction project: cement, paint, concrete blocks and sand and to pay labor costs to the person who will do the work.  Paulo does not have enough money to do the project and he’s concerned about his wife’s and his four children’s safety and protection.  He plans to repay the loan with part of the salary he earns as a Taxi Driver, which is the source of income he has to provide the best for his family.

loans.use: to finish the exterior of the house and build a perimter wall.

loans.name: Isolda Elena

texts.es: Isolda es una señora 33 años, tiene un negocio en su propio domicilio en el que vende bolsos, golosinas, shampoo, cremas y perfumes. Su negocio cuenta con una gran demanda los fines de semana, Isolda desarrolla esta actividad desde hace 13 años, lo que le ha dado experiencia y clientela. Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima. El préstamo le sería de gran utilidad pues la ayudaría a ganar clientela nueva y por ende mejorar sus ventas y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Isolda is 33 years old and runs a small business from her home. She sells purses, sweets, shampoo, moisturizing cream and perfume. She started her business 13 years ago, and has been building experience and a larger customer base over the years. Her business is especially busy on the weekends. Isolda is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory. The loan will help her attract new customers and increase sales.

loans.use: To buy purses, candy, shampoo, lotion and perfume.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old young man. Married with one son, he has a project of raising poultry and benefiting from selling their products. Mohammad wants to purchase fodder and medicine for his poultry and also wants to expand the coop size, but the money Mohammad has isn't enough to pay for theses expenses, so he needs to take a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN.

When Mohammad gets the loan, that is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase the necessary living needs for the poultry such as fodder and medicine and also to make the needed expansion for the coop. This will increase the productivity of his poultry and Mohammad will sell more poultry products and so increase the income he gets to have better living conditions. Mohammad is photographed here.

loans.use: To purchase poultry fodder, medicine and expand the coop size.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una madre de familia de 41 años, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio solo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesana.

Desde hace 2 años Gladys se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, confección, crianza y venta de ganado porcino, su negocio lo tiene en su casa, cuenta con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar más productos de belleza y de prendas de vestir innovadoras para exhibir y vender a su clientela y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Gladys es una mujer trabajadora y una madre que siempre trata que su familia salga adelante a pesar de las dificultades que a veces se presentan en la vida.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 41-year-old mother who lives with her family in her own home.  The only basic service her house receives is electricity.  It is located in the rural part of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  The people in this area farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

For two years, Gladys has been selling beauty products and clothes, and raising and selling pigs.  She runs her business from home and has her own customer base.  She uses the income that she makes from both businesses to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Gladys has requested a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more beauty products and the latest clothes to display and sell to her customers.  This will enable her to make more profits so that she can enjoy a better quality of life.  Gladys is a hard-working woman and a mother who always tries her best to get her family ahead in life in spite of the difficulties that life sometimes puts in her path.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and clothes for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 32 years old, married, and her husband works hence producing some additional income for the family. She is a mother of three school-going children aged 19 to 13 years.


She runs a retail shop and she has been in business for five years. Right now her monthly income is KES 9,100. She is borrowing a loan of KES 15,000 which she plans to use to buy sweets, maize flour, and soft drinks for sale.


She plan to invest back the profit into the  business. This is her third loan and her hopes and dreams are to continue with her retail shop and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy sweets, maize flour, and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
En Santa Rosa del Peñón del departamento de León, la Señora María Isabel actualmente se está desempeñando como maestra de educación primaria siendo esta labor lo que la motiva para salir adelante y así beneficiar grandemente a su pequeño hijo que tiene el deber de mantener y sacar adelante.  

Se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar a su casa y sobre todas las cosas ha logrado mantener en buenas condiciones su núcleo familiar.

Acudió a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de cemento y arena para la construcción de una cocina para su vivienda porque es menester construirla ya que el espacio que ha tenido para su cocina se encuentra en malas condiciones
texts.en:
María Isabel currently works as an elementary school teacher in Santa Rosa del Peñón, in León department.  This work motivates her to get ahead in life and benefits her young son who she must support and take care of.

María Isabel is noted as being a very hard-working person because she has known how to take care of her household and, above all, she has managed to keep her family unit in good condition.

María Isabel came to Ceprodel to request a loan so that she could buy cement and sand with which to build a kitchen in her home.  She must do this because the space which she had for her kitchen is in a bad state of repair.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand

loans.name: Clara Del Rocio

texts.es:
Clara de  34 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada el “fortín”. Su negocio es una tienda-papeleria ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda. 

Empezó con esta actividad haces 12  años,  ya que tenía poco capital ella pensaba ponerse otra clase de negocio, en la actualidad le va  bien con este negocio. 

Su  trabajo lo realiza sola, el horario es de lunes a domingo, desde las 8:00am hasta las 20:00pm.
No tiene dificultad, es soltera. Tienen 2 hijos uno de 3 y el otro de 7 años,  estudian  en escuelas públicas.

Solicita este préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: papeleria, bebidas, aceites etc. 
Su sueño es mejorar  su casa de cemento y agrandar muchos más su negocio y poder ayudar a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Clara is 34 years old and lives in a periurban district called Fortín. Her business consists of a general store and stationery shop located in the front part of her home. She started this business 12 years ago. With the little bit of capital that she had, Clara added another type of business and is now doing well. She works alone Monday through Sunday, from 8am to 8pm. Clara has not had any difficulties. She is single and has two children, a three-year-old and a seven-year-old who attends public school.

Clara is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as stationery, beverages, oil, and other products. Her dream is to make improvements to her cement house and expand her business as much as possible so that she can help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy stationery, beverages, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Djaharatou

texts.fr:
Djaharatou est une femme âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée à un électricien de profession. Elle a 4 enfants dont 2 scolarisés. L’ainé des enfants a 10 ans  et le benjamin 3 ans. 
Djaharatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle achète et revend des bijoux genres boucles d’oreilles, les colliers, les bracelets à toutes personnes à son domicile.
Djaharatou a requis son quatrième crédit de  WAGES afin d’acheter bijoux destinés à la vente. Elle pense réinvestir ces profits supplémentaires dans l’agrandissement de son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Djaharatou voudrait ouvrir une boutique de vente de bijoux. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Djaharatou is a 32-year-old woman. She is married to an electrician by trade. She has four children, of whom two are in school. The oldest of the children is 10 years old, and the youngest is 3. Djaharatou has been working as a retailer since 2005. She buys jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, and bracelets, and she sells them out of her house to anyone.

Djaharatou has requested her fourth loan from WAGES to buy jewelry for resale. She is thinking of reinvesting these extra profits to expand her business. In the next few years, she would like to open a store for selling jewelry. With the profits, she says she plans on ensuring that the family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is a 26-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be quiet, confident and time conscious. He operates a produce sales business, selling farm produce. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. His business is located in an agricultural area. 

Bonface describes his biggest business challenge to be an insufficient water supply. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy water pumps, a sprinkler and horse pipes. His business goal is to expand his business to large scale farming within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have more children and give them a quality life.

loans.use: to buy water pumps, a sprinkler and horse pipes.

loans.name: Luzalyn

texts.en:
Luzalyn is 30 years old and lives in Tacdog, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is single.
Luzalyn sells freshly caught fish to earn a living. She has been doing this for 13 years and has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase fresh fish from fishermen and display it at the market.
Luzalyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 11 months. In the future, she hopes to sustain and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish from fisherman and display it at the market

loans.name: Matide

texts.en:
Matide is a forty-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She began work as a coffee farmer when she received start-up capital. She has now been running a preserved fish business for ten years. The major hardship in her business is insufficient capital.

Matide needs a loan of 250,000 UGX to buy more salt to preserve fish. Her goal is to have a number of her own fish ponds as well as buying a house.

loans.use: to buy more salt to preserve fish.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Teresita has a flower garden from which she harvests and sells flowers, such as orchids. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for her flower garden.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her flower garden.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is a 44-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. Her husband works as a journalist. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Tam has been earning a living by running a food stall from the door of her house for the past five years. She sells noodles. 

She would like to borrow money to expand her business, to buy more furniture, bowls, chopsticks and meats. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture, bowls, chopsticks and meat for her food stall.

loans.name: Allah Walle Group

texts.fr:
Mme SAFOURA est la représentante du groupe ALLAH WALLE. Elle est  mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âge 03ans. 03 va  à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes  en charge.

Elle est gérante d’un kiosque depuis 01an. Elle s’approvisionne  dans une boutique et au  marché de pissy en ville. Ses clients sont  les jeunes du quartier.

Elle veut  s’acheter  02caisses de bière, 02caisses de sucrerie grosse bouteille et 01caisse de sucrerie petite bouteille.

 Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité et assurer son bien être. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une moto, une parcelle et assurer l’éducation  de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mme SAFOURA is the representative of the group called ALLAH WALLE. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest three years old. She is responsible for two other people. 

She has been managing a kiosk for one year. She buys her merchandise in a store and at the Pissy Market in town. Her customers are the young people of the neighborhood. 

She wants to buy two cases of beer, two cases of big bottles of soda, and one case of small bottles of soda. 

Mme Safoura uses her profit to bolster her business and to insure her well-being. Her ambition is to buy a motorcycle and a plot of land, and to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas for resale.

loans.name: 74-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thiện works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to to purchase pigs and chickens and ducks to raise.

Thiện is 56 years old and she is married with four children. Thiện is the group leader of the 03.7.74.Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, and she has no dependents

In 2010, Thiện joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thiện has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thiện has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thiện faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thiện hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and she hopes her children will find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and chickens and ducks to raise.

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Samet, 27, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over six years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economic situation, Samet is requesting a loan of USD 700 to raise capital for her business to purchase more groceries to resell. This purchase would enable her to generate more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to purchase timber to cover her house’s walls and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Kim Than

texts.en: Kim Than is 45 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $8 per day. Two of her children are construction workers. They earn about $6 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Kim Than is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase cosmetics for her daughter to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her daughter’s business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for her daughter to resell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita vive en una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad de Santa Cruz. En dicha zona no se cuenta con transporte público pero aquí en Bolivia se a implementado un nuevo servicio de transporte como los trufis, son vehículos de cuatro puertas que en vez de hacer un servicio de taxi lo hacen de trufis con una sola ruta definida a un barrio, la señora cuenta con un vehículo que lo hace trabajar de trufi y percibe una renta de este servicio pero como ella cuenta con dos hijos de este ingreso les alcanza para subsistir, pero en su vivienda aun le falta algunos arreglos ya que tiene dos cuartos los cuales no tienen techo, para esto es el préstamo que necesitan ya que su esposo no se encuentra en el país por que fue a buscar un futuro mejor para su familia, pero aun no ha conseguido un trabajo todavía, el crédito es para que esta familia pueda terminar de construir su casa que está incompleta y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señora Margarita lives in a district that is quite a distance from the city of Santa Cruz. In this area there is no public transportation, but here in Bolivia they have set up a new transportation service, such as the trufis (minibuses). They are vehicles with four doors that, instead of providing taxi service, have a single defined route to a neighborhood. Señora Margarita has a vehicle that she has working as a trufi, and she receives a rental fee for this service. But as she has two children, this income is sufficient for subsisting, but their home still needs some work, since she has two rooms that do not have a roof. The loan that she needs is for this, since her husband is not in the country, because he went to look for a better future for his family, but he still has not found work. The loan is so that this family can finish building their house, which is incomplete, and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Ayewa Bella

texts.fr: Âgée de 18 ans, Ayewa Bella a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Ayewa Bella n'est pas mariée. Ayewa Bella vit seule, et assure toute seule ses divers besoins. Pour cette raison, Ayewa Bella vend de la nourriture dans une école depuis trois ans. Ayewa Bella s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Ayewa Bella devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Ayewa Bella sollicite une deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments, du riz et  du haricot.

loans.name: Manik

texts.en:
Manik is a 33-year-old married woman with one son who is engaged in cultivating vegetables and selling them in the market. Through her job, she works to support her family, to improve her business and to continue growing. She is a very determined person who wants to continue growing. 

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other vegetables and fruits to continue to increase her sales. Manik is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that she is receiving.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is married with four children.She lives in Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam.Her two sons are in secondary school.Rosemary is self employed and own a shop near her residence.The shop sells different consumable items.Mainly food items,which have high demand.The shop provides her with an opportunity to raise her children.She would like to expand her business so that she can meet costs of educating her children.The shop employs herself and her sister.To expand her business she needs USD 750.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Nur

texts.en:
Nur A. is 25 years old and has seven-year- old-twins, "Siti Amaliyah and Siti Alawiyah". She sells snacks, beverages, kerosene, and even cosmetics in her store. All $50 loan obtained from MBK will be used to purchase merchandise for her store. Her daily revenue is IDR 300.000 with IDR 40.000 profit. She feels supported becoming an MBK member since the loan payment is affordable and the term is sufficiently long.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: George intends to expand and diversify his business

loans.name: Alma Mireya

texts.es:
Eight years ago and motivated by the desire to improve her family's quality of life, Alma started her own business by selling shoes from a catalog. She is married and has two children ages 10 and 15 years old. Her husband is a laborer and works on his own. That has made it a little difficult to get what her family needs. Alma wants to give her kids and education so they have a better future, but with her husband's salary alone, it is not possible.

She likes sales and her character has help her very much in growing as an entrepreneurial woman. Now her orders have increase considerably and needs a $1,200.00 dollars loan to fulfill them.She commits herself to return this amount in only 3 months. She trusts the speed of rotation of her products.and her ability. Contribute to the growth of this business! You can be an important part of this family's life. Thank you

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace ocho años Alma inició su propio negocio con la venta de calzado por catálogo, motivada por el deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 10 y 15 años de edad. Su esposo es obrero y trabaja por su cuenta. Esto ha dificultado un poco el obtener lo necesario para su familia. Alma quiere que sus hijos puedan estudiar y tengan un mejor futuro, pero sólo con el salario de su esposo esto no es posible.

El gusto por las ventas y su carácter le han ayudado mucho a crecer como microempresaria. Ahora sus pedidos se han incrementado considerablemente y necesita de un préstamo de $1,200 dólares para poder surtirlos. Ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses, porque confía en la rapidez de rotación de sus productos. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida de esta familia, gracias.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her shoe business.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde is 48 and is married to Julio who is 46. They have 5 kids who are 28, 26, 22, 18 and 16. Their three eldest sons work and their 2 younger daughters are in high school.

Clotilde tells me that her husband used to be a salesman for his brother's company where they made foods like sauages, chorizo (spicy sausage) etc. It was there that he learnt the secrets of making these products.

Her husband, after working for his brother for 7 years, decided to start his own factory to make more money.

Now they both work making and selling food products. Julio goes out to sell them on his own motorbike. He says that he is very sucessful and his clients increase each day due to the good quality of his products. They are united and will work until the end to overcome each day.

Clotilde's dream, the same as her husband Julio's, is to expand their small factory by increasing their food production levels and obtaining more income.

They now need a loan in order to buy the basic ingredients which they use to make their products such as: bacon rinds and condiments.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Clotilde tiene 48 años y está casada con Julio que tiene 46 años. Tienen 5 hijos de 28, 26, 22,18 y 16 años de edad. Los tres hijos mayores ya trabajan mientras que las dos hijas menores van aún a la secundaria. Clotilde comenta que anteriormente su esposo trabajaba como vendedor para una empresa, propiedad de su hermano, en donde se fabricaban embutidos de todo tipo como ser: salchichas, chorizos, fiambres, etc. Fue allí que aprendió los secretos para fabricar dichos productos. Su esposo, después de trabajar 7 años como empleado de su hermano, un día decidió montar su propia fábrica a fin de obtener mayores ingresos. Hoy día ambos se dedican a la fabricación y venta de embutidos, Julio sale a vender en una moto que es de su propiedad. Afirma que tiene mucho éxito y que día a día va aumentando su clientela debido a la buena calidad de sus productos. Ambos son muy unidos y trabajan con el fin de ir superándose día a día. El mayor deseo de Clotilde, al igual que el de su esposo Julio, es el de agrandar aún más su pequeña fábrica a fin de aumentar la producción y generar mayores ingresos. En esta oportunidad necesitan de un préstamo para adquirir la materia prima que emplean en la elaboración de sus embutidos como ser: almidón, tocino y condimentos.

loans.use: To buy bacon, condiments/Compra de almidón, tocino, condimentos

loans.name: Kayissan

texts.fr:
Madam T. Kayissan was born on January 25, 1982 in Lomé. She is a married mother of two children and takes care of her sister's two children. She buys and sells groceries. Her income is too low to buy sufficient supplies for her shop, which has resulted in a loss of customers. Very ambitious, and wanting to be at the top of her trade, she is asking for a credit of $600 to build her business. This will allow her to re-stock her supplies and satisfy her customers on time.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Kayissan est née le 25 Janvier 1982 à Lomé, mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants et à sa charge deux (02) de ses sœurs. Elle est revendeuse des produits d’Alimentation générale. Ses moyens sont très limités pour approvisionner sa boutique ce qui fait qu’elle perd sa clientèle car elle n’est pas en mesure de les satisfaire. Très ambitieuse, et voulant être à la hauteur de son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour renforcer la capacité de ses activités. Ceci lui permettra d’approvisionner sa boutique et satisfaire sa clientèle à temps.

loans.use: Buying supplies for grocery store

loans.name: Bakare

texts.en: Bakare G. is 38 years old, married and has 2 children. She hails form Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and provisions. Bakare has been in business since the 1997 and needs the loan to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Mrs Judith is 32 years old and has 5 children together with her husband Eulices.

Judith has had a business selling cold drinks and sweets for a long time. Eulices is a fisherman and he works for himself as he owns 2 little fishing boats. Together they work hard and constantly make an effort to offer well being and security to their beloved children.

Judith requests the loan in order to invest in her business and to help Eulices buy fishing equipment necessary for a good performance. With your help Judith will be able to materialize her objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Judith, se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas y dulces desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene 32 años y es madre de cinco hijos, su querido esposo, Eulices, es trabajador independiente y se dedica a al pesca gracias a que es propietario de dos botes. Judith en compañía de su esposo trabajan arduamente y se esfuerzan a diario a fin de otorgarles bienestar y seguridad a sus queridos hijos.

Ella desea el préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio y sobre todo para apoyar a Eulices con la compra de los materiales de pesca necesarios para su buen desempeño. Con tu ayuda la señora Judith concretará sus objetivos.

loans.use: Buy more supplies for a shop selling refreshments and to buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Wema

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbozi, Tanzania! This is 28 year old Wema M.. She is married with three children, aged 10, 7 and 2. In 2002, Wema established a crop selling business, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed ‘un-creditworthy’ by financial institutions due to a lack of tangible collateral assets. Poor financial support results in poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a ‘sale and leaseback arrangement’.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Esher Tanzanite Group

texts.en:
Esther A. , age 30, has got a child of ten years. She has a salon which she began 4 years ago. She works from 7.30am to 10pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around US$258.

In the past, Esther has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy salon equipments. He hopes for a new loan to start a secretarial service. Esther will share this loan with her subgroup members selling shops, coconut fruits and butchery.

In the picture Esher is in the middle back row

loans.use: to buy a printer and start a secretarial service

loans.name: Orfila

texts.es:
Orfila, who belongs to the community bank, Señor de los Milagros de Ciquian, has business selling groceries in the district of Chiquian, Bolognesi province, in the area of Ancash.

With a loan of S/. 1,200.00 soles ($450.00), Orfila would pay for 6 dues, would buy 2 bags of sugar, 2 containers of milk, 2 boxes of oil, 30 cheese moulds, 2 small boxes of soda , 3 containers of soda gas, and caramels and cookies.

Orfila is 52 years old, is married, and has 4 children, of which two are professionals. Her husband is a businessman, and together they manage the costs of the home and their children's educations.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Orfila, pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros de Chiquian, tiene su bodega de venta de abarrotes, en el distrito de Chiquian, provincia de Bolognesi, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 2 sacos de azúcar, 2 calas de leche, 2 cajas de aceite, 30 moldes de queso, 2 cajas chicas de gaseosa, 3 paquetes de gaseosa de litro, caramelos y galletas.

Ella tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos son profesionales, su esposo también se dedica al comercio y juntos afrontan los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Items for grocery

loans.name: Kaniza

texts.en:
Kaniza Bibi has been married to A. G., a daily wage laborer, for the last 27 years. She has three sons and two daughters. Kaniza’s eldest son manufactures caps for plastic bottles and plastic gallon jugs. The next son to him is in grade eleven and the youngest is in grade five. All of Kaniza's daughters are married and are settled separately in their own houses.

The family has their own machine for manufacturing plastic bottle caps. Their profits per month are approximately $175. Now they need to purchase raw material for their business so that they can promptly fill their orders.

loans.use: To buy raw material for bottle-cap manufacture

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. Carlos Alberto is a 36-year old married man with two children ages 3 and 6 who are in pre-school and the first grade. With his own strength, he has managed to raise four walls and buy some zinc for the roof of what will be his house. With this first loan request, he plans to purchase 30 zinc sheets, both large and small, and the window and door frames. For Carlos Alberto this loan is urgent because he wants to have a house for his wife and children, as they are currently staying with one of his wife’s relatives. At the moment he depends on the salary he receives from the Juigalpa Mayor’s Office, where he has worked as the head of the information technology services for 4 years and 7 months. His wife is completing her studies at the university. Mr. R. is an honest, responsible person with a desire to get ahead personally and for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Carlos Alberto, casado, de 36 años de edad, con 2 hijos de 3 y 6 años que estudian primer grado y primer nivel de educación, con esfuerzo propio ha logrado levantar 4 paredes y comprar una parte del zinc para el techo de la que será su casa, con la solicitud de este primer crédito pretende comprar 30 láminas de zinc largo y pequeño, y los marcos de las puertas y ventanas. Para él es urgente este crédito porque quiere tener su propia casa para sus hijos y su esposa, ya que en la actualidad están habitando en la casa de un familiar de su esposa. Al momento sólo cuenta con su salario que deventa en la alcadia municipal de Juigalpa, como responsable del departamento de informática, con 4 años y 7 meses de servicio, su esposa está finalizando los estudios universitarios. El señor R. es una persona honesta, responsable, con deseos de superacion personal y familiar.

loans.use: Purchase zinc and window and door frames for his home

loans.name: Thi Thuy

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Thuy (ID number: 11030025), 28 years old, is very hard-working and active. Apart from performing agricultural tasks, she also has a general store at home, selling food stuff, fruits, and other things. Her husband makes souvenirs for a living. She has never requested for loans before. Now, she wants to borrow 2,006,000VND (125USD) to purchase more stocks for her general store. Her family's average weekly income is about 300,000VND (approximately 19USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thùy (MS: 11030025), năm nay 28 tuổi. Chị là người chăm chỉ, năng động. Ngoài làm ruộng chị còn bán hàng tạp hóa, thực phẩm, hoa quả tại nhà. Chồng chị làm đồ mỹ nghệ. Trước đây chị chưa tùng vay vốn. Nay chị tham gia chương trình với mức vốn 2.006.000 VND để bổ sung vốn bán hàng. Thu nhập gia đình chị khoảng 300.000 VND/ tuần.

loans.use: Invest in general store

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia started this business because she needed to assist her husband with the household expenses and their childrens’ educations. Her needs included helping her children to get ahead so they could have a better quality of life and better educations. She started approximately 11 years ago selling shoes by catalog to friends and acquaintances, and she has increased her customer base over time.

She needs a loan of $1,025 USD, to be repaid over six months, to purchase merchandise and to fill some orders that are still outstanding for the coming school year.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Cynthia inicio con este negocio por que necesitaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos. Su necesidad en aquel entonces era sacar adelante a sus hijos para que recibieran una mejor calidad de vida y mejores estudios. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 11 años vendiendo calzado por catalogo a conocidos y amigos y actualmente ha incrementado su números de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $1025 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes para el regreso a clases que ya se aproxima.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mwatum's Mkorofi Si Mwenzetu Group

texts.en:
Mwatum is 32 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 14, 9 and 1. She has been a clothes seller since 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Mwatum is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Salhina.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora inicio el negocio para poder darles estudio a sus hijos ya que se quedo viuda y necesitaba pagar las deudas que le dejo el accidente que tuvo su esposo en el cual falleció, aparte de la preocupación de no tener dinero para darles de comer a sus hijos, pagar la escuela; así como otros gastos como pagar renta ya que no tenían vivienda propia. Es por eso que inicio la elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina para poder salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder incrementar las ventas darles a los clientes un producto de calidad.
texts.en:
Nora started her business so her kids could study as she is a widow and needed to pay off the debts that she was left with after her husband had the accident in which he died. Apart from worrying about having no money to feed her kids or pay for their education she also had other costs such as paying rent as they didn't have their own house. This is why she started making and selling flour tortillas - so she could move forward.

She needs a loan of $550 USD, which she will repay over a period of 6 months, to buy basic ingredients to make the tortillas and thereby increase her daily sales and give her clients a quality product.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients/comprar materia prima

loans.name: Time

texts.en: Time, the mother of four children aged 1, 15, 20 and 24, sells a wide variety of products at her small shop, the most popular being fish, charcoal, and small snacks.  She has been in business in Zanzibar for four years and currently earns a profit of approximately $80 each month.  Now, Time is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can add more inventory and increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort D. is a 39-year-old married woman and mother, but she also cares for two of her sister’s kids. Currently three of the kids are in school, while the other children have completed school. Comfort enjoys selling goods, and she takes great pride in her superb customer service. Indeed, for the past eight years, she has been selling beans and maize to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of beans and maize from farmers; by doing so, she avoids dealing with middlemen, who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices.

She is currently seeking a loan to buy beans and maize in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. In turn, she hopes to use some of her profits to support her children in school.

Comfort is a member of a community group known as the Voice Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She notes that she does not sell any goods on days when her group meets, and that her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and to avoid dealing with middlemen by purchasing beans and maize in bulk directly from farmers

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia considers the education of her children as the best treasure that she can give them because it is the only treasure that will not fade away. That’s why she wants to assist her husband to raise income for their daily living. She is married to Felix Sr. who is a government employee.

She has five children: Cristian Rick, 11 months, Katrina, 8 years old and in grade two, Felix Jr., 12 years old, a grade 5 student, Liezel, 15 years old and a junior high school student, and the eldest daughter is Rachelle Cany, 16 years old and in fourth year high school.

In order to increase the volume of her stocks in her village store, Eugenia wants to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000. The loan will be used to buy different merchandise like detergent /bath soap, toothpastes, canned goods like sardines, corned beef, meat and beef loaf, sugar, salt etc. With the additional capital she needs, Eugenia will be able to increase her income in order to buy food, clothing and finance her children who are still studying.

loans.use: Eugenia would like to purchase different products for sale in her store to raise money for her children's education.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Josephine D. from Dar es Salaam. She is widowed with two children between the ages of 4 and 6 years. Josephine has been running a clothes selling business since 2005. Her business is to buy clothes wholesale and sell them on a retail basis.  She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Josephine currently earns about 400 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 750 USD in order to purchase additional stock of clothes. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Josephine thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes.

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar is 25 years old. This man is single. He lives in Khachmaz town. He has run this business for 2 years. This young man not only sells phones and phone accessories, he also repairs phones. His minimum net profit is 600 AZN per month. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy more phones and phone accessories.

Vugar's future plans: He would like to sell all types of phones and phone accessories. He dreams of studying at the university. He plans to study after improving his business and getting more income.

loans.use: to buy phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI sont tous des femmes mariées. Elles ont  en moyenne 20 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles conjugales avec leurs frères, sœurs, enfants et époux. Elles résident dans le village de WEREKELA, sous préfecture de Fana, dans la préfecture de DIOÏLA relevant de la région de Koulikoro en république du Mali. 
Elles font plusieurs activités mais la plus importante est la vente de céréales.
 Dans le souci de développer leur activité elles ont  intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Aucun prêt précèdent n’a fait l’objet de mauvais remboursement.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 1tonne de maïs, 600 kg de sorgho et 450 kg de petit mil auprès des paysans et paysannes du village de WEREKELA et environs pour être revendus  dans le marché de Fana en gros et au comptant. Leur clientèle est composée essentiellement d’hommes. 
Elles comptent obtenir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 10.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the BENKADI group are all married women. They are on average 20 years old and have 2 children. They live in traditional nuclear families with their brothers, sisters, children, and husbands. They reside in the village of Werekela in the Fana sub-prefecture, in the Dioila prefecture in the region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. They engage in several businesses, but the most important is the sale of cereals. With the aim of developing their business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and are now seeking their fifth group loan. None of their previous loans had any problems being repaid. This loan will be used to buy 1 tonne of maize, 600 kg of sorghum, and 450 kg of pearl millet from the farmers in the village of Werekela and the surrounding areas; these goods will be re-sold in the market in Fana at wholesale in cash. Their clientele is composed mainly of men. With this loan, they intend to generate a profit of 10,000 FCFA, which will be used to take care of and pay for the education of their children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa S. is 60 years old, married and blessed with four children.  Two have completed senior high school.  She works with zeal to support her family.  Theresa is a fish monger and she also runs a small grocery shop in a shed in the local market square. Theresa procures her goods at wholesale prices and has been in business for ten years.  According to Theresa, most of her customers are food vendors in her community.  The loan will enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve a larger market and improve her family finances.  She lives with some of her children in a house in Kwahu Da, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.  She is a member of a group called “Anigyee" Trust Group.  Members guarantee one another as social collateral to access and repay loans.

loans.use: Procure fish and tilapia.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.  
Karina es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Karina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, productos que luego comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Karina trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebada, maíz, trigo.
Los sueños de Karina son tener casa propia y comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Milenia Community Bank. She is 21 years old, lives with her husband, and has a one year old son. Karina travels to the different trade fairs of the region to buy cereals which she later sells at the wholesale food market in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, she works as an assistant in the kitchen of a restaurant. She needs a loan of $500 with which she will buy barley, corn and wheat. Karina's dream is to own her own house and buy a car so her husband can go to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of barley, wheat and corn.

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim S. and Memuna T.. They named their group "Hope to God". This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have created a tremendous impact on the businesses and the personal lives of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are asking for a new loan of $600. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses, and consequently make a better profit and improve on their standard of living. 

Ibrahim S. (right) is the leader of this group. Ibrahim is twenty-three years old. He was born in Magburaka town, in Northern Sierra Leone. Ibrahim dropped out of school because his parents could not afford to pay his tuition fees. He started selling used clothes (referred to here as junks or kongo klose) five years ago. Out of his "junks" business he is able to sustain himself and support his parents.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Evelyn Otilia

texts.es: La Sra. Evelyn M. es comerciante su actividad princiapal  es la elaboracion de comida Buffet, boquitas, reposteria y Comida Mexicana,  actividad que realiza junto con su esposo desde hace varios años, cuentan con muy buena clientela,  ya que sabor que le dan a las comidas es exquisito,  son contratados pàra eventos y tambien venden almuerzos a los empleados de las fabricas de tabaco,  tienen 3 hijos uno de ellos esta iniciando su educacion primaria y las otras 2 niñas estan pequeñas, ellos estan solicitando un credito ya que se les presenta una oportunidad de ampliar su negocio, instalaran un cubiculo en uno de los Supermercados de Nuestra Ciudad y no cuentan con los instrumentos y materia prima necesaria para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una buena atencion y asi lograr mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ms. Evelyn M. is a businesswoman whose main activity is making buffet-style food, appetizers, pastries, and Mexican food. She and her husband have been in the food preparation business for several years. They have a good clientele because of the exquisite flavor that they add to their dishes. They are hired to cater events, but they also sell lunch to the tobacco factory workers in the area. They have 3 children—a son who is in elementary school, and two daughters who are younger. Ms. M. and her husband are requesting a loan because they have the opportunity to expand their business. They will set up a cubicle in one of the supermarkets in this city, but they do not have the tools and materials they need to offer their customers good service and improve their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial stove and a freezer

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
CECILIA C. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RICARDO PALMA” con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. César Calvo de Araujo Nº 1030, en el distrito de Callería, tiene 40 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como profesor y tienen 3 hijos mayores.

             Ella tiene 5 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, el cual utilizó para comprar panes, gaseosas y venderlo a sus vecinos, ella tiene la ventaja de que por el sector donde vive no venden pan.

             Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000. Nuevos Soles, comprará una vitrina para exhibir los  agradables panes y biscochos que ofrece.

             Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque sin tanto trámite en comparación con otras instituciones puede obtener un crédito financiero y mantener su negocio.
texts.en:
CECILIA C. S., a member of the RICARDO PALMA Microfinance Institute, lives in the district of Callería. She is 40 years old, and her husband works as a teacher. They have 3 grown-up children together.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. She used her first 300.00 PEN loan to purchase bread and soft drinks so that she could sell them to her neighbors. She has the advantage of being the only person who sells bread in the area.

With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase a showcase so that she can display the delicious bread and cakes that she sells.

She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos because she can obtain a loan and support her business without all the paperwork that the other institutes require.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase display cabinet

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn manages a rice farming business in Barangay San Francisco of Cauayan City. Aside from that, she is also managing a livestock business. She is now seeking the assistance of Kiva lenders to support her rice farming in order to generate a higher yield every harvest. She is requesting to borrow PHP 20,000 that she will use in her rice farming and livestock raising businesses. 

Roselyn is 24 years old. When she was very young, she married Rolando D. R., Sr. who is a farmer. They have been blessed with two children: Rose Mae, 7, and Rolando D. R. Jr, 3. Roselyn is good mother to her children and a good wife to her husband. She hopes to overcome the difficulties of life and give her children a better future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 54 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 20 años cría animales, ya que desde hace muchos años atrás su familia se ha dedicado a estas actividades, pero Maria también cultiva la tierra sembrando papa y maíz principalmente; sus animales los lleva a zonas donde haya praderas de abundantes pastos frescos para alimentarlos, esto lo hace con la ayuda de sus hijos. Después de varios meses, según el peso y tamaño de sus animales los vende en la feria ganadera de su zona. Para su futuro, Maria planea intensificar su actividad ganadera, obteniendo mayores cabezas de ganado. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida con su banco comunal porque es un gran espacio para fomentar la solidaridad, es por eso que renueva su compromiso de trabajo. El dinero que ahora está solicitando será destinado a la compra de un torete de raza para incrementar la cantidad de animales que posee.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old, a widow, and she lives with her 2 children in her own house. For more than 20 years she has been breeding animals as her family did for many years before, but Maria also farms sowing mostly potatoes and corn. She takes the animals to areas with abundant fresh grassland with the help of her children. Several months later the animals are sold at the stockbreeders' fair according to weight and size. For the future, Maria plans to increase her stockbreeding activities buying more cattle. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is very grateful to the community bank for being a space that promotes solidarity and therefore she renews her work commitment. The requested loan will be spent to buy a young bull of breed in order to increase the number of animals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a young bull

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: Doña Silvia Meléndez, casada, reside en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano de  58 años de edad, sus hijos independientes, su negocio es la venta de granos básicos, pollo , verduras y frutas, inicio este negocio con la venta de nacatamales para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia. Su meta es poder vender variedad de productos para crecer cada día más en las ventas. Con este crédito es su séptimo ciclo en cual invertirá en la compra de granos básicos y carne. El cual espera obtener buenas ventas. Da las gracias Afodenic por los préstamos otorgados.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia M. is 58, married, and lives in the neighborhood Monsenor Lezcano. She has children, but they are now independent. Her business is the sale of staple grains, chicken, vegetables, and fruits. She started this business by selling Nacatamales to support her spouse with the family expenditures. Her goal is to be able to sell a variety of products in order to continuing growing her sales. This will be her 7th loan, and she plans to invest it in the purchase of staple grains and meat. She thanks Afodenic for the loans that it has already granted her and looks forward to putting this one to good use.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple grains and meat

loans.name: Flor De Illimani Group

texts.es:
Nicolasa F. de 65 años, vende papa en la feria “16 de Julio” ella pertenece al grupo “Flor de Illimani” del Centro Focal “Los Andes” y necesita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería.Las demás integrantes de “Flor de Illimani” también tienen  sus propios negocios, algunas se dedican a la comercialización  de productos como papa, fruta, carne, embutidos y dulce y otras a la costura de edredones. Todas necesitan  el préstamo para la compra de ropa, naranja, carne y tela. 
Ellas se sienten satisfechas por pertenecer a la familia de Pro Mujer y esperan estar juntas mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Nicolasa F. is 65 years old. She sells potatoes in the “16 of July” market. She belongs to the group “Flor de Illimani” in the Andes Focal Center. She needs the loan to purchase merchandise. The other members of the Flor de Illimani group also have their own businesses. Some sell products such as potatoes, fruit, meat, sausages, and candy while others sew comforters. All of them need the loan to buy clothes, oranges, meat and fabric.

They feel satisfied to be members of the family of Pro Mujer and hope to be together for a long time.  

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (potatoes, oranges, meat) and staples (material)

loans.name: Victoire Fifamè

texts.fr: H. Victoire Fifamè est née le 21/07/1975 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin au quartier minontchou. Victoire Fifamè a comme profession la coiffure, une formation qu'elle a faite après avoir abandonné l’école. Mais Victoire Fifamè réside actuellement au quartier Gbèdjèwin, un quartier de la zone industrielle de Cotonou depuis qu’elle s’est mariée. Victoire Fifamè s'est Mariée à AKODOGBO Dimonthé, un mécanicien-auto. Ce couple a 4 enfants tous scolarisés, âgés respectivement de 12 ans, 7 ans, 5 ans, et 3 ans. Après sa formation en coiffure, Victoire Fifamè a commencé petitement par vendre des produits de coiffure et de toilette en les distribuant sur commande à ses clients. Victoire Fifamè s’approvisionne sur le marché international de Cotonou et celui de Lomé, Capitale de Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Après son mariage, il y a 8 ans, Victoire Fifamè a ouvert son salon de coiffure avec l’aide de son mari. Victoire Fifamè a continué de vendre des produits de coiffure et de toilette, mais dans son salon de coiffure. Victoire Fifamè a ajouté à tout ceci la vente de chaussures, de savons liquides et de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.).  Victoire Fifamè a commencé par prendre de crédits à ALIDé depuis 2006 ; aujourd’hui, Victoire Fifamè est à son cinquième crédit avec ALIDé. Victoire Fifamè sollicite ce crédit pour diversifier ses activités à la vente des produits lubrifiants.

loans.use: Achats de produits de coiffure et de toilette, de divers, de matières premières pour la fabrication de savons liquides et des produits lubrifiants.

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Hamidou Konaté est un homme de 35 ans, père de 2 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille monogame dans le  quartier populaire de Dougounina de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la  vente de divers articles de boutique.
 Avec plus de 10 ans d’expérience dans cette activité, Monsieur Hamidou Konaté maîtrise bien  son activité, est apprécié et sollicité au niveau de tout le quartier. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son père.
 En vue d’obtenir une ressource financière complémentaire indispensable à l’épanouissement de ses activités, Monsieur Hamidou Konaté décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec laquelle, il est à son premier prêt pour acheter d’importante quantités d’articles divers pour sa boutique.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique, à une clientèle composée de  toute la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Hamidou Konaté compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA. 
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique, payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamidou Konaté, 35, is the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in a monogamous family in the working-class neighborhood of Dougounina in the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school, he began earning his living very early, mainly by selling various dry goods. With more than 10 years of experience in this business, he is very good at it and is appreciated and sought after in his community. He learned this business from his father.

In view of obtaining complementary financial resources which are indispensible if Mr. Hamidou Konaté wants his business to flourish, he decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first loan, intending to buy a lot of articles for his shop. He does his buying in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) and sells his goods out of his shop, to a clientele composed of local people. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA. With the profit, he counts on enlarging his shop, paying the interest on the loan, and supporting his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for his shop

loans.name: Bendición De Dios Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Bendición de Dios II esta conformado por Juana Emilia M. V., Daysi R. M. y Karla Vanessa M. M.. Ellas son mujeres muy ingeniosas, inteligentes y decidas a salir adelante.

La coordinadora del grupo es Juana Emilia M. Valera quien tiene un negocio familiar de venta de cosméticos, todos en la casa cooperan y distribuyen la mercadería entre sus conocidos. 

Las otras dos integrantes son Daysi R. M. quien vende nacatamales y ropa usada y Karla Vanessa M. M.  quien vende lámparas y ropa usada.

loans.use: compra de cosmetico como lapiz labial, delineador, sombras, bases, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Joaquim

texts.pt:
NB. Não foi possível retratar a foto no local do negocio devido a distancia.

Pedro Joaquim C. nasceu em Gaza tem 44 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 2 aos 22 anos. 5 é que vão a Escola. para além dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua irmã enviando lhe 500mt ao mês e consegue poupar por 1.000.00MT porque conta com ajuda da sua esposa que também é docente. 

Pedro Sai de Gaza após concluir a 5ª classe é transferido para uma Escola privada a custo do Estado onde fez a 10ª classe, consegue fazer o curso de professorado é afecto para trabalhar no Centro de Formação de Professores na Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia com a categoria de Director do Internato auferindo 7.000.00MT durante 20 anos, de seguida ganha uma bolsa de estudo (nível superior em freqüência). Assim devido à distância e custo de transporte (Namaacha – Maputo e vice versa) diário aproxima se a Hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo, o 1º no valor de 14.000.00MT e o 2º também de 14.000.00MT para dar inicio do seu negócio na tentativa de aumentar a renda familiar. Hoje para além de ser docente tem vendido acessórios de automóvel tal com (óleo, filtros, faróis) adquiridos na África do Sul gastando 5.000.00MT em cada viagem e tendo de lacro um valor de 2.000.00MT tendo semanalmente, a venda é feita por encomendas e pagas em prestações.


Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Pedro na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 14.000,00mt para compra e venda de acessorios para automoveis. O primeiro de 14.000.00MT foi usado para dar inicio do seu próprio negócio, o segundo de 14.000.00MT foi usado para aumentar o volume do stock e pede este terceiro de 14.000.00MT que será usado para comprar acessórios do carro para revenda. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto, pois conta com ajuda da sua esposa que também é docente.
texts.en:
Born in Gaza, 44 year-old Pedro Joaquim C. lives with his partner and six children ages 2 to 22, five of whom are still in school. In addition to providing for his family, he also supports his sister by sending her a monthly allowance of 500mt. With the help of his wife's salary as a teacher, he is able to save 1.000.00mt per month. Pedro left Gaza after finishing 5th grade, when he was transferred to a private school. After finishing 10th Grade and getting his teaching credentials from the Center for Teachers' Education-Namaacha, he started working as director of a Boarding School located on the border of Swaziland. He worked taught there for 20 years. Upon getting a scholarship to a university in Maputo and in order to afford the high extra transportation costs of going back and forth from Namaacha to Maputo, he applied for a couple of loans with Hluvuku to start and stock a business of buying and selling car products and accessories such as oil, filters, headlights, etc. For each 5.000.00MT he now spends per week buying merchandise in South Africa, he profits 2.000.00MT by seeling it in Namaacha. This is Pedros' third loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. He plans to use the 14.000,00 to buy more products and accessories to sell. With the help of his wife, he is confident that he will be able to pay off the loan before its term expires.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more car products and accessories to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos es soltero, no tiene hijos, labora en el Instituto de Nueva Guinea como maestro de educacion primaria, vive en la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea junto su mamá quien tambien es maestra, esta solicitando su 2do crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para construir una  habitación y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar y tener mas privacidad,   este joven se ha caracterizado por ser un docente  muy responsable, honesto, de buena conducta y moral crediticia, profesa la religion evangelica; el y su mamá  son una familia bien unida y comparten con los gastos econòmicos de su casa,  han luchado para seguir  adelante y para seguir estudiando,   este cliente con el crédito anterior logró  comprar dos solares, pues  sueña con tener una vivienda propia con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral, seguir estudiando y salud.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is single, he does not have any children, and he works in the New Guinea Institute as a primary school teacher. He lives in Zone #1 in New Guinea with his mother who is also a teacher. He is seeking his second loan from the AFODENIC institution in order to build a new room and thus improve his home's living conditions, adding more privacy for himself. He has shown himself to be a decent, very responsible, honest, well-behaved, and moral borrower. He practices the Evangelical Christan religion. He and his mother make a truly united family, sharing the responsibility for their household expenses, fighting to prosper, and to continue studying. With his prior loan, this borrower was able to buy two plots of land, and he now hopes to have his own home with better conditions, have stable employment, take care of his health, and continue studying.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing a new room

loans.name: C2867 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Marie Claire is 30 years old, married with 4 children. Marie Claire operates a business selling foodstuffs at Kabuga where she has been the president of a group called “ABISHYIZEHAMWE” since 2003.  The hours of their business require that they work from 6 AM to 7 PM every day.

This group is requesting their first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses through purchasing more foodstuffs for sale. Through this expansion, they hope to attract many customers as well as increasing their profit. With this profit, this group hopes that their lives will change progressively as they can make more money through their efforts, continue to pay school fees for their children, and set aside some savings for their futures.

loans.use: More agriculural products for sale

loans.name: Amicolé

texts.fr: Amicollé S. est une femme de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PLATEAU2 depuis deux ans et demi et y a eu cinq expériences avec le crédit. Elle vend divers produits tel que de l'oignon, de la pomme de terre, du poivre, de l'arachide, du mil, des haricots etc. dans sa cantine au marché. Elle participe financièrement dans la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amicollé S. is a 51-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de PLATEAU2 for 2½ years and has had a record of five loans there. Amicollé sells a variety of goods, such as onions, potatoes, black pepper, peanuts, millet, beans, etc. in her stall at the market. She takes part financially in supporting the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mama Esther, as she is called by her numerous customers, is a 48-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and blessed with two children. She operates a local restaurant at which she prepares and sells local foods like "fufu" and "banku." Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and is eaten with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup. Esther says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more ingredients, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She believes your support would enable her to grow the business.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Puertas Del Sol Group

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes C. integrante del grupo  Puertas del Sol que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana, indica que es la primera vez que se anima a formar parte de un grupo y obtener un préstamo ya que necesita comprar mercadería para abrir su tienda de barrio.
Las demás integrantes del grupo también tienen sus negocios como  la venta de ropa, material escolar, joyas, muebles, arena, dulces y comida. Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios comprando mercadería.
texts.en:
Mercedes C. belongs to the Puertas del Sol Group, which is part of the Panamerican Regional Office. She says that this is the first time she has been inspired to join a group and get a loan, because she needs to buy merchandise to open up a neighborhood store. The other members of the group are vendors, too, selling clothing, school supplies, jewelry, furniture, sand, sweets, and food. They are all in need of a loan to invest in the purchase of inventory for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vannak C. is 39 years old. She is a member of a group bank loan which consists of four people, located in Anlong Romeit Choeng village in Kandal province. The group loan will be used by each member for a different purpose.  

Mrs. Vannak C. is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Now she wants to borrow 800,000 KHR from the Kiva field partner, AMK (Angkor Microfinance Kampuchea), to support her field. Besides being a farmer, she is also a dessert seller. Her husband, Mr. Saroeun Preap, is a policeman who earns a small income to support the family. Mrs. Vannak C. is the mother of four children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To support her field

loans.name: Nadwa

texts.en: Nadwa is a 50-year-old married woman and mother of 2 children. She has owned a small mini-market since 2008. She opened this small business to help her husband with the family's income and to improve their living situation. Her mini-market is situated in a busy area, so she has been able, over the years, to have a growing number of clients pass by her shop and buy all types of food products. Today, Nadwa is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more merchandise in large quantities, so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of office supplies

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es una mujer muy responsable, tiene 48 años y vive con el padre de su único hijo, en su casa rústica ubicada en su chacra.

Desde niña trabaja en las labores agrícolas como le enseñaron sus padres, y le gusta mucho esa actividad. Para ello, junto a su esposo, acude muy temprano a sus campos de cultivo, ya que los higos, manzanas y mangos que produce requieren de sus cuidados. Asimismo, recolecta “cochinillas” (insecto que se usa para producir colorante natural) de las tunas, logrando acumular al día hasta un kilo, vendiéndolo entre 150 y 200 soles. Cuando esperan la cosecha de sus frutas, se dedican a la recolección de este animalito, pues tiene gran demanda. De este modo, es como se gana la vida esta pareja y logran cubrir la educación de su hijo en la ciudad. Para el futuro, Graciela anhela comprarse un terreno en la ciudad para estar más cerca de su hijo y cuidar de que no pase necesidades.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, todos sus créditos anteriores los ha pagado con puntualidad y asiste a todas las reuniones de su grupo. Con el dinero que solicita va a comprar fertilizantes químicos para aplicar a sus chacras de fruta.
texts.en:
Graciela, 48, is a very responsible woman; she lives with the father of her only son in a rustic house built on her farmlands. Ever since she was a young child, she worked alongside her parents doing farming chores; she enjoys her work very much. She, together with her husband, goes to their fields very early because the figs, apples and mangoes she produces require care. In addition, she gathers "cochinillas" (cochineal, an insect used to produce a natural dye) off prickly pears sometimes gathering up to a kilogram a day, that she sells for between 150 and 200 soles. While they wait for harvest time of their fruits, they collect these little animals because they are in high demand. This is how this couple earns their livelihood and are able to pay for their son's education in the city. For the future, Graciela hopes to buy a lot in the city to be closer to her son so that she can insure that he has everything he needs. This is her 5th loan with MFP; she has repaid all her previous loans on time and she attends all the group meetings. She will use these funds to buy chemical fertilizers for her fruit crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Mambo Kwisha Group, Kampala

texts.en:
Betty N., shown in the small photo at the top left, also appears in the big group photo and is the leader of her group. She has a restaurant business that she has been running for four years, preparing all sorts of dishes like matooke (steamed green plantain), rice, posho (a hot, sticky dough made from maize or cassava), Irish potatoes, and sweet potatoes.

Betty is a widow of 48 years with five children and also cares for three relatives. At the moment, she is renting and she is constructing her business premises just next to her home to reduce transport and renting costs. She has also managed to pay school fees for her children out of her business and with the help of loans.

Betty needs a loan to help with buying more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Kilipitige

texts.en:
L. is a 57-year-old married woman living in the town of Akurassa in southern Sri Lanka.  She lives with her husband and nine children.
She has a tea cultivation business and her husband is her partner. She has been doing this business for two years so she has lots of experience in tea cultivation.  She knows all the symptoms of infection of tea plants as a result of her experience.  

L. has asked for a 20,000-LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to further develop her tea plants.

L. is honest and careful in her agriculture business. She hopes to provide a nutritious diet to her family through the additional income her business generates.  

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To expand her tea cultivation

loans.name: Mr. Sam Oak Eang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people in RolE. Kaen village in Kandal province have joined as members of a village bank group. Mr. Sam Oak E. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members. With the money from this loan, they will all invest in their different business ventures. 

Sam Oak and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice in order to support their family. They have two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other is studying in local public school. Although they try to work hard, they do not earn much income. Thus, Mr. Sam Oak E. requested a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. All the members are present in the picture but one of them is blocked from view.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Siriana

texts.en:
Siriana is 25 years old. She installs, services, and repairs refrigeration, air conditioning, and other electrical and electronic equipment. She has been in business for five years, and she operates in town on a busy street that is easily accessible from the town center and from residential areas. Her customers are typically schools, government institutions, and individuals.

Siriana is married and has a son and a daughter.

The primary business challenge Siriana faces is losing bids to larger competitors in town. In addition to this business, Siriana also operates a small retail shop in her residential area, a business she started before her current one.
