Siriana plans to use the 40,000-KES loan to purchase more electrical and electronic parts for installation and repair work. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.

Siriana hopes to "bring up God-fearing children and initiate them into business." In five years, she would like to be a successful businesswoman and to expand her business into selling electrical and electronic hardware.

She describes herself as hardworking, sociable, and God-fearing.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical and electronic parts for installation and service work

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU est composé de six femmes toutes issus du même village et se sont organisées et constituées par proximité et par affinité. Elles sont âgées en moyenne de 35 ans exceptée  Aïcha F. et Ndèye Y. qui sont respectivement de 49 ans et 48 ans (première et troisième sur la photo à partir de la droite). Le groupe est créé le 14 décembre 2008 et ses activités principales sont le petit commerce de légumes, de friperie et l'embouche. L'existence du grand marché quotidien dans la ville est très favorable aux femmes pour l'expansion de leurs activités commerciales. En plus des remboursements réguliers qu'elle font elles ont une bonne capacité de mobilisation d'épargne.

Coumba M. en médaillon sur la photo est née le 16 octobre 1969, elle a 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de légumes et d'huile de palme. Elle poste d'un petit espace au marché central de sa ville où elle a installé une table en fortune pour la vente de ses produits. Elle mène cette activité depuis son intégration dans le Banc Villageois le 14 décembre 2008. En sus de cette activité elle fait de la pâtisserie et vend ses galettes dans les écoles et en faisant du porte à porte. L'objet de son présent crédit est de renforcer sa capacité d'investissement afin d'accroître ses activités et de toucher une plus large clientèle dans le but de réaliser plus de bénéfices. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale, participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille, et à son épanouissement. Par exemple la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
The soldiarity group Sope Seringe Fallou is made up of six women all from the same village who have come together as friends and neighbors.Their average age is 35, with the exception of Aïcha F. and Ndèye Y., 49 and 48 years old respectively (first and third from the right, in the photo). The group was created on December 14 2008 and its main activities are selling vegetables and second-hand clothing, and fattening animals. The town’s large daily market helps the women to increase their business activity. As well as the regular repayments that they are making, they also have the ability and motivation to save. Coumba M., shown in close–up in the photo, was born on October 16 1969, is 41 years old, married and the mother of two dependent children. She has been carrying out this activity since joining the Banc Villageois on December 14 2008. In addition, she makes pastries and sells her goods in schools and door-to-door. The purpose of this loan is to increase her capacity for investment in order to expand her business and to reach more customers, with the goal of making more profit. She aims to support her husband in the household expenses and contribute to the family’s growth and improvement in living conditions, such as health and nutrition.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase investment capacity and promote the group's activities

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people are making a village bank loan which located in Preaek Ta Mem village, Kandal province. Mrs. Na Tai is 41 years old and is a village bank president having been selected by its members. While each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purpose.
Mrs. Na Tai is a farmer who owns a plot of land and rent some piece of land to cultivate rice and peanut for a living. In order to support this farm, she decided to ask for a loan to pay for renting piece of land and to buy fertilizer to grow crops. Her husband, Mr. Lonh Bo, is a construction foreman who is able to receive a small salary to support his family living. This couple has three children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and one is a construction worker while another one is a student in.

loans.use: To pay for renting piece of land and to buy fertilizer to grow crops.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 38-year-old married man living in Lebanon with his wife and 5 children. Ali has been working as a butcher since 1990 and has 25 years of experience. This is Ali’s first time to request a loan from Al Majmoua. He wants to buy two machines for mincing meat according to customers’ needs. Ali is well-known among his neighbors and in his town as an upstanding man who works hard for his family and to grow his business. Ali hopes to expand his work in the future and insure a stable and safe livelihood for his family.

loans.use: In order to buy two machines for mincing meat

loans.name: Dina Marina

texts.es:
La señora Dina Marina R. G. desde hace 17 años se dedica a la venta de tacos y gorditas de harina que ella misma prepara. La parte de enfrente de su vivienda ya esta muy deteriorada a causa de la fuertes lluvias que habido en esta misma ciudad, lo cual es muy preocupante para ella ya que es su único patrimonio familiar. Dina solicita de su apoyo para reparar la pared y así vivir cómodamente sin ningún problema.
Su esposo es un hombre trabajador que tiene como profesión ser carpintero y herrero son como se ayudan para cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en:
Sra. Dina Marina R. G. has been selling tacos and flour gorditas that she prepares herself for the past 17 years.

The front part of her house was badly damaged by heavy rains that came through her city. She is extremely worried because this is her only family asset. Dina is requesting your assistance to repair the wall so that she can live comfortably without any problems.

Her husband is hardworking gentleman. He is a carpenter and blacksmith by trade and helps to cover their expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the wall in the front part of her house

loans.name: Martha Ofelia

texts.es: La  Sra. Martha Ofelia R. C.   ella  es Trabajadora del colegio público “Rodolfo Schear” de San Rafael del Sur  desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene  Veinte y siete año de trabajar para el magisterio es casada actualmente, tiene una niña en Edad escolar y cuatro hijos en la universidad. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para la compra de una computadora para el uso de sus hijos, los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel  le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Martha Ofelia R. C. is an employee of the public school, Rodolfo Schear, in San Rafael del Sur. She works as an elementary school teacher and has been working in teaching for 27 years. She is currently married and has a school-aged daughter and four children in college. She has had seven loans with CEPRODEL and she has used them to purchase construction materials to improve the house in which she lives. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a computer for her children to use. Her loans with CEPRODEL have benefited her in a great way since, as a result, she has improved her living condition and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa R. is a widow who lives in Prk. Paraiso, Brgy. Taloc, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   poultry raising, food vending (bibingka) and a general store.  Adelfa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. 

With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Adelfa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $238, thus raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store and for the maintenance of her piggery and her poultry so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. She also wants to cover fees for her son who wants to work abroad. 

Adelfa R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Stock for the store and maintenance of poultry

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina Z. es una señora de 51 años de edad, casada y madre de siete hijos,  reside en la Aldea La Concepción en Juticalpa, Olancho y se dedica a la elaboración de rosquillas, pan, quesadillas, y hojaldras. De lunes a sábado ella y sus hijas se levantan a las 5:00 am para iniciar la jornada laboral preparando los ingredientes para hornear, y mientras el pan y los demás productos se están horneando ella se va arreglando para salir a venderlos a su puesto ubicado a las afueras de la alcaldía municipal en el centro de la ciudad de Juticalpa y está allí hasta las 6:00 pm. Solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz, leña y dulce, componentes necesarios para preparar sus productos. Con el apoyo de este préstamo espera seguir teniendo una fuente de ingreso para seguir ayudando a sus hijos a terminar sus estudios secundarios.  Desde hace 8 años Alejandrina es clienta de FAMA y con los préstamos que ha obtenido ha podido llevar el sostenimiento a su familia, su sueño es tener una panadería.
texts.en:
Alexandria Z. is 51 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She lives in the borough of La Concepcion in Juticalpa, Olancho and imakes donuts, bread, quesadillas, and wafers.

Monday through Saturday she and her daughters get up at 5:00 am to start the workday by preparing the ingredients for baking. While the bread and other products are baking she gets ready to go sell her products at a stand located outside the municipal hall in the center of the city of Juticalpa. She is there until 6:00 pm.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, wood and sweeteners, all needed in the preparation of her products. With the support of the loan she hopes to maintain a source of income which will help her children to finish high school. Alexandrina has been a client of Fame for the past eight years and with the loans she received has been able to sustain her family. Her dream is to own a bakery.

loans.use: Buy corn, wood and sweeteners

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai T. N. is 49 years old and has 2 children who are at college. She has been running a shop that sells construction materials for many years. Her business is very good. It generates 4,000,000 VND profit per month which she uses to manage her family life and to pay for her children's school fees. Since becoming a client of SEDA in 2006, she has used loans effectively in expanding her business. Now, she needs a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy more materials to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more material to meet customer demand

loans.name: María Eliza

texts.es:
La señora maría Eliza L. J. es comerciante del Mercado mayoreo el bisne desde hace 30 años su negocio está ubicado a una cuadra del sector comercio es una señora luchadora y emprendedora lucha por salir adelante, viuda, y sin hijos a su cargo.
Lleva cinco años de trabajar con Ceprodel en los cuales los financiamientos la han superado bastante ya que su negocio ha crecido bastante y su casa la ha mejorado con las utilidades que le han quedado.
texts.en: María Eliza has been a wholesale merchant for the past 30 years. Her business is located one block from the commercial center. She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who works hard to make headway. She is a widow and has no children under her care. She has worked with Kiva partner Ceprodel for the past five years, and the loans have helped her improve her quality of life quite a bit since her business has grown and her home has improved its utilities.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: Pheobe

texts.en:
39-year-old Phoebe is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya.  She has been in the farming business for 16 years, producing maize, beans, vegetables, and eggs. She has employed one farmhand.  She has 3 children, all of school-going age.

She has requested this loan of 40,000 KES to enable her to expand her poultry business.  She says this loan will provide income that will ensure that her children get enough food as well as education.  She hopes to have a bigger farm in the future.

She does not have any income of her own but believes her husband, who operates a second-hand cloth business, may help in repaying the loan once given.  She would like Juhudi Kilimo to advance higher amounts to enable clients to have bigger businesses.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Clara Virginia

texts.es:
Clara Virginia A. M. tiene 54 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Clara se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 20 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar casa.
Le gusta asistir a la iglesia los domingos.
texts.en:
Clara Virgina A. M. is 54 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and their children in Ventanas Canton in Los Rios Province. They have 3 children.

The members of the V.R.C. “UNIDOS SOMOS MAS” {Together We Are More] are in the area El Maranon, near the Puerto Pechiche parish part of Pueblo Viejo Canton. This service point is dedicated to farming short cycle crops like corn, rice and beans.

Clara has grown corn, rice and beans for twenty years. She buys her supplies in Comercial Lopez in Ventanas y sells her products in the market of Ventanas in the area of Maranon. 

She is requesting the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops. It will provide economic support to her household. They face challenges like plagues, illnesses and weather changes.  Her dream is to buy a house and she likes to attend church on Sundays.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Mari Luz, quien vive en la zona  D. Barrio San Sebastián de Presidente Franco.
 La Señora decidió formar el comité en la zona, para ello  Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el grupo en su comunidad.
El comité se Denómina “La Paz” están en el Séptimo  Ciclo   con 20   integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas   y responsables entre ellas, las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan labores para la recaudación de la caja chica.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Elizabeth quien se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales.
Esta actividad lo viene realizando hace un buen tiempo y le deja buena ganancia ya que ella compra los remedios en gran cantidad por bolsa y lo fracciona en pequeñas cantidades para volver a vender.
Para la compra de nuevas mercaderías (bolsa de manzanillas, boldos, y otros) ella solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sra. Mari Luz led the organization of this committee.  She lives in the San Sebastian neighborhood of Presidente Franco.  It's a local committee that she organized by asking her friends and neighbors to join.  The group is called "La Paz" (Peace) and is now starting its seventh round of fundng with 20 members.  The group is notable in the neighborhood for being united and responsible in their dealings with one another.  The members share an entrepreneurial spirit and all operate small businesses.
One of the members is Sra. Elizabeth who operates a business selling herbal medicines.  She has operated the business for a while now and it's profitable because she buys wholesale supplies of the herbs and sells them in smaller batches.  She will use the loan to buy supplies of new herbal medicines (bags of apple blossom, boldos, etc.).

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of herbal medicines.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Trinidad; ella tiene 45 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de compra y venta de ganados vivos que luego lo distribuye a sus clientes y a personas que le solicitan y a la vez vende en su propio estableciento, lleva años en este negocio siendo la única actividad que realiza y de esta forma saca a su familia adelanta.

La socia solicita solicita el préstamo para poder  comprar ganado que luego lo venderá a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Trinidad belongs to the "Qori Orcco" community bank which is located in Urcos district, in Quispicanchis province , in Cusco department.

Trinidad is 45 years old, married and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying live animals which she then sells to her customers and other people who request it.  She also makes sales from her own premises.  She has been in this business for years and it is the only business activity that she carries out.  Her business allows her to get her family ahead.

Trinidad is requesting a loan so that she can buy live animals which she will later sell to her customers.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy animals which she will then sell to her customers

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.fr:
Henry M. est un commerçant âgé de 30 ans qui habite la Commune  urbaine de Buyenzi en Mairie de Bujumbura. Il fait le commerce des produits de boutique depuis 10ans. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 2e année de L’Université. Il est marié à Linda Nzorubara qui étudie à L’Université. Ils ont 1 enfant âgé d’une année. Il arrive au 7e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de  boutique notamment des haricots, savons et divers autres articles à revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Il espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, il pourra acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison et  assurer les besoins élémentaires familiaux. 

Il  est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Baraka» qui signifie benedictions.
texts.en:
Henry M. is a 30-year old businessman, who lives in the urban district of Buyenzi in the municipality of Bujumbura. He has been selling products in his shop for ten years. He attended school up until his second year at university. He is married to Linda Nzorubara, who is studying at university. They have one child who is one year old. Henry is on his seventh community loan from Turame.

He is requesting the Kiva loan to increase his capital by buying large quantities of goods for his shop, notably beans, soaps and various other items, in order to resell them to his customers and be able to increase his savings. With the savings he makes with this loan, he hopes that he will be able to buy a piece of land to build his own house on and also provide for his family's basic needs. 

He is a member of the "Baraka" community group (Baraka means blessing or benediction).

loans.use: Increase his capital by buying large quantities of goods for his shop, notably beans, soaps and other goods to resell

loans.name: Cristobal De Jesus

texts.es: Cristóbal De Jesús tiene 49 años, el tiene 2 hijos menores que están a su cargo. Por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de triciclo taxi, pues tiene más de 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad para él es muy importante ofrecer un buen servicio ya que así obtiene más clientes. Todos los días el se preocupa por proporcionarle a su familia lo más necesario en su hogar, el es un hombre que disfruta de salir todos los días a los diferentes lugares que sus mismos clientes lo conducen.
texts.en: Cristóbal de Jesús is 49 years old and has two young children under his care.  This is why his job is providing taxi service with a three-wheeled vehicle.  He has been in this business for more than three years and it is very important for him to offer good service, as that is how he gets more customers.  Every day, he worries about providing his family with the most necessary items in his house.  He is a man that enjoys going out every day to the different places that his customers have him go.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosibel Estela

texts.es:
Rosibel, de 26 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera de dos hijos, el primero de 8 años y el segundo de 3 años de edad. Rosibel vive con su madre quien le enseño un oficio para que se pudiera defender y es la elaboración de empanadas,  tiene ya 7 años de dedicarse al negocio, de lunes a sábado.
Actualmente ella necesita comprar productos como plátano, leche y leña, que son los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de las empanadas, tal situación la lleva a solicitar un préstamo pues no cuenta con lo necesario en dinero para realizar dicha compra.
Con el otorgamiento del préstamo ella espera invertir bien los fondos, mantenerse en el negocio, tener ingresos constantes,  proveer para sus hijos la alimentación, y en un futuro sueña con tener su propia casa y que sus hijos estudien preparándose para tener mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Rosibel, 26, lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department.  She is a single mother of two children; the oldest is 8 and the youngest is 3.   Rosibel lives with her mother who taught her a skill so that she could fend for herself: making turnovers.  She’s been in this business for 7 years now, Monday through Saturday.

She needs to buy products like bananas, milk and firewood which are the materials needed to make the turnovers.  This situation necessitates her asking for a loan because she does not have the necessary money to make the purchase.

She expects to invest the funds from the granted loan well, to stay in business, have steady income, provide food for her children, and in the future have a house of her own and that her children study and prepare themselves so that they will have better opportunities.

loans.use: To buy products: banana, milk and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying beans for retail sale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita P., 52, aims to go against the common notion of mediocrity with regard to her business. She is happily married to Norberto, 52, a bus conductor.  They are blessed with two children who are already working. Together, they live in Molino, Bacoor, Cavite.

Running a sari-sari (variety) store is Teresita's occupation. She has run this small-scale business for five years. She adapts well to the trends in her neighborhood when it comes to popular brands of food, shampoo, and drinks.  She also sells some children's toys, accessories and kitchen merchandise.  Because of her expertise in this field, she earns at least Php10,000 monthly.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to request a Php50,000 loan. She intends to use this loan to buy more quality merchandise to sell in her store. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store.

Teresita is doing everything she can in order to see her business grow and expand. She wants to become successful in life, be it in her family life or in her business.  She wants to start another store as a branch someday.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To replenish her store's stock

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more fish for her fish vending business.

Stella has been in this business for three years and earns additional income from a trisikad transport business.

Stella has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of improving her business and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Matura Ole

texts.en:
Matura Ole M. has been a business man operating a hotel for the last five years. He is 44 years old, married and blessed with five children.

He learned about KADET Ltd from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. This is his first loan which he plans to spend to buy dry foodstuffs for the hotel (e.g. rice, sugar, flour, etc.) He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in the business and part for farming.

Matura’s dreams are to be the best and well-known businessman in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to buy dry food stuffs for the hotel, e.g rice, sugar, flour

loans.name: Unenjargal

texts.en:
Unenjargal, 29 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His older daughter, age 10, goes to a local secondary school, while the younger one, who hasn't yet reached school age, stays home.

With the help of his wife, Unenjargal manages a coal and brick-trading business that he started in 2004. The coal-trading business is profitable during the cold seasons, while brick-trading is popular during warm seasons. He has gained much experience and is planning to have his own working place in the future because he currently faces high rental expenses. Unenjaral is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to sell in the summer.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks.

loans.name: Rosa Elba

texts.es:
Rosa Elba  y su esposo son una familia de comerciantes que desde hace un año cuenta con su negocio de venta de tacos y gringas comida típica de la región, que es  carne con condimento rojo puesta en un trompo y se pone en tortilla maíz pequeña y la Gringa es con la misma carne y queso pero con tortilla de harina  y son  acompañados con cilantro, cebolla y salsa. El negocio se ubica en una avenida muy transitada y en una colonia lejos de la ciudad donde se encuentran pocos negocios.
 Esta pareja es quien prepara esta comida para ofrecer a sus clientes a un bajo precio y esta es su única fuente de ingresos por lo que desea comprar la materia prima como lo es la carne, condimentos, tortillas para seguir generando ingresos para su gasto familiar.
texts.en:
Rosa Elba and her husband are a family of salespeople who, for one year, have owned a business selling tacos and gringas which are traditional food in the region.  The tacos consist of meat with red spices which are cooked on a spit and then put on a small corn tortilla.  'Gringas' are the same meat with cheese but on a flour tortilla and served with cilantro, onion and salsa.  Their business is located on a very busy avenue, in a district far from the city where there are few businesses.

The couple prepare the food themselves to sell to their customers at a low price and this is their only source of income.  For this reason, Rosa Elba would like to buy raw materials such as meat, spices and tortillas so that they can continue making income to cover their family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.en:
Anastacia runs a small bakery producing and selling candies. She makes the candies from milk, coconut, and different fruits. She has operated her candy shop for around three years. She plans to use this loan to buy goods to produce different candies using sugar, flour, coconut, milk, fruits, etc.

She has successfully repaid her fourth loan and this will be her fifth one with Esperanza. Anastacia has four children and a long-term partner, all of them are living together in a very far community surrounded by vegetation, hills, and a river. Her children are studying and they are in a young ages. She said that her biggest challenge is to overcome her mother's illness. 

Anastacia is the group coordinator of her group Mujeres Emprendedoras (women entrepreneurs) 1 & 3. Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients (many of whom have recently immigrated to the DR). The group is based in Puerto Plata, in a community that has unreliable access to running water, electricity, and lacks trash service.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, coconut, milk, fruits, etc. to make candies for her candy shop.

loans.name: Zultsetseg

texts.en:
Zultsetseg is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children, aged 9 and 12, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house in the outer ger (traditional Mongolian housing tent) districts. 

She sells hats at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. Her husband works as a driver and also in the used clothing wholesale aftermarket. 
 
Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract with Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand. When Zultsetseg first began her business, she rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for her because the middleman could dismiss her at any time. 

In 2003, however, Zultsetseg had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul in order to make her business more stable. Now her working capital is almost 4 million MNT, and she sells hats. 

For the past 11 years, Zultsetseg and her husband have been successfully improving their living conditions gradually. For example, they bought a used microbus with 3,500,000 MN of their business earnings in 2005.

With this loan of 1,300,000 MNT, Zultsetseg will purchase more hats from Ereen City, China. Zultsetseg wants to use this loan to help support her in this very busy shopping season of the year.

loans.use: to purchase more hats to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Yolita

texts.en: Yolita is married with 4 children.  She is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. Yolita is a farmer and raises livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase livestock feed.  Yolita has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: She is 28 years old and married with four children.  Three of her children are now in school. If she can open a beauty salon, she can send another child to school.

loans.use: To open a beauty salon

loans.name: Mahmad

texts.ru: Махмад проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 34 года. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Он разводит мелко - рогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кроме того он выращивает овощи для продажи. В этой области он уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Mahmad lives in the Jililkul region. He is 34 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. He does animal husbandry and grows plants. He breeds small horned cattle for future resale. He also grows vegetables for sale. Mahmad has been in this business for ten years. He is taking out the loan to buy small horned cattle to increase their headcount.

loans.use: to buy small horned cattle

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Mr. Uk and his wife work hard to support their family through their farming business.  They earn approximately $3 per day.  They have eleven children.  Five are now married and living separately.  They would like a loan of $500 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farming materials for the upcoming planting season.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.name: Delia Maria

texts.es: Delia Maria está casada tiene 3 hijos y trabajan de manera independiente.Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante y en su domicilio. Empezó vendiendo leña y frijoles luego con golosinas y helados hasta que logro ampliarse con otros productos. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que requiere de mucho esfuerzo. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de mangos, melones, naranjas, sandias, zapote entre otros. Ella está agradecida a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en: Delia María is married and has three children who work independently.  She’s a fruit and vegetable street vendor and also sells from home.  She started out selling firewood and beans then sold snacks and ice cream until she was able to expand into other products.  She comments that her work is very demanding because it requires much effort.  She is asking for the loan to buy mangoes, melons, oranges, watermelons and zapote, among others.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it gives her.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is a farmer who lives in a village with his wife and their five children. He and his wife plant and harvest rice and vegetables for sale. Some of their children did not pursue their studies because they could not afford to finance them all. Two of them are presently studying and they want them to finish their studies despite the hardships and difficulties of life. 

In this regard, Virgilio wants to increase his yields to earn a higher income and support the education of their children, and to acquire their daily basic needs. He wants to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay labor costs for transplanting rice seedlings. He hopes that the loan will help a lot to increase their yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay labor costs for transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Gold Group

texts.en:
Prosper, who is in his mid 30s, is married with three children, all of whom go to school. He has had a business selling chips for three years now. He works from 7a.m to 11.30pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
This will be his 4th Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania, given in the middle of the main loan, which motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their loans smoothly to receive half the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. Prosper used his previous loans to buy a sofa set, TV set, to start making bricks, and pay his children's school fees and his household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy one bag of Irish potatoes, one big bucket of cooking oil and one sack of charcoal. His dream is to be able to finish building his house one day.
He will share this with his loan group "Gold," which has a total of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy one bag of Irish potatoes, one big bucket of cooking oil and one sack of charcoal.

loans.name: Nijat

texts.en:
Nijat, age 23, sells groceries from his food store in the city of Sabirabad, where he lives. His vending location is well-known for good prices that are lower than market prices. Nijat knows his customers’ preferences and offers only high-quality groceries. He has been in the grocery trade for about three years. His business has been marked with consistent stability. His mother is actively helps him: it was she who brought the idea of opening his own shop. 
 
Nijat is hoping to invest a loan of 1,500 AZN in additional merchandise, which will help him eventually to increase his turnover capital.  Nijat has a vision for the expansion of his trade that will be helpful in his entrepreneurial endeavors. The loan will help Nijat to persist, take small steps at a time toward his goal, and achieve success.

Nijat has a good client history and this will be his second loan from AqroInvest.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to offer for sale in his store

loans.name: Geronides

texts.en:
Geronides is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Geronides has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands like caldereta (comforting beef stew), afritada (tomato-based chicken dish) & bulalo (stew made from beef shanks and marrow bones). She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.
Geronides has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Geronides hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands (tasty dishes)

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es:
María casada, su esposo taxista, sus hijos estudiantes de secundaria, trabaja para un laboratorio como empacadora desde hace un tiempo. Sus planes son mejorar poco a poco la infraestructura de su vivienda. También tiene como otros ingresos el alquiler de cuartos. 
Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrín, láminas de zinc, ladrillos, barrillas para soldar, perlines, entre otros materiales. Que serán utilizados en el cambio de los perlines de madera por los perlines de hierro, así también el cambiar el techo que está en mal estado que se le pasa el agua, el repecho de las paredes y colocación de ladrillos ya que su suelo es embaldosado. Al realizar estas mejoras obtendrá comodidad, seguridad ante cualquier desastre y prevenir enfermedades. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo de lograr unas de sus metas y la oportunidad del crédito. Siendo de gran impacto de cambio en su vida.
texts.en:
María is married and her husband is a taxi driver. Her children are in secondary school. She has worked for a laboratory as a packer for some time. Her plans are to improve the infrastructure of her house. She also has other income from renting rooms. 
 
With the loan, she will buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, gravel, zinc sheeting, bricks, rods for welding, metal beams and more. These will be used to replace the wooden beams with the iron ones as well as replace the roof, which is in such poor condition that water is coming through. The walls will be re-plastered and bricks put down on the floor because her floor now is slab. With these improvements, she will have comfort, security against disasters and disease prevention. She is She is thankful to the bank for its support in achieving one of her goals. This will have a big impact and change her life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and do some home improvements.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 24-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be social. She operates a beauty salon business, where she offers hair and beauty services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenges to be stiff competition and power rationing. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy a steamer for treating hair. Her business goal is to own a modern salon salon, with all the salon equipment needed to give the best touch to all clients, within five years.

loans.use: To purchase a steamer for treating hair.

loans.name: Chankrisna

texts.en:
Chankrisna (in the photo) and her husband, Moa, live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Moa is a fisherman. In addition, he is also a rice farmer and drives a horse cart to carry goods for his fellow villagers. Chankrisna sells the fish that her husband catches in the local market. They have been married since 1989 and have three sons and four daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment workers and the other four attend school.

Chankrisna is asking for a loan of $500 to support her husband’s fishing business by buying one more boat and additional fishing nets.

loans.use: to buy one more boat and additional fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is married and blessed with five children, and two of them are in school. He has been operating a van transport business to support his family. He also does dairy farming to earn more income. He has employed one person to help him to manage the business. Wilfred has been able to retain his business because of a good reputation with his customers. 

He is requesting for a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en: Khoder is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man living with his one parent and sibling. His father is working as a construction worker and he’s the one taking care of the family. He has a previous experience of three years working in a local clothing shop. Since Khoder wishes to help his father with the family expenses, he decided to start his own business last year. He sells children clothes, in addition of selling traditional dresses. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to restore his shop. This may help him attract additional clients, thereby increasing his sales and returns. In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to restore his shop.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has three children. 

Carol has a shop that sells beauty and cosmetic products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy products from Natasha and Avon to sell.

Carol has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Carol hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy products from Natasha and Avon to sell.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en: Sambo, 45, is widow and lives with her two children in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer and raises ducks. One of her children works in Phnom Penh  and another one helps her raising ducks. Sambo is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to open a new grocery store in order to generate more income for supporting her family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery seling business and rebuild her house.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Sixty-five-year old Japheth is married and a father to many children who are all above 18 years of age.  He is in the business of selling animal feed in a shop and he has done this business for the past 30 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He has applied for a loan that he will be using to expand his business by adding more animal feed for sale.  He hopes that the profits will scale up from this business boost so that he can make more profit.

His dream is to start a company of his own.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying animal feed for his shop.

loans.name: Gombre Group

texts.fr:
Mr SAYOUBA représente le groupe  GOMBRE. Il est célibataire sans enfant.
Mr est tailleur depuis 04ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur en ville. Ses clients sont les amis et voisins.
Mr veut s’acheter 01 rouleau de popeline, 01paquet de fermeture et 01boite de boutons confondus.
Il épargne ses bénéfices. Mr ambitionne agrandir son d’activité et aider ses parents dans les charges  familiales.
texts.en: Sayouba represents the Gombre group. He is unmarried and has no children. He has been a tailor for 4 years. Sayouba stocks up at the market in his town. His customers are friends and neighbors. He wants to purchase 1 roll of poplin, 1 package of closures, and 1 box of assorted buttons, and plans to save his profits. Sayouba's goal is to expand his business and to help his parents with the family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 1 roll of poplin, 1 package of closures, and 1 box of assorted buttons

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un infirmier du nom de Hyppolyte. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Julienne assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Julienne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour ce faire, Julienne vend des boissons et de l'huile de palme à son domicile depuis sept ans. Julienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Nigéria. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Julienne sollicite pour une quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and palm oil

loans.name: Olouwa Lache Group

texts.fr: OLOUWA LACHE  est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont de la même famille. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sènami Brigitte B. (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 33 ans. Sènami Brigitte B. a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Sènami Brigitte B. est mariée à un couturier du nom de Mahomed. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sènami Brigitte B. vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Sènami Brigitte B. et son mari. Pour cette raison, Sènami Brigitte B. vend des mèches à son domicile et dans son actelier depuis huit ans. De façon secondaire, Sènami Brigitte B. vend du riz accompagné de diverses sauces, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Sènami Brigitte B. s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sènami Brigitte B. sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe OLOUWA LACHE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches, des condiments et du riz.

loans.name: Susila

texts.en:
Susila is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her husband and a 4-year-old child in a village of Koraput District, Odisha. She is engaged in vegetable cultivation and selling. She has been doing this business for the last eight years. Her husband helps her in this business. She earns 5,000 INR per month from this business. Susila is a very hardworking and responsible woman. 

Susila has requested this loan to take land on lease so she can produce more vegetables and can make more money. She dreams to build a house for her family. Susila is thankful to kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to take land on lease so he can produce more vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of farming inputs in his shop.

loans.name: Rusiah

texts.en:
Rusiah is 35 years old. She runs a business selling gasoline and various snacks on the side of the road from a stall that is made of bamboo. Because of the strategic location, there are many different people who buy from there. The loan that she asked from MBK for $50 will be used entirely to buy what might be needed for the stall. Daily income can reach $10.

Translated from Indonesian by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her kiosk

loans.name: Nabieva

texts.en:
Nabieva S. has been engaged in trading since her youth. She likes her job and it helps her and her family. She has three children and two grandchildren. Her husband is the driver of a microbus. Her two sons are  metal turners.

They are a friendly family and live together in one house. With her last loan she increased her assortment of toys. Now she plans to open another section in her shop to sell household goods.

loans.use: Expand her shop

loans.name: Regina

texts.pt:
Regina J. was born August 1, 1956 in the Chamanculo neighborhood of Maputo. Her parents abandoned her when she was 5 and she went to live with another woman and was raised by that woman's mother. At the age of 13, she lost this second mother and went to live with her older brothers until she was 19 years old. She studied through the 7th grade. She also had small businesses. When she was 30, her older brothers died and she lived with her nephews.

She learned to weave textiles, and she made cloth and towels for sale. Later, she left this activity to sell drinks instead. She also tutored children from grades 1 through 5 in her home, and was able to save enough money to build a stand where she carries out her business today.

She lives with 8 people, 6 of whom she supports. She learned of Hluvuku through a neighbor. Because she is disabled and cannot move about easily, she took advantage of the fact that one of the loan officers works in the area and she applied for a loan.

She has applied to buy inventory for her business. In the future, she hopes to build a hair salon and to buy a car to make transportation easier. As a disabled person, she moves with the help of a small cart and some transport vehicles will not accept her onboard.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Rejina José nascido no dia 1 de agosto de 1956 , no bairro de chamanculo em Maputo . Quando tinha cinco anos ,o pai lhes abandona e foi viver com outra mulher ficando a ser criado por sua mãe. Aos 13 anos perde a Mãe passando a viver com os seus irmãos mais velhos até aos 19 anos, estudou até 7ª classe e ,tambem fazia pequenos negócios aos 30 anos os dois irmãos mais velhos morrem passando a viver com seus sobrinhos.

Aprendeu a fazer tecelagem, onde passou a fazer panos e toalhas para venda .Algum tempo depois abandona esta actividade passando a vender refrigerantes e tambem dava explicação a alunos da 1ª a 5ª classe em casa tendo juntado algum dinheiro com qual construiu uma barraca onde até então desenvolve a sua actividade comercial.

Vive actualmente com 8 pessoas em que 6 estão na sua responsabilidade. Atravês duma amiga Vizinha ficou a saber da existência da Hluvuku e porque ela é deficiente físico e não pode se deslocar facilmente , e porque um dos oficiais de crédito tem trabalhado na quela zona , aproveitou formalizar o seu pedido.

Com o valor de 10.000,00mt financiado aplicou na compra de produtos para reforçar o seu negócio . Futuramente pretende construir um salão de cabelereiro e comprar uma viatura para facilitar a sua locomoção sendo deficiente físico actualmente desloca-se com auxílio de uma carrinha e alguns transportadores não aceitam lhe levar.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her shop

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Ms. Albina is 32 years old, attended school up to 9th grade, is the single mother of a girl and is expecting a second child. She lives is the Alto Trujillo Projects in the Florencia de Mora district of the Trujillo province. Ms. Albina started her business with a loan of approximately $96 she obtained from “Las Conquistadoras” Communal Bank. With that loan she bought fruits and vegetables to sell at the market of the Victor Larco district at the Trujillo province. With her next loan, she incorporated little outdoor coal stoves (“briquetas encendidas”) to her sales, which yielded a higher income. However, due to her pregnancy, she was forced to stop selling them, as the emanated smoke constituted a health risk. With the latest loan of approximately $286, given by Manuela Ramos, she bought corn and all kinds of produce to sell at a regular stand she now has in that same market. Ms. Albina dreams about traveling to the Sierra, to her native village of Cuyuchugo, in order to bring potatoes and other products to sell in bulk. She also wants to own her stand at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Albina tiene 32 años de edad, estudió solo hasta tercer año de secundaria, es madre soltera de una niña y está en espera de otro bebé. Vive en el Asentamiento Humano Alto Trujillo del Distrito de Florencia de Mora de la Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Albina inició su negocio con el préstamo de $ 96 dólares aproximadamente, que recibió del Banco Comunal “Las Conquistadoras”, con lo cual compró frutas y menestras para poner a la venta como ambulante en el mercado del distrito de Víctor Larco en la Provincia de Trujillo. Con su siguiente crédito, se dedicó también a vender briquetas encendidas (pequeñas cocinas de carbón de piedra), negocio con el que obtenía mayor ganancia, pero tuvo que dejarlo debido a su embarazo, ya que el humo que emana es perjudicial para su salud. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de $ 286 dólares aprox., compró maíz para chufla y todo tipo de menestras para vender en un espacio fijo que ahora tiene en el mismo mercado. La señora Albina sueña con viajar a la Sierra, a su pueblo natal, Cuyuchugo, para traer papa y otros productos y venderlos al por mayor. Además quiere tener un puesto en el mercado que sea propio.

loans.use: Purchase of grains and produce.

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dopé K. was born on 3 June 1977 in Lomé. She runs a telephone booth. The income from the booth alone is not enough to meet her needs. She would like to add the sale of telephone cards and other basic need goods. Since her finances are unable to help her realize this project, she is asking for a loan of $1000.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Dopé est née le 3 Juin 1977 à Lomé. Elle détient une cabine téléphonique. Le seul revenu de la cabine ne suffit pas pour subvenir à ses besoins. Elle veut ajouter la vente des cartes de recharge et d’autres produits de premières nécessités. Ses économies ne pouvant l’aider à la réalisation de ce projet elle sollicite un apport financier de $1000.

loans.use: To buy and sell telephone recharge cards

loans.name: Maisha Group

texts.en: The photograph features Tatu M., Halima M., Husna O. and Noefita B. , who are all hard-working women forming the MAISHA group. They have been doing business for the past ten years, and are beneficiaries of the business and entrepreneurship skills training programmes organized by the Youth Self Employment Foundation. Sulemani and Hassani run their own restaurants in Vingunguti, while the other two women each own a grocery. Each one of the group's members needs US$300 to help them boost their business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is a very creative and warm woman. She is a happy mother of four children who are still in school and she does not waste the opportunity to enjoy every day of their company. At home she produces beautiful textiles with her wonderful hands. She makes very beautiful blankets and rugs that help her to have a small extra income to cover the needs of her home. She commercializes her products with friends in her home town and as well as in the city of Cerro of Pasco. Her wish to increase her production made her request your help through a loan. Let's make her wish possible so that this hard-working mother can keep on granting the well-being to her loved children.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela, es una mujer muy creativa y muy cálida en su trato. Ella es una feliz madre de cuatro hijos que están aún en etapa escolar y no desaprovecha la oportunidad para disfrutar día a día de su compañía. Produce en casa bellos tejidos, con sus manos maravillosas elabora mantas y tapetes muy hermosos que la ayudan a tener unos ingresos extras para la satisfacción plena de las necesidades de su hogar, comercializa sus productos con las amistades que posee en su ciudad y también cuando se desplaza a la ciudad de Cerro de Pasco. Su deseo de incrementar su producción la conducen a solicitar vuestra ayuda a través de un préstamo. Posibilitemos su petición para que esta trabajadora madre siga otorgándole bienestar a sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: To have a bigger working capital to increase her production.

loans.name: Seniman

texts.id:
Seniman is a collector, his daily activity is finding used goods. He lives in Bhuana Raya with a rental of 150.000 a month. With his modified motorcycle which included extra two boxes at the rear, he drive thru hosing areas market and warehouse to collect the use goods. Most of the time he buy them from house wifes, and he price them according to good's condition and weight. Financial help from Dinari will be use as a capital to buy more goods. He and his family hopes that their economic condition will improve in the future.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Seniman adalah seorang pemulung yang setiaphari aktifitasnya mencari barang-barang bekas. Tinggal di jalan Bhuana Raya dengan mengontrak sebuah kamar dengan harga 150.000/bulan. Dengan menggunakan sepeda motor miliknya yang dipasang kotak di kedua sisi belakang motornya Seniman menjalankan aktifitasnya sebagai seorang pemulung. Dengan menyusuri lorong-lorong perumahan, pasar, gedung-gedung dengan tujuan untuk mendapatkan barang-barang bekas, lebih sering Seniman membeli barang-barang bekas dari para ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang suka mengumpulkan barang yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi. Barang-barang bekas tersebut ditimbang dan dihargai sesuai dengan kualitas barang. Dana yang didapat dari DINARI digunakan sebagai modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pengepul. Harapannya bersama keluarga semoga keadaan ekonomi keluarga mereka semakin membaik di masa yang akan data

loans.use: buying used goods - untuk membeli barang-barang bekas

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 29 years and married with a child.  She sells ladies' and children’s clothes in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone, and has been running her business for the last 5 years.  She would now like to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Marie would like a loan to help her in the expansion of her business selling used clothing.

loans.name: Brígida

texts.es:
Brígida has always proved to be very hard-working, dedicated and enterprising. Now that she and her husband Rogelio have established a family, she has decided to make clothes, a skill she learned from her parents and, with hard work and diligence, has continued to develop. Her work helps ensure the financial security and stability of her family and her three-year-old son Kevin. To generate additional income, Brígida has begun to sell wool. Through this work, along with making clothes, she and her family aim to improve their quality of life. Brígida would like to increase her working capital to be able to offer a greater number of products.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Brígida siempre demostró ser una muchacha muy trabajadora, dedicada y emprendedora, ahora que acaba de formar su familia junto a su esposo Rogelio decidió dedicarse a la confección de prendas de vestir, labor que aprendió y heredó de sus queridos padres y que ahora con mucho empeño y diligencia vienen desarrollando eficientemente con el fin de brindarle seguridad y tranquilidad económica a su pequeño niño Kevin de 3 añitos de edad; del mismo modo para generar ingresos extras esta joven madre decidió dedicarse a la venta de leña, con estas dos actividades están buscando mejorar su calidad de vida.Su deseo es incrementar su capital de trabajo para ofertar en mayor volumen sus productos.

loans.use: Injection of capital to offer greater number of products

loans.name: Mwantum

texts.en:
Mwantum is a 24 year old single woman. She owns a small salon, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8 A.M. to 8 P.M. and she earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business.

loans.use: To  buy more salon items for her business

loans.name: Bakhtier

texts.en:
G. Bakhtier is 37 years old. He is married and has four adorable children of school ages. Bakhtier’s wife is not working. She is housekeeper and taking care of their children. Bakhtier’s children are small now, but already today he is working hard in order to ensure the best future for them. 
Bakhtier has a very large family. Except for his wife and kids he is supporting his parents and sister. So that to be able to do it, he is running the business. He is selling the perfumery like perfume for women and men, deodorants, air fresheners, shaving cream and others. All the goods are supplied form Almaty, Kazakhstan.
Today Bakhtier requests 1000 $ US Dollars as he is planning to expand his business and increase the capital. After receiving of the good income from his business Bakhtier is planning to arrange the wedding of his sister. He would like to thank all supporting him and promises to pay the loan in 9 months. Your support will really help him. Be an important part of the growth of Bakhtier’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing the new perfumery in order to expand the business

loans.name: Olawale

texts.en:
Olawale F. designs and sells clothes. She studied this business for 5 years and has been working since 1992. Olawale is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Egan, Lagos State, Nigeria.

Olawale has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past year. She now needs a loan of US$875 to buy an embroidery machine and a generator so that she can meet the demands of her increasing customers.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and a generator

loans.name: Joyce's Jiamini Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a single woman with 2 children who are 1 and 4 years old. She began selling fish and soap in 2008. Every day, she works extremely hard from 8 am to 5 pm at her business and, in doing so, she can earn a monthly profit of approximately $155 from her sales.

Joyce now seeks a loan in order to buy more fish and soap for her business. Importantly, she will share the loan proceeds with her subgroup members, Tatu, Maria, and Amina, who have their own businesses dealing with secretarial services and clothing sales.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional fish and soap

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en:
Kemi G. lives in Ojo-Alaba, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells drinks, wine, and juice from the front of her house. She has been in this business since the year 2003. Kemi is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She begins her sales each day by 6:30 am and ends sale each day by 8:00 pm. Her customers are mostly her neighbours.

She has been a LAPO client for more than a year. Kemi needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more drinks, wine, and juice for sale. She says that this will increase the growth of her business and also her profits. She says thank you to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, wine, and juice for sale

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
La señora Reina Meliana B., es soltera, tiene una hija, quien es menor de edad y acude a una escuela pública. El negocio lo tiene muy bien ubicado, en el centro del mercado Nº 4, zona altamente comercial, sobre la Avda. Rodríguez de Francia c/Battilana, inició con un capital de Gs. 1.000.000.- U$ 250.- aproximadamente, que fue ampliando con el correr de los años, pues actualmente cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes y la zona en la que se encuentra es muy poblada y muy concurrida.

La señora retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de mercería como remeras, blusas, lencería variada y ropa interior tambien para caballeros, especialmente prendas para niños para la temporada primavera - verano. A muy tempranas horas del dia inicia sus actividades aproximadamente a las 04:00 Hs A.M. A fin de comprar todo lo que necesita para su negocio.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento o mobiliario para su propio futuro salón comercial y poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reina Meliana B. is single and has one daughter. Her daughter is young, and goes to public school. Reina’s business has a great location in the center of Market number 4, in the business district, on Rodríguez de Francia Avenue c/Battilana. Reina starts her day at a very early hour – 4:00 AM – in order to buy everything that she needs for her business. She started with approximately Gs. 1,000,000, equivalent to US$250, which has grown with as time passed. Now she has a large portfolio of clients, and her shop is located in a well-populated, busy area. Reina would like a loan to buy various merchandise, such as T-shirts, blouses, a variety of lingerie and underwear for men and women, and especially children’s clothes for spring and summer. One of Reina’s goals is to be able to expand her business soon, by buying equipment or furnishings for her future store, in order to offer a more comfortable environment to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, such as T-shirts, blouses, lingerie in general and children's clothes.

loans.name: Mwatum

texts.en:
Mwatum has been cooking and selling food in Zanzibar for 7 years. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $160 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more ingredients to enable her to prepare a greater quantity of food and increase her profit.

Mwatum is 30 years old, married, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the food that she cooks and sells.

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.en: Mahfuza R. is married and has one son.  Her husband works as a laborer and earns a relatively meagre income.  In order to contribute to her family's overall income, Mahfuza started a small business four years ago selling electrical goods and various housewares.  Since then she has been increasing the range of goods in her shop, and is now requesting a loan of $750, which she will use to do some minor remodeling to her business and more importantly purchase a wide variety of products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a wider range of electrical goods for resale.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Don Juan, trabaja en una empresa de trasportes en el puesto de descargador e inventario y como todo padre siempre está al pendiente de la salud de sus hijos, en este momento se presentó la necesidad de operar a su hija del paladar y la boca.
Es un gasto fuera del presupuesto familiar, le es imposible cubrirlo y acude ante nosotros para que podamos apoyarlo, le complacerá enormemente toda la ayuda que ustedes le puedan brindar para la operación de su pequeña.
texts.en:
Don Juan works in a transportation company loading inventory. Like all fathers, he is always thinking about the well being of his children. Right now, there is a need for one of his children to have an operation on her palate and mouth. As this is an unexpected expense, it's impossible to cover it unless he can get some help. He greatly appreciates the help you can give for his daughter's operation


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help cover the costs of an operation for his daughter

loans.name: Isack

texts.en: Isack S. is a Tanzanian businessman. He runs a clothing and shoe shop at Kilakala Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam. He has been in the business for four years. He buys his inventory items from the wholesale shops in Kariakoo business center. Supplying his family's daily needs depends directly on his business income. The business demand is very high compared to his capacity to supply the goods. He is requesting a loan of T. shs 600,000 to buy more items.

loans.use: to buy more business inventory

loans.name: Elena Marisol

texts.es: Elena Marisol G. D. C., resiD. en el municipio D. Apopa en el departamento D. San Salvador, a sus 39 años D. edad debe trabajar en su pequeño negocio el cuál es una pequeña tienda en la que venD. golosinas algunas frutas  verduras, jabón y otros enseres del hogar. D. esta manera ella se gana la vida y contribuye junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que este se ve obligado a viajar periódicamente hacia los Estados Unidos para poder incrementar los ingresos del hogar. Elena solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder abastecer con más productos su tienda y aprovechar al máximo sus ganancias y poder invertirlas en el desarrollo D. sus dos pequeños hijos, sobre todo en el tiempo que su esposo esta fuera del país.
texts.en:
Elena Marisol G. D. C. lives in the Apopa municipality in the San Salvador department. At her 39 years of age she works in her small business selling candies, fruits and vegetables, soap and other household products. She makes a living in this manner and contributes, along with her husband, to the household expenses as her husband is obligated to travel to the United States periodically to increase their income. Elena is requesting a loan in order to stock her store with products which will allow her to make the most of her earnings so that she can invest in the development of her two small children especially during the time when her husband is out of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock more products for her store.

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат Ганиева 1971 года рождения , замужем имеет 3 детей. Работает с Микроинвест с 2007 года. Получила кредит на  покупки сухофруктов. Также торгует хозяйственными товарами. В бизнесе помогают дети, когда холодно или когда она неможет выйти на торговлю. Планирует сотрудничать с КИВА и в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
Mamlakat G. was born in 1971. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2007. She received a loan to purchase dried fruits. She also sells household products. Her children help her in her business when it is cold or when she cannot go out to sell. She plans to work with KIVA in the future.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business development

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena D. is 45 years old. She is a widow and mother of three kids who currently attend school. Abena lives with her family in their own house at Anyinem, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Abena works hard to support her kids’ welfare and schooling.  She sells foodstuffs and vegetables like plantains, cassavas, yams, tomatoes, onions, egg plant, etc. on a table top in the community market.  She buys her goods from farmers in surrounding villages.  Abena has been in business for twelve years. She also distributes cassavas and plantains to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators.  Abena wants a loan to buy food stuffs on a large scale so she can cut down on costs by reducing her number of trips to procure goods to maximize profit.

She is a member of the community group called Patience.  Members guarantee one another as social collateral to access the loan and repay loans.

loans.use: Buy food stuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: el sr. Miguel Z. tiene 24 a@os de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de bloques de concreto para la construccion de casas, este producto tiene mucha demanda en la zona ya que la mayoria de las contrucciones emplean este material por ser mas economico y resistente. el sr. Z. nos manifesto que este negocio es de mucha bendicion ya que le ha generado ingresos apra suplir gastos personales y las obligaciones financieras que ha contraido. nos esta solicitando el apoyo crediticio ya que necesita producir mas para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Z. is 24 years old and he makes and sells concrete blocks used in the construction of houses. This product is in great demand in his area as the majority of the construction uses this material because it is economical and sturdy. Mr. Z. tells us that this business is a blessing as it has generated income to cover his personal expenses and financial obligations that he has. He is asking for our support for a loan as he needs to produce more in order to satisfy the demands of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement and sand

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor es chofer propietario, tiene una vagoneta que trabaja como radio taxi en la empresa Apolo, y su esposa es comerciante.
Tiene tres hijos que son independientes y los ingresos que genera por el servicio de transporte y la actividad de su esposa es para la sobre vivencia de su familia.
Vive en la zona de Villa Armonia de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión (mantenimiento completo del vehiculo).
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.
texts.en:
Víctor is a taxi driver and has his own station wagon, which he uses as his taxi for the company Apolo, His wife is a businesswoman. He has three grown children, and the income he makes from his transport service and from his wife's job goes toward the family's survival. He lives in the Villa Armonia area of La Paz, in his own home.

This loan will be used to invest in the complete maintenance of his vehicle. This is Victor's fourth loan with Impro (a Kiva partner), and the second time he has sought the support of Kiva. He has been a client since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his taxi

loans.name: Nolie

texts.en:
Nolie is a good father to his three children. His children are Nolie V. Jr. and Aliah Shaira, who have started their schooling, and Aira Heart Zian, who is 3 years old. He is married to Arsenia who is a public teacher in their village at Centro 3, Angadanan, Isabela. Nolie wants to see his businesses grow so he can provide for his family, especially for his children’s education. 

Nolie manages many businesses. These businesses include soft drink vendor, furniture maker, and landlord since he rents one of his rooms to university students from the near-by university.  He gradually started all the businesses with the income he was able to generate by renting out a room. His soft drink business is growing fast, and he would like to borrow PHP10,000. This would help him satisfy his customers’ demands.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu A. is twenty-two years old. He is married and has two children: a boy and a girl. According to him, both are currently in the primary school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. Yakubu’s wife is a trader. She trades in cereals.

Yakubu is also a trader. He deals in livestock. He sells live animals such as goats, sheep, cattle, etc. He buys all the way from the northern part of the country and sells to the butchers in his community. Yakubu has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure livestock in bulk. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy livestock in bulk

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa L. Sánchez tiene 42 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Incompleta,   tiene 4  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
María   se dedica a la venta de comida, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió  en la compra de utencillos para el restaurante como ollas, taperes.
El crédito de 1000 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de  productos como verduras, frutas para implementar su negocio.
María tiene como sueño  tener su cafetería  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Teresa L. Sánchez is 42 years old, she lives in the La Esperanza District, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She studied part of her primary education, she has 4 kids who are economically dependent on her. María sells food, she has developed her business out of her home. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from her village bank New Hope II, she invested in the purchase of utensils for her restaurant like pots and tapers. The loan of 1000 soles will be invested in the purchase of products like vegetables and fruits used to implement her business. María has a dream of having her own cafeteria and to grow as a microentrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase such products as vegetables, fruits in order to implement her business.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es: Clorinda tiene 42 años, es una madre muy trabajadora; tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales sólo tres viven con ella en su casa propia. Clorinda trabaja diariamente desde muy joven, puesto que la agricultura es la única actividad que conoce y que le ha generado muy buenas ganancias durante todos estos años. Por ello es que quiere mucho a sus siembras de papa y oca, ya que gracias a ellas sus hijos no pasan dificultades y necesidades económicas. Algunas veces trabaja también en chacras de sus vecinas, donde le pagan 12 soles diarios incluido su almuerzo y con este dinero solventa los gastos de su anciana madre y los estudios de sus hijos. Pero cuando tiene que cultivar sus propias chacras, Clorinda y su esposo priorizan esta labor hasta terminar enviando sus productos al mercado. Con las ganancias anteriores ha aprovechado en comprar vacas, de las que vende su leche a 1.5 soles el litro, además, cada vez tiene más becerritos. Por ello, sus  anhelos son de comprar más vacas que le generen ingresos extras a su hogar.
