Los demás integrantes están en el décimo crédito con MFP, mientras que Clorinda va por el octavo préstamo, pues ingresó a su banco comunal cuando ya tenía un año de formado; por otro lado, ella se siente muy alegre por lo que viene ahorrando junto a su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de funguicidas que erradiquen los gusanos que atacan la oca y la papa, el resto lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
Clorinda is 42 years old. She is a very hardworking mother with 4 children, 3 of whom live in her house. Clorinda has been working everyday since she was very young because agriculture is the only activity that she knows and that has been yielding great profits all these years. For this reason, she really likes her potato and oca (a root vegetable) crops. Thanks to them, her children have not experienced financial difficulties. Sometimes she also works on her neighbors’ farms, where she gets paid 12 PEN daily, including lunch. With this money, she can pay for her elderly mother’s expenses and for her children’s studies. However, when she has to cultivate her own crop fields, Clorinda and her husband make it a priority until they end up sending their products to market. She has made the most of her previous earnings by purchasing some cows, selling their milk at 1.5 PEN a liter. Furthermore, her cows keep having more and more calves. For this reason, she hopes to purchase more cows, which will increase the household income. The rest of the members are on their tenth loan with MFP, while Clorinda is on her eighth loan because she joined the microfinance institute a year after it was formed. Nevertheless, she feels very happy because she has been saving money with her group. The money that she is now requesting will be used in purchasing fungicides to eradicate the pests that attack her potatoes and oca. She will also invest in purchasing chemical fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fungicides and fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Hacia Adelante Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres Hacia Adelante” (Women Moving Forward) is pictured here. On average, the women in this communal bank, which was created on October 20th 2008, have been working with Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner, for less than a year. The majority of the communal bank’s members live in Pucallpa, in two different neighborhoods: “San Juan D. Miraflores” and “25 D. Marzo” (25th of March). 

Señora Susy Cárdenas Morí is 38 years old and is the president of “Mujeres Hacia Adelante.”  She has a business selling clothing. The communal bank has 12 members. The members trust one another. The group is small and its members are happy. They take their commitments seriously and view their businesses optimistically. As a group, they are requesting a loan of 5,800 Nuevos Soles, which each will invest in her business.  The women of “Mujeres Hacia Adelante” dedicate themselves to a variety of business ventures, including selling new and used clothing, candy, snow cones, beauty products, CDs and DVDs of films or music videos, plantain chips and cooked food.  Two women plan to invest in making their first payments on motorcycle taxis.

Amongst themselves, the women speak of enjoying Manuela Ramos’s hymn, whose words caused them to reflect and inspired them toward further progress. (Each new bank member listens to this hymn about a Peruvian woman who tires of oppression and decides to develop her skills in order to improve her life). With the support offered to them by Manuela Ramos, the women of “Mujeres Hacia Adelante” will be able to continue developing their businesses.

loans.use: food for catering businesses, other products for sale, and purchase of motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Fortaleza” trabaja junto a  Pro-Mujer hace cinco años,  a la fecha  cuenta con once miembros, que  han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Actualmente este grupo tiene negocios independientes, por ejemplo Roberto vende variedad de juguetes, otras se dedican a la venta de cosméticos, víveres, además también otras  socias  elaboran masitas y ofrecen servicio de te y cafetería. Necesitan capital para poder comprar mayores insumos o mercadería para obtener mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida  a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group called “Fortaleza” (Strength) has been working with Pro-Mujer for five years. They now have eleven members and have demonstrated themselves to be a group that is organized in paying their loan amounts. Currently this group has a variety of businesses. For example, Roberto sells a variety of toys, others sell cosmetics, or groceries, and some members make sweetbreads and pastries and have tea and cafeteria businesses. They need capital in order to buy more ingredients and merchandise so they can have better incomes; this will allow them to provide better living conditions for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and merchandise

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La señora Zulma A. , clienta nueva, es madre de dos hermosas niñas: Maria y Camila que fueron la inspiración para el nombre del negocio. Zulma es una mujer muy  trabajadora, ella se dedica a la venta de lencería, jeans, remeras, blusas, y vestimenta en general para dama y caballeros también accesorios de todo tipo. 
Sus principales clientelas son  personas del barrio y también clientela ya formada desde hace bastante años
Ella está en este rubro desde hace 7 años en la venta sobre pedido y ahora ya tiene su local propio en la ciudad de Asunción cerca de una de las oficinas de Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Zulma A., a new client, is the mother of 2 beautiful girls: Maria and Camila, that were the inspiration for the name of her business. Zulma is a very hard working woman; she sells lingerie, jeans, t-shirts, blouses, and other clothing for women and men, as well as a variety of accessories. Her main customers are locals from the area and also loyal customers she has had for many years. Zulma has worked in retail for 7 seven years selling clothing by catalog order and now has her own store space in Asunción city near the offices of Fundación Paraguaya.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to increase her stock: t-shirts, pants, shirts, lingerie, etc.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lamine Sangaré est  âgé  de 28 ans, il réside avec sa femme et ses 2 enfants dans une famille traditionnelle avec d’autres ménages dans le quartier Sido Sonincoura de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il fréquenta l’école coranique qu’il abandonna en classe de 4ème années (système éducatif Malien). Il commença alors à mener des activités génératrices telles le jardinage auprès de son père. C’est grâce aux recettes tirées de cette activité qu’il commença à vendre de l’huile alimentaire au marché château depuis  7 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. Il effectue sa vente à l’aide d’une pompe manuelle qui lui sert de mesure. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire la demande clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est en relation depuis 12 mois. Après 1 prêt individuel correctement remboursé, il est à son 2ème prêt  qu’il  compte utiliser pour acheter, 200 litres d’huiles alimentaires, soit 10 bidons de 20 litres  sur place à Ségou auprès des grossistes. Lamine Sangaré vend en détail, au comptant et à crédit à un clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Il envisage  réaliser une bénéfice mensuel de 70 000FCFA qui lui permettra de subvenir aux  charges familiales et d’augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Son ambition est d’agrandir et de diversifier  son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Lamine Sangaré is 28 years old. He resides with his wife and two children in a traditional family with other households in the Sido Sonincoura district of the city of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He attended Koranic school, and in the fourth grade (of the education system of Mali), he dropped out. Then he started to run income-earning businesses, such as gardening, with his father. Thanks to the income derived from this business, he started selling vegetable oil at the Chateau marketplace seven years ago and enjoys a large number of customers and fame. Sales are made using a manual pump, which measures the oil. Concerned about satisfying continually growing customer demands, he has turned toward Soro Yiriwaso, with which he has been associated for 12 months. After one individual loan, properly repaid, he is now on his second loan, which he intends to use to buy 200 liters of vegetable oil (either in 10- or 20-liter containers) locally in Ségou from wholesale merchants. He sells at the retail level while accepting cash or credit from customers composed of men and women. He envisions realizing a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA that will enable him to provide for his family and to increase his working capital. His ambition is to expand his business and to diversify it.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetable oil

loans.name: Garcia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Garcia esta integrado por Martha Irene M. quien desde hace quince años vende frutas y verduras, Melena Cecilia C. G.  quien también vende verduras y Claudia del Rosario M. R. quien vende gaseosa y fresco.

Lo que ellas desean es poder su para esta crisis económica con trabajo, dedicación y esfuerzo pero para ello necesitan capital para invertir en productos para sus negocios como yuca, pipián, ayote, chayote, yerba buena, quequisque, naranja, pitaya, tamarindo, semilla de jícaro, cacao,  tomate entre otros.

loans.use: pata compraryuca, pipián, ayote, chayote, yerba buena, quequisque, naranja, pitaya, tamarindo, semilla de jícaro, cacao,  tomate entre otros

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida H., 33, has a food market stall in Silang, Cavite, where she also lives with her husband, Eduardo, 35, a driver, and their two children who are in grade school.

She has been selling fruits, vegetables, fresh meat and fish for two years.  Because electronic load credit for mobile phones is in demand, she also tried it and proved it to be a worthwhile additional source of income. Zenaida now earns a net income of PHP 16,000 per month. From her profits, she was able to purchase a motorcycle.

She is now on her seventh loan cycle with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative.  She joined the cooperative in 2007. Zenaida has applied for a new loan in the amount of PHP 19,000 as additional capital for her food market business.

Zenaida desires to have her own public market someday. 



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food market business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr: S. Safiatou est née en 1974 et réside au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis huit ans. C'est une divorcée ayant à sa charge quatre enfants, dont deux sont ses enfants et sont tous scolarisés. Safiatou vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Safiatou n'a jamais été à l'école. C'est depuis 10 ans que Safiatou mène comme activité, la vente de bouillie (fait avec l'amidon de maïs) accompagnée de beignets (fait avec la farine de blé). Safiatou mène cette activité de façon ambulante et s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Safiatou a déjà obtenu de ALIDé, deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Safiatou désire agrandir davantage son activité et satisfaire plus sa clientèle, afin qu'elle puisse s'élargir. C'est pourquoi, Safiatou sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
S. Safiatou was born in 1974 and has been residing in the Gbégamey district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for eight years. She is divorced and has four children to support. Two of them are hers, and all of them are in school. She lives by herself with her children and is the sole supporter of the family. Safiatou has never been to school. For ten years, she has been running a business selling porridge (made with corn starch) served with beignets (made with wheat flour). It’s a moveable operaton. She stocks up at Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. She has had two ALIDé loans before which she has repaid. She wishes to expand her business further and to satisfy her customers more, in order to expand. This is why she’s requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, wheat flour, and packets of sugar

loans.name: Maria Carolina

texts.es:
La señora María Carolina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años y 06 hijos, 03 de ellos que están bajo su responsabilidad.

María Carolina, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito y lleva varios años en el negocio, cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 9:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
María Carolina, 40, is a member of the "La Marginal II" communal bank which is in Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and has 6 children, 3 of whom still are under her care. María Carolina has been selling prepared meals for the past two years in her area's Central Market. She has a well-equipped area to see to her customers. She tells us that her daily earnings are good due to the unique taste of her meals. Her main customers are residents of the city, passersby, and regular customers that know her; she is well received. Currently, she continues with this line of work and happy with her daily tasks. She works in the mornings form 9-2. She personally attends to her customers with her characteristic good humor. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy ingredients that she needs for her meal preparation such as, rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, chickens, vegetables, as well as some utensils to provide better customer service. She continues to want to get ahead in life and has many dreams and goals to achieve, like having her own, well-stocked, grocery store. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: The Way Forward Group

texts.en:
The above group of entrepreneurs calls their group 'The Way Forward'. They are small-scale businesspeople in the small town of Waterloo, located near Freetown. These people have been in business for many years but their businesses have been growing at a very slow pace due to lack of sufficient working capital. As such, they formed themselves into a group of three to apply for a loan of SLL 1,500,000 from SMT, a partner of 'Shine on Sierra Leone' in Waterloo.

The leader of this group is Aminata S. in the middle of the photo. Aminata was born in Kambia, north of Sierra Leone about forty-five years ago. She is married to a businessman in Waterloo and they have one child who is already a grown-up. Since 1980, Aminata S. has been selling used clothes for adults. With her share of this loan, she will buy a bale of used clothes to add to her business. A bale usually costs about SLL 550,000 in Freetown.

loans.use: Buy a bale of used clothes to add to her business

loans.name: Ndèye Awa

texts.fr: Ndèye Awa N. est une femme de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KA FALL depuis 03 ans et demi et a eu de bonnes expériences avec le crédit pour l’avoir contracté à 7 fois de suite. Elle s’active au tour de l’embouche bovine et ovine et ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Ndèye Awa N. is a 32 year-old married mother of three. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de KA FALL for three and a half years and has benefited positively from the seven consecutive loans that she has received. She is involved in the fattening of cows and sheep, and the profits that she generates from this activity enable her to help improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enable her to finance herself autonomously

loans.name: .kiden

texts.en:
Kiden M. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol beverages and is requesting a loan to purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell.  Kiden is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio  es socio del Banco Comunal de Ladrilleros de Compañía, es de la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Eusebio es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Eusebio junto a su esposa se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, producto que vende crudo en el mismo lugar.
Eusebio necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en el techado de su casa,
Los sueños de Eusebio son comprar un terreno en Ayacucho para construir su casa y comprar un carro para transportar el ladrillo.
texts.en:
Eusebio is a member of the Ladrilleros de Compañía Communal Bank in the Comañía community, which is 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Eusebio is 37, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Eusebio and his wife make bricks by hand in the Compañía community. They sell their products unprocessed in the same area. Eusebio needs a loan for 900 PEN to invest in the roof of his house. Eusebio’s dreams are to buy a piece of land in Ayacucho to build a house on, and to buy a car to transport the bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the roof of his house

loans.name: Mukono Women Crafts Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Faith, pictured at the top right, is the leader of her lending group (and she happens to be in the small photo, too). She is 57 years old and a single mother of 5 children, some of whom have finished university.  She is also taking care of 8 nephews and nieces.

Faith is a business lady involved in the making and selling of crafts like mats, baskets and other items.  She also does outside catering and her biggest challenge are the seasons when the number of clients is inadequate.

She has operated from the Butebe zone for 3 years and she is able to make 100,000 Ugandan Shillings as profit each week. She ensures that she has quality products and, in future, she would like to make a big show room for her crafts. She needs a loan to be able to buy more materials for making crafts in bulk.

loans.use: Buying craft materials in bulk.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita Q. is from the village of Dalisay, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Anita is single and has one adult child. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling baked food in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Anita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Daki

texts.en:
Daki V. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home. She is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell. 

Daki is 35 years old and is married to a nurse. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Mangaljav

texts.en: Mangaljav is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in Uvs province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Mangaljav operates a transportation business with his own truck. He contracts to bring brick, gravel and soil to construction companies during the spring, summer, and autumn. Mangaljav has been operating his business successfully since 1997 and has a loyal customer base. He would like to purchase a trailer which has a capacity of 10 tons for his truck to transport materials including gravel and soil for the airport construction. Mangaljav built a warehouse and a garage for his truck in 2009. In addition, he created his own auto repair center and has been planning to expand and stabilize his business. Mangaljav is a open-minded person focused on the future. He says, “I started saving money for my three daughters' university tuition fees. I would like to purchase another truck for my business in the future.” He is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug (~ 2560 USD) loan to purchase a 10-ton trailer for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer

loans.name: Talemwa Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
Her market vending business is all she banks on to bring food to her family’s table. She got started after her husband gave her the startup capital thirty years ago. Being a not-so-profitable business, it has not really improved on her standard of living to her expectations. Despite this, she has strained every nerve to see to it that all her nine children get an education.

This is the story of Aisha A., a woman with a down-the-line hard work ethic. She mostly sells tomatoes, cabbages and eggplants. In her years of operating, her predominant customers have mostly been hotel owners. She has reached a rate of progress where she makes monthly profits of 50,000 shillings.

With this loan, Aisha wants to buy fresher produce to sell. She specifically wants to buy more cabbages which are in high favor with most of her clients.

loans.use: To purchase more cabbages and other highly-favoured foods

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mariama C. est une institutrice dans une ecole prescolaire,elle a 38 ans et est mere de 5 enfants.
Elle fait en meme temps un commerce de tissus, qu'elle achete en Mauritanie pour les revendre a Ziguinchor. Elle fait le voyage 1 fois tous les 2 mois. Elle est dans ce commerce depuis mintenant 7ans. Elle est entree dans cette activite pour gagner plus d'argent et gerer ses charges. Elle souhaite developper son activite avec surtout l'aide de partenaire financie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariama C. is a kindergarden teacher. She is 38 years old and is the mother of five children. At the same time, she sells fabrics which she purchases in Mauritania to resell in Ziguinchor. She makes the trip to buy her stock every two month. She has been in this business for seven years. She launched this activity in order to increase her income and manage her expenses. She is seeking to grow her business with the help of additional financing.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting business capital

loans.name: We Dee Woman Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will be able to add more stock in their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school and feeding and clothing them. 

Marie D. is the leader of this group. She was born in Waterloo forty-two years ago. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending schools – one in college and three in secondary school. 

Marie sells market food such as palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), vegetable oil, rice, etc. She has been doing this business for more than eleven years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying palm oil, vegetable oil and rice wholesale.

loans.use: Buy palm oil, vegetable oil and rice wholesale

loans.name: New London Group

texts.en:
Claudia C. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Claudia was born in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. Claudia is 35 years old. She is married to a farmer and the couple has 4 children, 3 of whom are attending school. 

For over 5 years now, Claudia has been selling firewood, fried cakes and boiled cassavas and potatoes. This is the first loan that Claudia and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Claudia will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business; she will buy firewood, cassava roots and potatoes wholesale.

loans.use: Buy firewood, cassava roots, and potatoes wholesale

loans.name: María Bertha

texts.es: María Bertha C. es una mujeres trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 45 años. Ella en el 2005 inicio con el comercio de ropa y luego instalo una pequeña venta la cual inicio con el comercio de chiverías. Hoy en día ambos negocios se encuentran bien surtidos en el caso de la venta tiene desde granos básicos, carne, refrescos, productos lácteos etc.
texts.en:
45-year old María Bertha C. is a hardworking, enterprising woman who puts a great deal of effort into all that she does. In 2005 she began selling clothing and then started her own stall selling snacks. Today both businesses are doing well, and she also sells basic grains, meat, soft drinks, and milk products etc. from her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and basic grains

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en: Basilisa D. is a 28-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish-vending business. She lives in Brgy. Liloan, Santander, Cebu. Basilisa has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish-vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of 3,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Basilisa is borrowing 10,000 PHP as additional working capital for her fish-vending business. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 7,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey towards her family's well-being following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mt Mongai Group

texts.en:
Meet M. Ramadhan M. and the Mt. Rongai Group!  M. is 55 years old, married and has a 20-year-old daughter who goes to school. Additionally, he supports the 7-year-old son of his brother-in-law, and that child also goes to school.  He has been running a business selling dishware for 3 years now and works from 7am to 7pm daily. He is able to make around $67.

This will be M.'s 2nd motisha loan from  Tujijenge Tanzania.  A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. M. used his previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his inventory, and he has repaid that loan successfully. With this loan, M. wants to start selling dishware wholesale.

In the picture M. R, M. is second from the right, second row in a dark shirt.

loans.use: to start selling dishware wholesale.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en casa de sus parientes, en compañía de sus 2 hijos. Durante la semana, trabaja en una central telefónica como recepcionista, atendiendo denuncias y reclamos de los usuraos de teléfonos fijos, mediante las llamadas y los fines de semana prepara buffet criollo, siendo pedido por parte de clientes que desean celebrar matrimonios, bautizos, quince años y demás acontecimientos. Sus clientes son sus vecinos de buena posición y algunas son  los profesores del colegio de sus hijos. Los 6 años que lleva en este negocio; le han pagado todo aunque con un poco de demora; es por ello que ahora cobra antes de dar el servicio. En adelante piensa ampliar y diversificar su negocio, con la repostería, por ello va hacer cursos de esta índole, para que sus ingresos aumenten. Para Silvia, es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo,  y agradece a los de su grupo por integrarla. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará arroz, fideos, asimismo comprará ollas ya que los que tiene están deteriorada, de ese modo continuar su negocio de los buffets.
texts.en:
Silvia is 39 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her two sons at some relatives' home. During the week she works in a call centre as receptionist, taking calls about complaints and other claims by land-line phone users. At the week-end she prepares creole buffets for clients celebrating weddings, christenings, fifteen-year old birthday parties and other events. Her clients are well-off neighbours and some of them teach at her sons' school. She has been in this line of business for 6 years. She has always been paid, although with some delays, and hence she now asks to be paid before providing the service. She plans to expand and diversify her business by also providing confectionery, so in order to increase her income she's going to take a course on the subject. This is Silvia's first loan with MFP and she is committed to repaying it on time. She would like to thank the members of her loan group for welcoming her. With the loan requested she will buy rice, noodles and pots because the ones she has are in a poor condition. This will enable her to continue with her catering business.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic products for her catering business.

loans.name: Boris Stalin

texts.es: El Sr. Boris Stalin G. T. el es Trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Responsable de turismo social tiene  dos  años de trabajar para esta empresa, es casado actualmente, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada préstamo lo  ha realizado para diferentes actividades, gastos médicos, mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para la compra de granos como trigo, maíz, para siembra y fertilizantes, los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Boris Stalin G. T. is employed by the city of San Rafael del Sur; he’s Chief of the Social Tourism department. He has been thus employed for two years. He’s married and has a school age son. He has had seven loans with CEPRODEL each of which has been used for different purposes: medical expenses, home improvements. They have been of great benefit to him in that they have improved his and his family’s living condition. The current requested loan will be used to buy grains like wheat and corn to plant and fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Aiganalupe

texts.en:
Aiganalupe L. is 39 and married with two children (ages two and six).  She owns a business selling barbecued foods (sausages, chicken and plantains).  Aiganalupe has two years' experience in this business. She needs a loan of 1000 talas to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates and utensils, and coal.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $122 per week) to improve and expand it.

In 2010, Aiganalupe joined SPBD.  This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Aiganalupe's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates and utensils, and coal

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of San Isidro, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 58 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Truc

texts.en: Truc T. N. is 55 years old and has 2 children who work for an electrical appliance manufacturer. She has been retired for 5 years. She, therefore,  raises 200 chickens for meat to generate income to help her children manage their family life. Since becoming a client of our program in 2006, she has used her loans effectively to expand her business. Currently, she wants a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens

loans.name: Juan Boanerges

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Boanerges G. G. es trabajador Activo de la empresa D.G.I desempeñándose como Guarda de Seguridad tiene tres  años de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  dos   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Juan Boanerges G. G. is currently an employee at a company called D.G.I., where he works as a security guard.  He has been working for this enterprise for three years.  He has had two loans with CEPRODEL, and has taken each one in order to buy construction materials to expand and improve his home.  The loans with CEPRODEL have greatly benefited him, by allowing him to improve his and his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, stone, cinder blocks, paint.

loans.name: Kleber Washington

texts.es:
Kleber Washington  P. A. tiene 37 años. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con el compañero y con los hijos,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Milton se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño tener salud y vida para seguir trabajando para darles la educación a los hijos.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Kleber Washington P. A. is 37 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his partner and 4 children. They live in the Ventanas area in the Los Ríos Province.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Kebler is in agriculture and has grown corn for over 3 years. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the markets in the same city.

Kebler needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn crops. The loan will help him to meet his financial needs. Some problems that he faces are plagues and disease and climate change. His dream is to be healthy and live enough to keep working to give his children an education.

Kebler enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Fernando Bismark

texts.es:
Fernando Bismark M. F. tiene 24 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa  viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No Tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Fernando se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 2 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar casa y terreno.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Fernando Bismark M. F. is 24 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife in the Ventanas settlement, located in the “de Los Ríos” province.

The members of the “UNIDOS SOMO MAS,” (United we are more) communal bank, located in Marañon, within the Puerto Pechiche parish; part of the Pueblo Viejo settlement.  This area produces short cycle crops, such as corn, beans, and rice.

Fernando has specialized in raising corn, rice and beans for the past two years.  He buys his supplies at “Comercial López” in Ventanas and sells his harvest at the Ventanas marketplace.  

He is asking for this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizer.  This loan will help him to meet his financial needs.  He faces challenges, such as crop diseases and the weather.  Some day he would like to buy a house and his own house and some land.  He likes playing sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Gleiny Luz

texts.es: La ropa,  los cosméticos, los productos naturales , son el pan de cada día de Gleiny  P., una mujer de 27 años que vive en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, y que todos los días se mueve entre estas mercancías: comprándolas, costeándolas, definiendo sus precios, exhibiéndolas, promocionándolas, consiguiendo nuevos clientes  y vendiendo todo lo que compra.   Así pasan los días de Gleiny entre la atención de su hija menor de un año y su negocio,  que es su ingreso principal e inició hace un año en su propia casa; esta es  la razón  por la que ha construido su principal clientela entre sus vecinos, familiares y referidos y aunque la competencia es fuerte, se sostiene porque es muy amigable y ofrece  precios competitivos    y muchas veces mejores , pues ella está muy pendiente de lograr descuentos y promociones que beneficien a sus compradores, así  mismo   los clientes se sienten satisfechos porque los  plazos y formas de pago son concertadas con ellos mismos . Gleiny vende de contado y a crédito, su rotación de inventarios es de 6 días y su razón corriente es de 2,09 veces; en la actualidad está postulada a recibir su primer financiamiento a través de la linea crediKiva, con este financiamiento comprará colonias, cosméticos, productos naturales y fantasias, para responderle a los clientes en la mejor época del año, en la que se incrementan sus ventas sobre pedidos. Su sueño se concentra en trabajar  en su negocio para tener una casa propia, porque en el   futuro visiona a su hija como una profesional  exitosa y muy próspera.
texts.en:
Clothes, cosmetics, and natural products are Gleiny P.’s daily bread and butter.  She is a 27 year old woman who lives in the 20 de Julio neighborhood.  Every day she is involved with this merchandise.  She selects it, pays for it, sets the prices, displays it, and sells it.  This way she gets new customers, and she sells all that she purchases.

That is how Gleiny spends her days, between taking care of her one year old daughter and her business.  This is her main income, and she started a year ago in her own house.  That is why she has built her customer base among her neighbors, relatives, and referrals.  There is strong competition.  She keeps going because she is very friendly, and her prices are competitive and often lower than the competition.  She watches carefully for discounts and promotions that will benefit her customers.  Her customers are very satisfied because the terms and payment arrangements are set up with the customers themselves.

Gleiny sells for cash and credit.  She rotates her inventory every six days.  Her current ratio (working capital ratio that measures liquidity) is 2.09.  She is now looking forward to receiving her first Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy cologne, cosmetics, natural products, and novelties.  She will do this in order to be in tune with her customers during the best season of the year.  This is the season when orders and sales increase.

Her dream is to concentrate on working in her business in order to have her own house.  In the future she envisions her daughter as being a successful and very prosperous professional.

loans.use: To buy cologne, cosmetics, natural products, and novelties

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal “12 D. Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia D. Puno y departamento D. Puno, tiene 51 años, D. estado civil casada, tiene ocho hijos independientes.

Trabaja  hace un año con el Movimiento   Manuela  Ramos,  su  préstamo  inicial fue D.  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. comidas fuera D. los establecimientos, en las ferias.

Solicitará un  nuevo crédito por la suma  D. S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio, con el cual comprará productos como azúcar, chocolates, leche, arroz, papa, y gas, es ayudada en el negocio por sus hijos y su esposo.

Su sueño es mejorar el negocio.

Le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo
texts.en:
María is a member of the "12 D. Agosto" community bank which is located in Puno district, in the province and department of the same name.  She is 51 years old, married and has eight children who live independently.

María has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling meals outsiD. businesses, in markets.

María is requesting a new loan for 600 Peruvian soles which she will invest in her business, buying products such as sugar, chocolate, milk, rice, potato and gas.  María receives help in her business from her children and her husband.  Her dream is to improve her business.  What she likes about her community bank is the convenience of the loans.

loans.use: To buy products such as sugar, rice, potatoes and gas for preparing her meals

loans.name: Nkoriais Ole Mankura

texts.en:
Nkoriais Ole Mankura K. is 38 years old .He is married and a father of fifteen children. Nkoriais is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staffs in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to prepare his wheat farming which normally do well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and educate his children. In future he desires to practice large scale farming. Nkoriais is a hard working man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to prepare his wheat farm which normally do well in his area due to good climatic conditions.

loans.name: Orlando Henry

texts.es:
El cliente tiene 24 Años, vive en el trópico de Cochabamba en la localidad de entre ríos, tiene su pareja y tienen una hija de 1 año.
El señor Orlando se vino al trópico, de la provincia cercado del departamento de Cochabamba, por mayor oportunidad de trabajo, porque en la ciudad los sueldos son bajos y los productos de la canasta familiar son cada vez más caros, apenas alcanza para sobrevivir.
Cuando llegó indica, que se vino con unas cuantas ropas a la casa de sus suegros, ahí ayudaba a cargar fruta de temporada y llevaban a la ciudad de santa cruz, para su comercialización, aun Orlando  no podía encontrar un trabajo seguro, se presentaba a las empresas pero no le seleccionaban, cansado de esperar, quiso regresar a la ciudad de Cochabamba, pero de repente de una de las empresas le llamaron y hasta la fecha trabaja en esta empresa.

Con el transcurso del tiempo fue  ahorrando poco a poco y fue comprándose un lote urbano y se hizo una pequeña habitación, ahora  el cliente solicita el crédito para seguir ampliando su vivienda y estar un poco más cómodo,ampliar con una pequeña construccion mas, tiene un sueño poner su propio negocio, y de esa manera sobresalir de esta situación, y posteriormente quiere  comprarse una casa en la ciudad de Cochabamba.
texts.en:
The client is 24 and he lives between rivers in the tropical area of  Cochabamba.  He has a partner and they have a 1-year old daughter.

Orlando came to the tropics from the province around Cochabamba department for better working opportunities.  In the city salaries are low and prices for products that families need continue to get more expensive and he hardly made enough to survive.

When he arrived he tells us that he came with only a few pieces of clothing from his in-law’s house.  There he transported fruit during the season to sell in the city of Santa Cruz .  But even then Orlando couldn’t find steady work.  He looked for work with businesses but he wasn’t chosen.  Tired of waiting he wanted to return to Cochabamba when suddenly one of the companies called him and he has been working there since.
 
With the passing of time little by little he saved some money and bought a lot in the urban area.  He built a small house and now he is requesting a loan to continue enlarging it with just a bit more construction to be more comfortable.  His dream is to have his own business.  This would help him get ahead with his current situation and then he would like to buy a house in Cochabamba.

loans.use: Construction to enlarge his house

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 65 años de edad, natural del distrito de Quimbiri es un hombre muy alegre y próspero, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Trancito de 65 años; tiene cuatro hijos quienes viven en sus propias casas junto a sus familias. Juan, es un hombre de buen trato, su negocio es administrar su propio hospedaje llamado “Hostal Vacors” situado en el distrito de Quimbiri donde brinda a sus usuarios las mejores habitaciones desde simples hasta matrimoniales, incluido terma, TV cable y playa de estacionamiento, su hospedaje es muy concurrido por los servicios que presta; tiene una construcción de 03 pisos donde ofrece 28 cuartos para poder arrendarlos. Este negocio lo  viene administrando por más de 22 años y obtiene buenos ingresos y cuenta con el apoyo de sus trabajadores para que se encarguen de la limpieza. Le gusta administrar su hospedaje y que sus usuarios se sientan cómodos. Los planes para el bien de su negocio es aumentar más habitaciones; por ello están construyendo 06 habitaciones más. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará material de construcción como cementos, fierros y ladrillos.
texts.en:
Juan is 65 years old and a native of the District of Quimbiri. He is a happy and prosperous man who lives in his own home with his wife Trancito, age 65. They have four children who live in their own home with their families. Juan, a well-mannered gentleman, manages a boarding house called “Hostal Vacors” in the District of Quimbiri where he provides guests the best accommodations ranging from single rooms to bridal suites. Accommodations include bathrooms, cable TV, and parking. His establishment is well-known for the services it provides. The building that houses Juan’s business has three floors and contains 28 rooms available for rent. He has managed this business for 22 years and generates good revenues so that he can pay the housekeeping staff. Juan enjoys managing his boarding house and making sure that his guests are comfortable. He plans to expand his business by building six more rooms.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Juan is willing to complete all of his payments on time because he wants to access another loan very soon. He is a well-liked member in his Communal Bank. His loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, and bricks.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build more rooms for his boarding house

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah O. is a 45-year-old man from Usenge, Kenya. He is married to Pamela Onyango, and they have eight children.  They live in Usenge area, which is not very far from Kisumu county.

Noah has a business of selling clothes and is applying for a third loan from KADET LTD after paying the previous loans successfully and on time. Noah plans to use the money to buy more clothes to add to his stock. He will use the profits from this business to pay his children's school fees. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.

His dream is to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add to his stock.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya , 50, is married and lives with her husband and one daughter in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past eight years. They have a decent standard of living. 

Enhtuya started selling food stuffs in 2000. At first she operated her grocery business in a small town with her husband. She came to the province center to sell coal and firewood in 2005. She takes orders from customers and delivers coal and firewood to their homes. She began making clothes and sewing handcraft items in addition to her business. Now her husband operates a transportation business using his mini-truck. Their children still help them, even though they have their own lives. 

Enhtuya is a hardworking person who says, "my husband and I have been trying hard to help our children start their own lives and we still need to make money to support our life. We want to continue operating our business." She is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to purchase clothing that she can sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange was born in 1976 in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. She now lives in the Lawole district with her husband, Stephane, and their only child, who is in education.

For the past year, Solange has sold refreshments from her home. This is her third loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments. It will allow her to purchase stock in bulk for resale. Her ambition is to buy her own plot of land. Her greatest attributes are her welcoming nature and her kindness.

loans.use: to purchase various drinks and refreshments for resale

loans.name: Ann Nyambura

texts.en:
Ann Nyambura G. operates a retail business that deals with assorted household items such as jugs, basins and face towels in Naivasha town. She has run this business for the last three years. She is 34 years old and married to Simon Mwangi, and they have two children.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by her friend, and this will be her third loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more retail goods to sell.

In the future, Ann hopes to grow her retail business into a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more retail goods to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna G. works hard to support her family. Lorna is married and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Lorna is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Lorna is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Luis Britaldo

texts.es:
Luis  tiene 30  años de edad, vive en casa propia en la zona rural de Pacora en una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque,  en su vivienda cuenta con servicios de  luz y agua.

Luis se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público en una mototaxi que es de su propiedad. Dicha labor la desempeña en los alrededores de su localidad  Esta actividad la viene realizando hace  varios años, en los que ha ido adquiriendo experiencia en el rubro y clientela fija.

Luis tiene la necesidad de darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi por lo que ha recurrido Edpyme Alternativa para solicitar u prestamos de 1500 nuevos soles.  Con los que el podrá realizar las compras de los repuestos necesarios para que pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Luis es un padre de familia bastante trabajador y de muy buen carácter, las personas que lo conocen le tienen mucha estima, cariño y respeto
texts.en:
Luis, age 30, lives in his own house in the rural zone of Pacora.  It is a small community with approximately 100 families.  It is 30 minutes from the city of Lambayeque.  His home has electricity and water service.

Luis provides public transportation service with his own “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). He does this work in the area surrounding where he lives. He has been doing this for several years. During this time he has been acquiring experience in the field and acquiring established customers.

Luis needs to perform maintenance on his taxi. That is why he has come to Edpyme Alternativa to request a loan for 1,500 soles. With the loan he will be able to buy the replacement parts he needs in order to be able to offer his customers better service.

Luis is a hard-working father of very good character.  The people that know him hold him in high esteem, and they have affection and respect for him.

loans.use: to perform maintenance and to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Fidencia

texts.es: El Sra. Fidencia utilizara su crédito para la colocación de una barda ya que tanto el como su esposo trabajan todo el día,  por lo cual su domicilio se queda la mayor parte del tiempo solo, comenta que en la actualidad hay mucha inseguridad por lo cual desea proteger su patrimonio,  ve en el crédito la posibilidad  de  realizar  su sueño por  lo  que  agradece  enormemente  el  apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Fidencia will use her loan to install a wall. She and her husband work all day and the house is left unattended most of the time. She says that there isn't very much safety which is why she wants to protect her home. The loan will give her the possibility to realize her dream. She is enormously thankful for the support provided.

loans.use: to build a wall on her property.

loans.name: Zambezi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 49 year old Jenipher (holding the yellow folder) from Masvingo.  She is widowed with four children.  

Jenipher runs a retail business selling clothing and footwear at the local flea market.  The business has been in operation for 10 years and she employs two people.  She says the main challenge she faces is limited capital.  Jenipher has requested a loan of $300 to increase her stock of clothes.  She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's quality of life as there will be more disposable income.  In the future Jenipher plans to grow her business into a shop.

loans.use: to increase stock of clothes

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Carmela has a retail shop that sells rice by the kilogram. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of rice per kilogram.

Carmela is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Carmela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: C1186 Ituze Group

texts.en:
Ladislas is 46 years old and is married with seven children between the ages of 5 and 23 years old.  He is the president of a group called “Ituze”. Ladislas is the first person in the left side. 

He sells products such as bananas, beans and sorghum.  Ladislas employs two people to help him and has been working for twelve years.  He operates his business from 7am to 8pm everyday.

Ladislas and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more products such as bananas, beans and sorghum for sale. With the profits from the loan, Ladislas and his team would like to satisfy the basic needs of their families, reinvest in their businesses and start saving.

loans.use: To buy more products such as bananas, beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Fariza

texts.ru:
Fariza zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Ona jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Fariza 45 let.
Fariza uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya prodajey molochnix produktov osobenno sira. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami kotoratya i pomogla yey otkrit etot magazin. Fariza seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupi molochniye produkti dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en: Fariza is married and has three children.  She lives in the Absheron region with her family.  Fariza is 45 years old.  For nine years already, Fariza has worked selling dairy products, especially cheese.  She started this business with her mother who helped her open the shop.  Fariza now needs 2000 AZN to buy dairy products for resale.

loans.use: to buy dairy products for resale

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida and husband, blessed with three children, is 52 years old and has been engaged in farming for 35 years now. For each harvest (April and November), she is able to earn an average of P25,000. She also manages a furniture-making business.

Although the businesses help her and her husband pay for the necessities at home, weather challenges such as typhoons and drought have adversely affected her business capital. For this reason, Aida is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy farm inputs such fertilizers and insecticides and pay farm labor costs. She will also use part of the loan to purchase some tools for her furniture shop.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides and pay farm labor costs.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. María Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 39 años y tiene una hija de 17 años estudiante de nivel superior.  Su carácter emprendedor que le ha caracterizado siempre y las ganas de salir adelante, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio con una inicial de S/. 100.00  Nuevos soles, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas preparadas en forma ambulatoria, las vende en los terminales terrestres, actualmente da pensión en su casa y reparte a domicilio, gracias al apoyo de su conviviente quien la traslada en su motocarro. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son estudiantes universitarios, vecinos, familiares y transeúntes.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1200.00 nuevos soles, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, verduras y frutas regionales, asimismo ollas, platos, vasos, mesas y sillas plásticas. 
María Mercedes es una mujer luchadora,  su sueño es contar con un Restaurant amplio y bien implementado, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
María Mercedes, 39, belongs to the “Los Eucaliptos” (The Eucalyptus Trees) communal bank in Tarapoto District, San Martín Province and Department.  She has a spouse and a 17-year-old daughter who is a high school student.

She’s always been characterized by an enterprising spirit and the drive to get ahead.  They have served for her to start her own business with an initial investment of 100 new soles.  She’s a street vendor of prepared food.  She sells at the bus stations.  At home, she provides daily meals and also sells door to door thanks to help from her spouse who drives her from place to place.  Gradually, she’s become well known among her customers who are university students, neighbors, family members and passersby.

She will use this 1200 new sol loan to buy ingredients for her meals like: sacks of rice and sugar, chickens and crates of eggs, bunches of bananas, noodles and oil by the dozen, regional fruit and vegetables as well as pots, plates, glasses and plastic tables and chairs.

María Mercedes is a tenacious woman who dreams with having a spacious, well equipped restaurant.  She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to make their dreams become a reality.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies: rice, chicken, pots, plates, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Ulanoi

texts.ru:
Уланой замужем и любящая мать 6 детей. Она умная и добрая женщина. Её муж уехал в Россию, чтобы зарабатывать денег и Уланой начала свой бизнес, чтобы помогать мужу для содержания семьи. Уланой выращивает морковь, картошки и капусту. Она хочет, получит максимальную прибыль и устроит своих детей в школу. Ей необходимо покупать горюче смазочные материалы и минеральных удобрений для переработки земли и семена для посева, чтобы получить хороший урожай в предстоящий сезон. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 1800$ США. Она надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать её. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Ulanoi is married and is a loving mother of six children.  She is a smart and kind woman.  Her husband left to go to Russia in order to earn money, and Ulanoi started her own business, so that she could help her husband to support the family.  Ulanoi grows carrots, potatoes and cabbage.  She wants to maximize her profits and place her children into a school.  She needs to buy lubricants and mineral fertilizers to recondition the land, and seeds for sowing, in order to receive a good harvest in the upcoming season.  This is why she is requesting a loan in the sum of $1800.  She hopes that creditors will support her.

loans.use: to purchase lubricants, seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rosalind

texts.en:
Rosalind is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Rosalind has been in this business for 6 years. Rosalind earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Rosalind has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is 54 years old and owns a sari-sari (variety store) in her community. In the five years she has owned this business, she has been able to support the studies of her five children. She says she is thankful to our creator's help and assistance. She continues her business to provide a better living for her family. 

She is requesting a loan amount of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs and biscuits to sell in her store. These goods are a big help in acquiring a higher income each month. She wants to continue increasing her profit in order to achieve success in business. This may cause her living condition to improve.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs and biscuits to sell in her store

loans.name: Anargul's Group

texts.en:
Anargul is the leader of this group. She is 45 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband, she is raising three daughters. The older daughter works in Russia, the second is a student, and the youngest daughter is pre-school aged (under seven). Five years ago, Anargul purchased two cattle and since that time she has been engaged in cattle breeding. Reselling cattle after fattening, she earns about 3000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future, Anargul plans to build a shed to keep cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and lives in Purok Rizal Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is married and has 3 children.  Teresita has a tractor for her business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to purchase another farm tractor. 

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy a tractor

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: La socia en la actualidad se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y de granos secos, la socia vende en el mercado en su stand granos como trigo, moraya, papa, cereales entre otros, la socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de productos secos y de animales menores para mejorar sus ganancias. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores como gallinas 10 y cuyes 10, también comprara productos secos como moraya, entre otros.
texts.en: The borrower currently works raising small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens and dry grains.  She sells grains like wheat, dehydrated potato and cereals, among others in her market stall.  She wants to use the loan to buy dry goods and small farm animals to improve her profits.  She is asking for the loan to buy small farm animals like 10 guinea pigs and 10 chickens and also to buy dry goods like dehydrated potato, among others.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals and dry goods.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 56 years old and lives in Tuyabang Alto,Oroquieta .She is married and has 4 children. Loreta has a general store business, earning approximately PHP 1,500 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock for her store.

Loreta has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to own a grocery store. Loreta hopes that her children can finish their studies. Loreta is a hardworking mother, an honest person and a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Shamsidin

texts.ru: Шамсидин занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят. Шамсидин женат. Ему 37 лет. У него четверо детей.
texts.en: Shamsidin grows, breeds and sells cattle.  He is 37 years old, married with four children.  Shamsidin has been in this industry for eight years.  He is asking for a loan of $650 to purchase calves.

loans.use: For the purchase of calves

loans.name: Vannara

texts.en:
Vannara is 30 years old and her husband, Socheat, is 34 years old. They live in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two daughters who are in school.

Vannara sells grocery items at home. Her husband is assisting his wife in the business. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her daughters to drive to school. 

Photo: The motorbike behind Vannara does not belong to her. It belongs to her customer. They come to buy grocery items.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her daughters to drive to school.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Nemia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Nemia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Nemia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru:
Анаре 32 года, замужем, воспитывает дочь дошкольного возраста. 
Анара  занимается животноводством, которое она начала в 2005 году, использовав для этого начальную сумму в 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Анары, на данный момент ее хозяйство, насчитывающее 1 голову нетели  и 1 бычка, дает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом от продажи молока и молочных продуктов.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота и кормов. Доходы Анара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает построить новый дом для семьи.
texts.en: Anara is 32, married, and is raising a daughter who is of pre-school age. Anara has her own livestock business, which she started in 2005 with a starting capital of 25,000 somi (KGS). Thanks to Anara's hard work and persistence, her farm, which began with one heifer and one steer, is generating a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk and dairy products. Aiming to further develop her business, Anara has asked Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle and feed. Anara plans to invest the proceeds from the loan into increasing her number of cattle, and dreams of building a new home for her family someday.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is 26-years-old, married and lives with five family members.

Karar has been the owner of a shop since 2010, selling spare parts for cars. He has a sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1500 loan in order to make a sliding door and an external ceiling. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to make a sliding door and an external ceiling.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
A 31-year-old and hard-working woman by the name of Victoria who is a high school graduate is a widow living together with her five children. The ages of the children are 1018-5yrs and all of her children are in school. For the past four years, Victoria has been selling charcoal. According to her, she will use the money to buy enough charcoal to sell. 

Victoria faces a problem with low income from her business. She transports her goods by car to her business center and sells 8 hours per day. She started this business from her son's savings and learned this trade from seeing other people doing it. She likes her business because it gives her money and what makes her proud is that she's able to buy things for herself. Her future plan is to have a big business and see her kids go to a good college. And thanks were her last statement.

loans.use: to buy enough charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Most Moldovan women love cosmetics and perfume, and those passing by Svetlana’s table in the open-air market are no exception.
