Adriana vive en la localidad de Villa Tumavi, del municipio de el torno distante a 15 km de la comunidad, es nacida en el departamento de Cochabamba, hace unos 18 años que se vino a vivir al departamento de Santa Cruz, con su esposo el cual ya falleció, la Sra. Adriana es viuda, el destino  del crédito es para terminar de construir su domicilio, necesita comprar materiales de construcción, hace unos 30 años que se dedica ala agricultura hoy en día ella con la ayuda de su hija, siembran papa, Maíz, Yuca, cítricos, y una ves que cosechan comercializan sus productos en el mercado de el Torno; se siente agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por el apoyo económico que le ha brindado.
texts.en: Adriana lives in a place called Villa Tumavi, about 15 kilometers outside of the center of Torno, in Santa Cruz.  She was born in Cochabamba, but 18 years ago she came to live in Santa Cruz with her husband.  Adriana's husband died and she is now a widow.   The loan she is requesting is to purchase materials to complete construction on her home.   30 years ago Adriana worked in agriculture, and now, with the help of her daughter, she grows potatoes, corn, yuca and citrus fruits, which she sells in the market of Torno.   Adriana is grateful to the organization Emprender and Kiva for the economic support they have provided to her.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to complete needed work on her home

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector tiene 47 años, es un hombre soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en su casa propia con su madre. La casa está ubicada en el caserío Guaraguaos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Hector se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace 15 años. Por un lado cría animales menores, especialmente ovinos, en el terreno situado detrás de su domicilio. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre quién esta fallecido, así que conoce a la perfección el rubro. Hector también se dedica al cultivo y la comercialización de limones y mangos. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades se encarga de ayudar a su madre con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Hector desea comprar más fertilizantes para la plantación de sus limones para mejorar la producción y la calidad del fruto. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Hector is 47 years old, is single, and has no children.  He lives with his mother in a home he owns.  The house is located in the village of Guaraguaos in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, located near the Piura region.  The Piura region is four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  

Hector has dedicated himself to agricultural work for the past 15 years.  He raises livestock, particularly sheep, on the land behind his home.  His father, who passed away, taught him how to do this, so he knows the trade well.  Hector also dedicates himself to growing and selling lemons and mangos.  He helps his mother support their family with the income he generates from these activities.  

Hector would like to buy more fertilizer for his lemon crop to improve the production and quality of the fruit.  For this reason, he believed it would be beneficial to request a 1000 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa, an organization that is helping him realize his goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: 'god Is Able' Group

texts.en:
Patience F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of three borrowers called 'God Is Able'. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children who are 14 and 8 years old. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to financial constraints. She cares for two siblings. 

For two years, she has been selling slippers in the Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian Dollars business loan to buy more slippers for resale.

She describes herself as a jovial woman whose goals are to improve her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Agatha is inset because she was absent during the loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more slippers for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more snacks and organges for her business.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Phiona has a business of outside catering, which she has had for five years.

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cooking oil and charcoal for making chapattis for sale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Phiona hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Phiona hopes to become a lawyer after her studies.

Phiona is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and charcoal for making chapattis for sale.

loans.name: C9333 Twubakane Group

texts.en:
Isaac is 31 years old and is married with two children, aged one and three years old. He is the president of the group which is called "Twubakane" in the local language. Isaac is the first person on the left side. He owns a business selling foodstuffs such as sugar, rice, salt, bread, etc. This group contains seven members: three women and four men.

Isaac and his group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their businesses through purchasing more goods. Through this expansion, Isaac and his group will be able to earn more profit, which will allow them to save in the future and to pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like rice, sugar, bread and so on.

loans.name: Dok

texts.en:
Dok S., 32, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known as one of Angkorean Temples. S. sells coffee and breakfast, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of USD 6 per day to help cover the family expenses.  Each month, the family has to spend USD 110 on food and USD 20 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to build chicken cages and purchase chickens to raise for sale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to build chicken cages and purchase chickens to raise for sale

loans.name: Marmie

texts.en:
Marmie R. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Marmie is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marmie owns & operates transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. Marmie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marmie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marmie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marmie is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Marmie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Rosas De Villa Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE VILLA INGENIO” iniciará el ciclo número cuarto en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  María.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción de artesanías, producción de cuero, carpintería, servicio de comida y tejido de máquina
 
La señora María indica que hace veinte años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de artesanías en cuero desde hace veinticinco años
 
El crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su capital (material de cuero)para la elaboración de las carteras, las que venderá por mayor en diferentes lugares, ya que viaja para vende sus productos a diferentes lugares. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos
texts.en:
The “Rosas de Villa Ingenio" community bank is about to start its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Germán Busch regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is led by María.  The businesses that the members of the bank carry out are varied and include: commerce, making handicrafts, leather production, carpentry, a meals service and machine knitting.

María tells us that she has been working in Pro Mujer community banks for twenty years.  She was invited to join by a promoter.  She has a business making handicrafts from leather which she has had for twenty-five years.

María will use the loan that she is requesting to increase her capital by purchasing leather which she will use to make billfolds that she will then sell wholesale.  She travels to different places to sell her products.  This work enables her to make money with which to support her family.  María is married and has three children.

loans.use: to buy leather

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Robert has a barber shop that provides services like hair cuts. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of  PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed to maintain the service.

Robert is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future ,Robert hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy new scissor, alcohol, powder and more to be used in the service

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Ek, age 44, is a rice farmer who has been living in the Ornlong Veng District of Siem Reap Province. Her husband is employed in the public sector as a soldier and has a specific salary every month. They are blessed with two school-age children and are able to live under their income. With the rainy season coming now, Ek would like to request some funding in order to pay for plowing costs and to begin planting potato seeds. Ek hopes she will increase her income by using a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs and to begin planting potato seeds.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a divorced woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are town dwellers. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the Kshs 5,000 she wants to purchase sacks of ground nuts, wheat flour and sweets. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of ground nuts, wheat flour and sweets.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2008, Afi sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des pagnes à Lomé. Femme d’un instituteur, elle a 02 enfants. Elle veut voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions, avoir sa propre boutique.
texts.en: A retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) since 2008, Afi is requesting this loan to buy some pagne cloth in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is the wife of a primary school teacher and has two children. She wants to see her children grow up in the right environment and to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 38 years old, married and the father of two children. For the last four years, he has earned a living by running a retail shop where he earns about KES 5,000 a month, all of which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he learned about from a friend who is a member. He will use the loan to buy more items, including sugar, rice and wheat flour, to sell to his customers. With the additional income made possible by this loan, he plans to go into the business of selling kerosene. His hope is to open a wholesale business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and wheat flour to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Sara Magdalena

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer emprendedora de 34 años, que se vio en la necesidad de emprender un negocio propio para apoyar en los ingresos de su hogar ya que debido a la crisis que aumenta cada día no se abastecían con los gastos que se generan en el diario vivir. Junto a su hermana con la que trabajan desde las 7:00 hasta las 15:00 haciendo comida y  recorriendo el sector vendiendo ropa. La competencia es dura indica pero no hay que desfallecer.

Tienen 2 hijos cada uno de 15 y 9 años que estudian en instituciones públicas y está casada con Jorge quien trabaja como asalariado en una compañía. Desea un préstamo para comprar más mercadería y ropa , para así poder poner un local propio que lleve su nombre.
texts.en: Sara is an enterprising 34 year-old woman who saw the need to start her own business so that she could contribute to the household income, because due to the economic crisis the cost of living has been rising each day.  She works with her sister from 7am until 3pm making food and going out in the neighborhood selling clothing.  The competition is stiff, but she doesn't lose heart.  They each have 2 children aged 15 and 9 who are in public school.  Sara is married to Jorge, who works as an employee for a company.  She wants a loan to purchase more merchandise and clothing so that she can have her own store that carries her name.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Nshoko Kwekamba Group

texts.en:
A sparky disposition is what has endeared 54-year-old Jackson to his clientele. He has won laurels for the good-humored way he relates to clients who purchase goats and local gin from him. This has, in many respects, put his business in the running. Though he still has much more ground to make up to solidify his niche, he remains upbeat about success. For Jackson, the sky is the only limit.

Jackson, who is happily married with 6 lively kids, plies his trade in Bushenyi. His business took root 6 years ago. In those 6 years, he has strengthened his insight on how to run a business proficiently. Jackson says his goat sales trade is much more profitable than his local gin business, but he runs them concurrently and does not have any regrets.

On the side, Jackson also subsists on income from a modest farming business. Weekly, he says his sales income from his goat sales trade is in the sum of 100,000 Ugandan shillings. "It could be more if I had more goats," he notes.

Jackson says with this Kiva loan, he will begin with a clean slate. He plans on purchasing more goats to resell. He also plans on purchasing molasses to make more local gin.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell and molasses to make more local gin.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is 36 years old, married with five children aged nine months to 14 years. He is the sole bread winner for his family that lives in Hioma, Uganda. He has a motorcycle business and has been running it for the past two years. His major challenge is the rainy season which disrupts his work. His dream is to have at least three motorcycles in the next five years. Deo needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Bwanya Plus Group

texts.en:
Walelu is the leader of the Community Bank named “Bwanya Plus” which means 'dignity' in English. It is composed of seven members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Walelu has been a micro-entrepreneur for years. He runs a cement facility to the East of Kinshasa. He works hard with good management skills in order to achieve his goal of one day opening a larger cement facility in his environment. He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business that earns her $280 per month. Walelu is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having four times obtained and correctly repaid loans. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying some more bags of cement and reselling them at a profit. Sixty-three years old, Walelu is married and the father of seven children whose ages vary between 13 and 37 years; two of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his business by buying some more bags of cement and reselling them at a profit.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with three children, one of whom is attending school, while the other two are working. Her husband who is employed contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child. 

She has operated as a food vendor for the past three years. Her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of establishing a hotel business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu because of low loan interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Shahla's Group

texts.en:
Shahla has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s spare parts business. He started his business 10 years ago with a small investment. Now he is well established in his business but he needs continuous investment to purchase spare parts for his shop. He is a very hard worker with a good business sense. Shahla is hopeful that her husband’s business will bring more profits to him after making an investment into it. 

She is a mother of five children. Two of her children are studying while her other three children are young and not of school-going age yet. Shahla is a very active and supportive lady who does her household responsibilities very well and tries her best to provide comfort to her family.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahla.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is a banku (fermented corn/cassava dough) seller at Elmina. She prepares it, bags and peddles with it. The tray on her lap has some banku wrapped in transparent bags that will be sold to her customers. Fati has received a junior high education. She is divorced and has 2 children. Her business is about 5 years old. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy maize in bags and fresh fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to buy maize in bags and fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Tumbuh Kembang 9 Group

texts.en:
Yayan is a widow. She has been selling things such as oil, sugar and snacks from a kiosk in front of her house. Now she wants to add gallons of water and liters of gasoline to her kiosk to sell as well. Her business has been going well, but she is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to hopefully help continue to grow it. The income from her business enables her to feed her family.

Yayan hopes someday she can become an agent of the gasoline company and sell wholesale to customers like herself now. She also hopes that all of her children and grandchildren grow up with the opportunity and finances to attend school.

loans.use: to pay for gallons of water and liters of gasoline to resell in a kiosk

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with four children. Estrella is 57 years old, residing at Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Estrella owns and operates a gardening land, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale to earn a living, and she's been 30 years in this business. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this business. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Estrella is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Estrella wants to make improvements to her house and enable her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Tul

texts.en:
Tul (in the photo) is a fisherman. His wife, Saras stays at home because she has diabetes. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have six children (four sons and two daughters). One is a fisherman, three are in school, one is a weaver, and one child lives at home. 
Tul hopes to increase the volume of fish that he catches, so he has decided to request another loan of $800 to buy fishing nets and one additional boat motor for his son who is also a fisherman.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and a boat motor for his son’s fishing business.

loans.name: Byiel

texts.en:
Byiel is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a food stall in South Sudan for the past four years.

Byiel requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase maize flour, soda and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, soda and onions to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells clothes and cooking utensils in Brasi near Abura.  Efua is married to a mason and has four dependents.  Efua uses her income to help her husband provide for their family.  She will use this loan to purchase more clothes and cooking utensils to sell.  With the new profits generated by this loan, Efua plans to acquire a shop in which to sell her clothes.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and cooking utensils to sell.

loans.name: Nadar

texts.en: Nadar is a 44 year old man from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to make improvements to his home by increasing the number of rooms. His future plans are to own a home.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.en:
Madam Kossiwa D. was born on 28th April 1968 in Lomé, eigth (08) of a family of twelve (12) children, she had to stop her secondary studies after her failure in o’level examinations due to the incapacity of her poor parents to pay the school fees. After few years spent to follow her mother in the market, she has opted for the cloth dressing. Today, married and mother of four (04) children, she manages herself her workshop with difficulties, for lack of financial means despite the support of her husband who does not succeeding himself to make (both) ends meets. Very dynamic and devoted with her experience in the domain for about 20 years, Madam D., has made proof of a trusty woman from her two first credits repaid without incident. She has a mastery of her businesses and deserve to be backed financially in order to allow him to enlarge her workshop and substitute the haberdashery. For that purpose, Madam D. requests a credit of $950 which will serve to enlarge her workshop, to acquire a new sewing machine to buy and resell the articles of haberdashery (buttons, zippers, linings, hairpin, etc.). Surely, this credit will give her a second breathe at the economic plan what would have without doubt positive consequences on her family life and on her children education which she wants by all means.

Madame D. Kossiwa est née le 28 Avril 1968 à Lomé, Huitième (8ème) d’une famille de douze (12) enfants, elle a dut arrêté ses études secondaires après son échec au BEPC à cause de l’incapacité de ces parents pauvres à lui payer les frais de scolarité. Après quelques années passées à suivre sa maman au marché, elle opta pour l’apprentissage de la couture. Aujourd’hui mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle gère elle-même son atelier de couture non sans difficultés, faute de moyens financiers malgré le soutien de son mari qui lui-même n’arrive pas à joindre les deux bouts. Très dynamisme et dévouée avec son expérience dans le domaine depuis presque 20 ans, Madame D., a fait preuve d’une femme de confiance à partir de ses deux premiers crédits remboursés sans incident. Elle a une maîtrise de ses affaires et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement afin de lui permettre d’agrandir son atelier et en substituer la mercerie. Pour ce faire, Madame D. Kossiwa sollicite un crédit de $950 qui servira à agrandir de son atelier de couture, à acquérir une nouvelle machine à coudre et acheter pour revendre des articles de mercerie (boutons, fils, fermetures, doublures, épingles, etc.). A coup sûr, ce crédit lui donnera un second souffle au plan économique. Ce qui aura sans doute des conséquences positives sur sa vie familiale et sur l’éducation de ses enfants qui lui tient vraiment à cœur.

loans.use: to acquire a new sewing machine, to buy and resell the articles of haberdashery

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas has been in the business of chemistry for the last ten years. He is married and has three children who are going to school. He also has a brother who depends on him.

Given the loan, he wants to purchase additional stock so that he can cater to both humans and livestock. This will enable him to increase sales and income.

He plans to use the funds to educate his children and build a house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for his business.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia K. is 57 years old and has run an agricultural business since 1990. Previously she worked in the state agricultural company in Silistra. Now she has her own 300-square-meter greenhouse in which she grows tomatoes and cucumbers. She also farms 10 decares of land on which she grows onions, cabbages, carrots, potatoes, and other crops. She sells her crops in the city cooperative market. Anastasia is asking for a  loan of $1200 that she will use to buy seedlings.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Dingamyom

texts.fr: Monsieur Dingamyom D. est âgé de 34 ans. Il est célibataire et a bénéficié d'une formation dans le domaine de la coordonnerie. Il a ouvert un atelier de réparation des chaussures au coin d'une rue dans le quartier qu'il habite. Les gens sont satisfaits de son travail, parce qu'il repare rapidement les chaussures usées qu'on lui confie. Il veut se lancer dans la fabrication des chaussures locales, mais il manque de ressources financières pour acheter le cuir, la colle et les ficelles. Pour son projet, il sollicite un prêt de 225 dollars. Cet prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son revenu

loans.use: Achat de cuire, de la colle et des ficelles pour fabriquer des chaussures

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy environmental friendly bags and other household goods for resale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Due to the fact that her husband was not earning sufficient amount of money to support her and their children, in August 1992, Rosa M. started selling ceramics for a lady where she was paid on commission. When she realized that this was a good business, she decided to work independently and start her own business selling beauty products such as Avon, Fuller and Jafra. Later, she also started to sell jewelry and, currently, she is also selling clothing. She is fortunate that she is able to sell such a variety of articles due to the demand from her clients.

At the moment, she needs a larger supply of merchandise such as clothes and jewelry for the winter season to offer to her clients. Rosa is seeking a credit of $375 to be repaid in four months. With your help, Rosa will be able to expand her small business so that her children can finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Debido a que su esposo no ganaba lo suficiente, como para mantenerla a ella y sus hijos, Rosa M. en Agosto de 1992, comenzó vendiendo cerámica que una señora le daba a comisión para que ella se la vendiera. Como se dio cuenta que era un buen negocio decidió independizarse además de comenzar a vender productos de belleza como Avon, Fuller, Jafra, posteriormente se dedicó también a vender joyería y actualmente también se dedica a la venta de ropa, todo esto gracias a que su clientela le ha ido pidiendo diferentes tipos de artículos.

Actualmente necesita surtir de mercancía así como ropa y joyería de la temporada de invierno para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Rosa está solicitando un crédito de US $375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses. Con tu ayuda rosa podrá crecer su pequeño negocio, para poder sacar a sus hijos de la escuela y estos sean hombres de bien.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the winter season.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is 36 years old and married with 5 children.   With five children, all in school, Fatmata needs to help generate enough income to meet the family’s expenses.  Her business income supplements her husband’s meager income. She sells cosmetics in the open-air market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.  She is requesting a loan of $175 to expand her stock.

loans.use: add to her stock of cosmetics for sale so that she can increase her profits

loans.name: New Budding (Tunas Baru) Group

texts.id:
Kelompok Tunas Baru (New Budding Group) resides in Desa (Village) Melaya Krajan Kecamatan Melaya. Kelompok Tunas Baru consists of housewives who agree to form a group to rear pigs. Why name the group Tunas Baru (New Budding)? Because the group usually pioneer or become example of growth and is usually imitated by other housewives who do not posses business activities in their family. Each member receive a loan of Rp. 1.500.000,- (about USD160) which will be used as piglet and supplies funding. With this funding each member usually rear 2 piglets. Each year Kelompok Tunas Baru usually sells the pigs twice, once every 6 months. On average profit from each member for each sale is Rp. 200,000,- (about USD20). Besides rearing pigs, Kelompok Tunas Baru also has group conformity standards, which includes meeting routinely, once a month. In such meetings, members mutually share experiences in pig rearing. Most of the times the members gained positive outcome, usually learning better ways of pig rearing. Members are also valid organization is able to regulate the family’s output. The desire of Kelompok Tunas Baru is to become the group that yield by way of assistance of funding from Dinari.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Kelompok Tunas Baru beralamatkan di Desa Melaya Krajan Kecamatan Melaya. Kelompok Tunas Baru terdiri dari ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang bersepakat untuk membentuk suatu kelompok yang memiliki usaha beternak babi. Mengapa diberi nama Tunas Baru? Supaya kelompok ini bisa menjadi pelopor atau contoh yang bisa tumbuh dan bisa ditiru oleh ibu-ibu lainnya yang tidak memiliki usaha dalam rumah tangganya. Setiap anggota mendapatkan pinjaman sebesar Rp.1.500.000,- yang dipergunakan sebagai modal bibit dan pakannya. Dengan modal ini setiap anggota bisa memelihara 2 ekor babi penggemukan. Setiap 1 tahun kelompok Tunas Baru bisa menjual babinya 2 kali, dijual per 6 bulan. Rata-rata keuntungan dari masing-masing anggota per panen Rp. 200,000,-. Disamping usaha ternak, kelompok Tunas Baru juga memiliki kebersamaan dalam kelompok seperti pertemuan rutin yang diadakan setiap bulan. Dalam pertemuan ini anggota saling tukar pengalaman dalam beternak babi. Banyak sekali hal positif yang diterima oleh anggota kelompok Tunas Baru, anggota bisa belajar bagaimana cara memelihara ternak yang baik. Anggota juga bisa berorganisasi yang benar dan bisa mengatur pengeluaran rumah tangga. Harapan dari kelompok Tunas baru supaya kelompok ini bisa menjadi kelompok yang berhasil lewat bantuan dana yang diterima dari Dinari.

loans.use: Purchase superior piglets and quality supplies (Membeli bibit babi jenis unggul dan pakan berkwalitas)

loans.name: Jader Genaro

texts.es:
Hardware and tools are used in many activities, which is why Jader C. wisely devoted himself to selling hardware products in the Central Market of León more than five years ago.

Currently, he is the father of two children, a boy and a girl, that he tells us are his entire motive for his working so hard to meet their needs.

Three months ago, Mr. C. got his first credit through CEPRODEL, and according to him, it has benefited him greatly, and he now sees greater income, and has been able to supply the needs of his two small children. He greatest need these days is the acquisition of hardware and tools.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Los productos de ferretería son muy utilizados para muchas actividades, es por esto que muy sabiamente desde hace más de cinco años el señor Jader C. se dedica a la comercialización de productos ferreteros en el mercado Central del departamento de León.

Actualmente es padre de dos pequeños (un niño y una niña) que según cuenta son todo el motivo por el cual él se esfuerza para satisfacer todas sus necesidades.

Desde hace tres meses, el señor C. realizó su primer crédito en CEPRODEL y según comenta le fue de mucho beneficio ya que percibió mejores ingresos y además logró suplir las necesidades de sus pequeños hijos. Su mayor necesidad hoy en día es la adquisición de los productos ferreteros.

loans.use: Purchase of hardware and tools for resale

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es:
Maria Celia is 43 years old and has been separated from her husband for a few years now. She lives with her daughter in her sister, Blanca C.'s house. One of her sons is coming back from the barracks soon and her daughter is still in high school.

She has been selling onions for more than 4 years. There is some competition, but her stall is in the main market with all the other onion sellers, so the buyers know exactly where to go.

With this loan, she will buy a sound system for $200 and a table with drawers for $50. She will use her current wages to repay it. Maria has had loans before with financial companies as she took out credit through a group she was in. She has now finished paying off this loan and therefore has the opportunity to get more credit. This will be her third loan, and her credit rating is very good. She is a very good candidate.

Translated from Spansih by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Celia es una señora de 43 años de edad que actualmente está separada de su esposo desde hace varios años atrás. Actualmente vive sólo con su hija en la casa de su hermana que se llama Blanca C.. Uno de sus hijos esta por llegar del cuartel y su hija aún está estudiando en colegio. Tiene una experiencia de más de 4 años en el comercio de cebollas. La competencia es media, su puesto de venta se encuentra en un mercado principal y exactamente en un sector de comercio de cebollas, por lo que las compradoras ya saben donde dirigirse. Con la presente solicitud comprará el equipo de sonido que costara aproximadamente 200$us y la comoda unos 50$us. Con el saldo se cancelara su actual crédito en la institución. Maria tuvo un antecedente en una entidad financiera como consecuencia de un crédito en grupo que sacaron, ella termino de cancelar el crédito. Se le dio la oportunidad en la institución y actualmente esta con su tercer crédito, su promedio de mora es bajisimo, casi cero. Tiene un excelente comportamiento.

loans.use: To buy and use a table with drawers and a sound system/Consumo, compra de comoda y equipo de sonido

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 57-year-old father of 3. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Mohamad sells clothing. This is the seventh time he has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. Mohamad wants to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase his stock

loans.name: Maida

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 24 year-old Maida K.. She is married and has 3 children aged 1, 6 and 15, who live with her. In 2000, Maida established her genge business.She now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop or stall is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk .

loans.name: Mulika

texts.en:
Mulika O. sells cosmetics and bread. This is a skill that she acquired for over two years. She has been in this business since1988. She is 50 years old and married with six children. She lives in Okoko in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Mulika has been a LAPO client for the past four years and she needs a loan for $425.00 to enable her buy more cosmetics and bread to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and bread to sell.

loans.name: Teodolinda Magdalena

texts.es:
Teodolinda, at 20 years of age, had to overcome her husband's infidelity. He abandoned her and left her alone with two children, but thanks to the support of her parents, she was able to get ahead and start a business selling sweets. Her parents' house is very close to the school in town, which improved the possibility of her business being succesful. Nevertheless, Teo hopes to be able to grow her business and to sell basic supplies in addition to sweets, so her customers are not only children. For this, she will need to buy new merchandeis that covers the needs of her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Teodolinda, a los 20 años tuvo que superar el engaño de su pareja quien la abandonó, dejándola sola con dos hijos, pero gracias al apoyo de sus padres puedo salir adelante y poner un pequeño negocio de dulces. La casa de sus padres es muy cercana a la escuela del pueblo y esto mejoró la posibilidad de que su negocio tenga éxito, sin embargo, Teo espera ahora poder incrementar su negocio y además de dulces, vender también víveres y productos de primera necesidad para que sus clientes no sean sólo los niños. Para ello necesita comprar nueva mercadería que cubra las expectativas de sus vecinos.

loans.use: To acquire new merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Nasra Rehman's Tumaini Letu Group

texts.en:
Nasra Rahman, age 32, is married and has three children (ages 11, 9, and 6). She has a clothing shop that she started in 1999. She works from 8 AM to 8 PM daily, and is able to make a profit of about $172 a month.

In the past, she has had 4 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy land. She is requesting a new loan so she can open a salon. Nasra will share this loan with her loan group, called Tumaini Letu, which has 19 members. These members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture, Nasra is the second person from the left, in an orange blouse.

loans.use: Open a new salon

loans.name: Danaya (La Confince) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe(deux mariés et deux célibataires) Danaya  de l’association Soro Yiriwa de Médine ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 1 enfant. Elles vivent dans des familles nucleaires au quartier Médine de la ville de Sikasso( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues dans le quartier en raison du voisinage.
Elles font généralement le commerce d’habits pour enfants, de savons (de fabrication moderne et traditionnelle), de charbon de bois, des produits alimentaires et  divers articles.
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités les femmes du groupe Danaya ont décidé ensemble de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso qui accepta de leur octroyer leur sixième prêt. et  tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt,  10 douzaines d’habits pour enfants,  5 cartons de savon de toilette, 2 sacs de savon de fabrication traditionnelle (gabacourouni)et divers articles alimentaires.
Généralement, elles se ravitaillent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso auprès des grossistes pour les revendre sur place à Sikasso (à domicile) et dans les villages environnants les jours de foire en détails, au comptant ou à crédit. Les marchandises sont soit étalées sur des tables (au marché du quartier de Médine) ou mises dans des tasses pour les vendre de porte en porte. La clientèle est composée de femmes et quelques fois des hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice par cycle de 60. 000FCFA, lequel sera utilisé pour subvenir aux dépenses quotidiennes des familles, payer les intérêts du prêt  et investir le reste dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Danaya (two married women and two single women) of the Soro Yiriwa of Medicine assocation are on average 30 years of age with one child. They live with nuclear families in the Médine area of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know each other due to being neighbors in the area. They are involved in the general business of clothing for children, soaps (made both traditionally and from modern methods), charcoal, food products and diverse other items. In order to increase the size of their sales these women of the Danaya group decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso which agreed to provide them with a sixth loan. All previous loans were paid back on time. With this loan, they are planning to purchase 10 dozen clothes for children, 5 boxes of body soap, 2 bags of soap manufactured traditionally (gabacourouni) and various food products. Generally, they obtain fresh supplies from the large market in the city of Sikasso from the bulk vendors and re-sell them door to door in Sikasso and in the surrounding villages during market days for cash or credit. The merchandise are either displayed on tables (at the market in the area of Médine) or put in bags to be sold from door to door. The customers are mostly women and sometimes men. They plan to earn a profit of 60,000 FCFA per cycle (approximately $ 130), which would be used to support daily expenses of the families, repay interest on the loan and invest in the rest of their activities.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothes for children, soaps and other items

loans.name: Lenin

texts.es: Lenin es un hombre trabajador, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo, es propietario de dos motocarros, uno de ellos lo maneja él, y el otro, su hermano, a quien le brinda trabajo de esa forma. Lenin es padre de 3 hijos, los cuales estudian y lo quieren mucho, su esposa Lucia quien se dedica a al venta de ropa, también lo apoya mucho y está de acuerdo con lo que se propone para el progreso familiar.Lo más importante es hacer estudiar a sus hijos, para que en un mañana sean profesionales.El motivo por el que solicita este préstamo es para comprar repuestos para mejorar sus motos, gracias a esta actividad estabilizó su economía y su nivel de vida, por ello quiere crecer en este rubro, y posteriormente comprarse otras motos.
texts.en:
Lenin is a hardworking man dedicated to transporting passengers for many years now. He is the owner of two motocarts: one of them is driven by Lenin and the other by his brother, to whom he offers a job in this way. Lenin is the father of three children, who study and love him very much. His wife, Lucia, who is dedicated to selling clothing, also supports him a lot and agrees with his plans for their family. The most important thing is to make his kids study, so that one day they will be professionals. He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to improve his motocarts. Thanks to this activity, his economy and lifestyle is stable, and he wants to grow in this business, and eventually buy other motocarts.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spare parts for his motocarts.

loans.name: Oulimata

texts.fr:
Oulimata est une brave sénégalaise, elle vend des consommables de bureau et divers articles.
Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son stock car la demande est forte en ce moment d'ouverture des classes
texts.en:
Oulimata is a hard-working Senegalese who sells office supplies and sundry merchandise.

She is requesting this loan to bolster her inventory since there is a lot of demand now when people are going back to school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to bolster her inventory of office supplies

loans.name: Yesenia Asunción

texts.es:
La señora Yesenia  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción”  del Distrito de J., Provincia de Chucuito-Puno, vive en el Jr. San Juan Nº 146  y tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de una niña de 8 años, termino sus estudios superiores y se dedica a todo tipo de negocios según la temporada de venta. Su esposo se dedica al manejo de carros “chofer”.
 Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro artículos de joyería como artes, collares y pulseras, después de 2 años cambio de rubro y abrió una Tienda .Ella es independiente en sus negocios, es muy activa en el trabajo, actualmente cuenta con tiendita escolar en el Centro Educativo Nº 890 de J.  que abre a partir de las 9 de la mañana y  por las tardes sigue vendiendo en su Tienda de Abarrotes.

Con este préstamo que recibirá de S/: 3000.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas comprara  material (cinta cola de rata) para confeccionar carteras, correas, etc.

Su deseo es construir su casa  e implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yesenia belongs to the communal bank "Immaculate Conception" in the J. district in Chucuito-Puno province (Peru). She lives in Junior San Juan No. 146 and is 31 years old. Mrs. Yesenia lives with her partner, and has an 8 year old daughter. She finished her higher education and works in various types of businesses depending on the season. Her husband is a chauffeur.

With her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles (US $100), Yesenia bought artistic jewelry, necklaces, and bracelets. After 2 years, she changed directions and opened a shop. She is independent in her business and very active at work. Currently, she has a school shop in the Educational Center No. 890 in J., which opens at 9am. In the afternoons, Yesenia continues to work in her grocery store.

Yesenia is requesting a loan of 3000 Peruvian Soles (US $975), which will be used to buy material (ribbon) to make wallets, belts, and so on. The loan will be repaid in 4 installments. Her desire is to build her house and improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make crafts (i.e. wallets, belts)

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married and has two grown children. She sells various home products at the central market in Berdyansk, and she has a very good selling location with a good flow of customer traffic.. Her monthly gross income is 4,000 UAH, the profit is about 2,000 UAH (about $253).

Alla works with her daughter in her business, and they are both known as hard-working, responsible business women. They know their customers and what they like, and this helps them keep old customers and attract new ones. Alla is requesting a loan so she can purchase new inventory. She will use her increased earnings to repair her house and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Wilma De

texts.es:
La Sra. Wilma tiene la edad de 55 años es casada y cuenta con dos hijos que viven en su domicilio, cuenta con vivienda propia que esta inscrita en DDRR a su nombre. La Sra. Wilma cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su  propio domicilio, hace mas mas de 3 años que cuenta con esta tienda de abarrotes. 
La tienda de abarrotes es la unica mas surtida de la zona en la que los vecinos encuentran lo que necesitan.                                                                                          El destino del credito es para el capital de operacion de su tienda de abarrotes para aumentar mas mercaderia ya que en la epoca de fin de año tiene mas ventas. La clienta tiene un buen historial crediticio en nuestra institucion ya que es el cuarto credito que refinancia teniendo un buen comportamiento de pago, ademas cuenta con credito tambien en otra institucion de la cual esta pagando en fecha.
texts.en:
Wilma is 55 years old, married and has two children who live at home. She owns her own home which is legally registered under her name. Wilma has a grocery store located in her home and has had the store for more than 3 years. The store is the only well-stocked one in the area in which her neighbors can find the goods they need. This loan will be used for working capital for the store in order to have more merchandise for the end of the year when there are more sales. Wilma has good credit; this is her fourth loan and she has had a good payment history. She also has a loan with another institution that is being paid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for store

loans.name: Mwachum

texts.en:
Mwachum has owned a nursery school in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250. She works at her business for 14 hours every day. 

Mwachum is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more supplies for her business. She hopes that this loan will increase her profit so that she will be able to pay school fees for her children and save some money.  

Mwachum is 40 years old, married, and has two children aged 24 and 14.

loans.use: To buy more school materials to improve her business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhàn  năm nay 47 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 1995. Trong suốt 13 năm tham gia Quỹ  gia đình chị Nhàn luôn sử dụng vốn vay để chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Với sự chăm chỉ và những kinh nghiệm sẵn có công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển hơn. Hàng tháng với mức thu nhập 6.000.000đ từ chăn nuôi lợn, gà và sự hỗ trợ của 3 con đã đi làm  gia dình chị không chỉ hoàn trả  vốn  tốt cho Quỹ mà còn có điều kiện để tích luỹ và tạo điều kiện cho 2 con đi học.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., 47 years old, has joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 1995. In thirteen years being a TYM Fund member, Mrs. N. has always used her loan in raising animals to increase her family's income. With diligence and experience, her farm has grown significantly. Each month, with 6,000,000 VND (equivalent to 345 USD) from raising pigs and chicken and from her three children's wages, Mrs N. is able not just to give TYM the repayments but also to save some money towards her children's schooling. In the coming loan cycle, she'd like to borrow 20,000,000 VND (equivalent to 1150 USD) to buy more pigs and food for pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Sedenko

texts.fr: Née en 1943 à Havé Doumé dans la Zio au Sud du Togo, Mme Sedenko A. est une femme veuve et mère de six (06) enfants. Elle a comme activité la vente de produits de premières nécessités et de produits vivriers. Cette activité lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge et de faire face à certains besoins de sa famille. Toutefois, elle est confrontée à un manque crucial de fonds de base. Elle est dans l’incapacité de renouveler son stock régulièrement. Pour y remédier, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de constituer un stock suffisant de marchandises afin satisfaire ses clients et dégager de bénéfices importants.
texts.en:
Born in 1943 in Havé Doumé in Zio in the South of Togo, Mrs. Sedenko A. is a widow and mother of six children. She sells staple goods and foodstuffs. This allows her to make enough money to support herself and some of her family's needs. However she is faced with a critical lack of funds and is unable to renew her stock regularly. To solve this, she is asking for a loan which will allow her to restock enough merchandise to satisfy her customers and make sustantial profits.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple goods and foodstuffs to retail

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Juan José G. le esta haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventanas y puertas de su casa, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder poner las protecciones. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder tener su casa más segura ya que el trabaja como oficial de seguridad en turno de la noche, le preocupa la seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Jose Garces' home is lacking locks on his windows and doors, but at this time, he does not have the money to install these protections. He is applying for a loan in order to make his home more secure because he works as a security guard during the night and worries about the safety of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of locks

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: La señora Cruz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Esperanza”, vive en el Jr. Iquitos Nº cdra. 04, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y es madre 03 hijos, 02 que todavía depende de ella.Con su crédito de S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia, inició su negocio vendiendo bebidas  y  nos cuenta que le va muy bien. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio vendiendo sus menús en un local amplio, ubicada en la en su misma casa, donde vende a los moradores de la comunidad, amigos y vecinos. También se dedica al Alquiler de cuartos y mas adelante desea implementarlo mejor. Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá, ampliando e implementando su negocio, y comprará materiales como madera, calaminas, ladrillos y bolsas de cementos. Y parte del dinero también lo utilizara comprando paquetes de gaseosas de todos los sabores y tamaños.Ella mayormente toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente más independiente y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y en los actos de su vida diaria.Nos manifiesta su gran agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que quieren emprender su negocio y salir adelante solas.
texts.en:
Ms. Cruz, belongs to the Banco Comunal "La Esperanza" and lives in Iquitos Jr. No. 4 block, Juanjui District, Department of San Martín. She lives with her partner, is 36 years old and mother of 3 children, 2 of whom still depend on her. With her loan of S /. 300.00, taken on her own initiative, she started a business selling drinks and tells us that it is doing very well. At present, she continues the business serving a menu in a large space, located right in her home, where she sells to residents of the community, friends and neighbors. She also rents rooms and later wants to improve on this business. With this loan of S /. 3000.00 to be repaid in 6 months, she will invest to expand her business and buy materials such as wood, calamine, bricks and cement bags. She will also use some of the money to buy packs of soda in many flavors and sizes. She generally make decisions regarding the profits of her business. She now feels more independent and responsible by paying her accounts and in the events of her daily life. She expresses her deep gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and support other women who want to start their own business and succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials such as calamine, brick and cement.  And to Purchase softdrinks for sale,

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
“When I started farming, I didn’t know how to plant rice. My husband taught me how to. Now, I am his assistant when we are to prepare the land for another planting season. I would say it’s really hard. But when you think of your children, it doesn’t seem like hard work," says Elizabeth T., a 28-year-old mother of two children.

She is asking a loan of PHP 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. The loan will help her achieve better yield in her farm. In that way, she believes, she could easily provide her children education.

CEVI gives not only loans to its clients but also offers trainings and insurance coverage services to help small business grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.es: La Señorita Brenda S. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el Reparto López en la capital de Managua, soltera, vive con su madre. Con planes a corto plazo de mejorar su nivel de vida y seguir ayudando a su mamá. Joven con iniciativa para alcanzar sus objetivos ya que desde hace siete años tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropas, zapatos y otros productos de uso personal, con proyecciones grandes de desarrollo para su negocio, ya que tener una cadena de tiendas esta dentro de sus planes a futuros. Le da las gracias  Afodenic por la oportunidad que se le  brinda en abrir su puerta y permitirle solicitar un préstamo el cual será utilizado para comprar mercaderías como: cosmético, joyas, zapatos, ropas y articulo para damas como: pañoletas, cinturones. Siendo los pequeños pasos para cumplir sus proyectos.
texts.en:
33-year old Señorita Brenda S. lives in the López neighbourhood of the capital city Managua. She is single and lives with her mother. Her short-term plan is to improve her standard of living and to continue helping her mother. This young woman shows the enterprise needed to reach her goals as she has run her own business selling clothes, shoes and other personal items for seven years. She has big plans for the development of the business, with a chain of stores among her future plans. She is grateful to Kiva partner, Afodenic, for opening the door to her and giving her the opportunity to ask for a loan which she will use to buy merchandise such as cosmetics, jewellery, shoes, clothing, as well as items for women like shawls and belts. From small steps big projects grow.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, jewellery, and shoes

loans.name: Ruth Constanza

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas.
Ruth es casada, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Ruth vende ropa variada a pedido, sus ventas los realiza a trabajadores de las distintas instituciones y son en mayor parte al crédito, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Ruth necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sacos y blusas.
Los sueños de Ruth son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y brindar todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Hormigas Community Bank. Ruth is 49, married, and she has three children. Ruth sells various clothing by order. She sells to the workers in different institutions. She mostly sells on credit. She gets her products in the city of Lima. Ruth needs a loan for 1,400 PEN to buy jackets and blouses. Ruth’s dreams are to have her children become professionals, to improve her business, and to give her children everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jackets and blouses

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of three people, all of whom are living in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Long L., 49, has been selected by the members to be the leader. Long L. owns a bigger plot of plantation where she plants various crops to earn a living. She collects her mature produce to sell in bulk to her buyer every three months. She is married with eight children all of whom are single and live at home, while three of her sons are employed (two are painters and one is a teacher). Her husband is a local teacher at the secondary school. Long L.’s sons have been running the painting business for years, but their sector actions still need equipment. Therefore, Long L. has decided to ask for a loan for her sons to use as capital to purchase extra painting tools. 
The other borrowers who have jointL. requested the loan are listed below:
It S. is a sweets seller who is asking for a loan to develop her investments.
Nun S. is a farmer applying for a loan as capital to buy hairdressing tools to begin providing beauty services.

loans.use: To purchase extra tools for their painting services

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Eugenia es casada, tiene 52 años y 3 hijos, Eugenia vende cereales y menestras en el mercado de la ciudad de Cañete que se ubica a 6 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los cereales los compra en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Eugenia sueña con mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Nobleza Communal Bank.
Eugenia is 52 years old, married and has three children. Eugenia sells cereals and legumes at the market in the city of Cañete, which is located six hours from the city of Ayacucho. She buys the cereals at Ayacucho’s wholesale food market.
Eugenia needs a 1,000 PEN loan to purchase cereals.
Eugenia dreams of improving her business and giving her daughters a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cereals

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco García Martínez tiene 67 años. Este señor se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi de manera muy humilde y trabajadora. Hace más de 50 años que se dedica a este negocio. El inicio este negocio desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que aprendió a conducir a pesar de esta muy joven él era un joven muy responsable ya que tenía que hacerse cargo de su familia, y trabajo muy duro para obtener su propio su propio negocio y decide comprar un carro y este es su medio de trabajo y así ha logrado proporcionarle a su familia lo más necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de llantas, focos y proporcionarle mantenimiento. El sueño de Juan es comprar un nuevo carro y que asegurar más ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco García Martínez is 67 years old. He makes a living providing a taxi service. He is very humble and hard working, and has made a living in this business for more than 50 years. Juan started this business a long time ago, and learned to drive when he was very young; he had to take care of his family, and so he had to be very responsible as a young man. Juan worked very hard to set up his own business and decided to purchase a car. This is his source of income and it has enabled him to provide his family with what they need most. The funding Juan is requesting is for working capital, which he will use to purchase tires and lights and to perform maintenance on his car. Juan’s dream is to purchase a new car and thus guarantee more income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zamonkul

texts.ru: Одинаев Замокул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст 45 лет. Женат имеет 4 детей. Замонкул имеет среднее образование. Он более 10 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. он откармливает и продает скот на рынке. Кредит просит для закупа скота и в дальнейшем его продажи.
texts.en:
Zamonkul O. is a 45-year-old, married father of four, living in the Yavana district. Zamonkul has secondary education. For more than ten years, he has been involved in raising animals, in that he takes care of livestock and sells them at the market. The loan request is to purchase livestock and to sell them in the long term.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Paraiso De Antapasco Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Paraíso D. Antapasco, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Antapasco, distrito D. San Antonio D. Antapasco, provincia D. Angaraes, departamento D. Ayacucho.

Eleodora es divorciada y tiene 01 hija. Eleodora se dedica a la crianza y venta D. cuyes, los cuales venD. en el mercado D. su comunidad, con el apoyo D. su hija. Eleodora, requiere D. un préstamo con el cual incrementara la crianza D. sus cuyes. Eleodora, tiene como meta el poder cultivar alfalfa para la alimentación D. sus cuyes.

Aurea es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Aurea como otras personas D. su comunidad se dedica a la crianza y venta D. cuyes, con el apoyo D. su esposo e hijos. Eleodora solicita un préstamo, con el cual cultivará alfalfa, la cual estará destina a la alimentación D. sus cuyes. Aurea destinará sus ahorros en la educación D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Paraíso D. Antapasco Communal Bank is located in the Anapasco community, San Antonio D. Antapasco district, Angaraes province, Ayacucho department. Eleodora is divorced and has one daughter. Eleadora raises and sells guinea pigs. She sells them, with help from her daughter, in the community market. Eleadora needs a loan to expand her business of raising guinea pigs. Eleodora’s goal is to be able to grow alfalfa to feed her guinea pigs. Aurea is married and has three children. Aurea, like other people in the community, raises and sells guinea pigs. She does this with help from her husband and children. Eleodora is asking for a loan to grow alfalfa. The alfalfa is to feed her guinea pigs. Aurea’s savings are for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Altiplano Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Villa tejada se reúne la asociación “Altiplano” un grupo muy simpático ya que además de trabajar juntas con el sistema de créditos que pro-mujer les ofrece, llegaron a formar una linda amistad entre ellas.
Actualmente son varias las actividades que realiza esta asociación, por ejemplo  Isabel hace seis años elabora masitas y las vende de forma ambulante, Justina vende variedad de frutas, Leonora vende papa y chuño,  Yolanda realiza tejido de mantas, Katy tiene un puesto de libros, Fabiola elabora pan y comida. Ellas afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de insumos y variedad de productos (harina, azucar, frutas y otros ).
texts.en:
The village bank, "Altiplano" meets at a regional office called Villa Tejada. They are a very nice group that in addition to working together in Pro-Mujer's system, they have formed lovely friendships within the group.

Currently there are a variety of activities in which this bank works. For example, Isabel has been making corn breads for the last six years and peddling them. Justina sells a variety of fruits and Leonora sells potatoes and chuño, or dehydrated potatoes. Yolanda makes fabric for blankets and Katty has a book stall. Fabiola bakes bread and makes food. They say they need more capital to buy supplies and a variety of products like flour, sugar, fruit and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a very hardworking married man and father of two young children. He has been working as a sanitary worker since 2000 to earn enough income to satisfy the needs of his family. Elias is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more merchandise required by his clients.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Sofonias

texts.en:
Sofonias Y. is from the village of Lower Lilingayon, Valencia City. He is 45 years old. Sofonias is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Sofonias runs a bakeshop. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread in the local community. Sofonias has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sofonias joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sofonias is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sofonias from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian M. is from the village of Canicapan Clarin, Mis. Occ.. She is 41 years-old and married with three three school-aged children. Vivian owns and operates a service-based business operating a motorcycle "habal-habal" in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Vivian joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase spare parts for the motorcycle and also to invest a portion of the loan to another business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Vivian from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Ablawa Eugénie

texts.fr: A. Ablawa Eugénie est née le 30 Mars 1948 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin.  C’est une veuve ayant à sa charge trois enfants dont deux sont ses propres enfants et sont tous scolarisés. Ablawa Eugénie vit seule avec ses enfants au quartier Cocotomey non loin de Cotonou, depuis trois ans. Ablawa Eugénie supporte seule les charges de la famille. Ablawa Eugénie a très tôt arrêté l’école, et il y a deux ans, elle mène comme activité la vente de fuits et aussi de charbons de bois en détail à Cocotomey. Ablawa Eugénie s’approvisionne aux marchés de Glo et de Ouègbo, au Bénin. Ablawa Eugénie a déjà obtenu auprès de ALIdé, un crédit qui a été bien remboursé. C’est pour accroître son activité et ouvrir sa propre boutique afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que Ablawa Eugénie sollicite un deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Ablawa Eugénie was born on May 30, 1948 in Ouidah, a historic city of Benin. She is a widow with three children to support. Two of them are her own children, and all of them are in school. For three years, she has been living alone with her children in the Cocotomey district, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is the sole breadwinner of the family. Ablawa Eugénie stopped attending school early on. For two years, she has been running a business selling fruit and also charcoal at the retail level in Cocotomey. She supplies herself from the markets of Glo and Ouègbo, in Benin. She had an Alidé loan before, which has been repaid. To grow her business and to open her own shop, so as to satisfy her customers further, she's requesting a second Alidé loan.

Translated from French by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit (3 baskets of pineapples, 2 truck-loads of oranges) and 10 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Arnold

texts.es:
Arnold, tiene la edad de 21 años, es soltero, y  tiene 1 hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El tiene una finca de 4 hectarias donde cultiva cafe. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. El quiere comprar de abone, pago de peones y  asistencia de cafe para que el cafe se prepare bien para la proxima cosecha . Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El tiene el deseo a lograr que coseche mas para aumentar sus ingresos y poder cubrir asi sus necesidades basicas con su madre. 
About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Arnold is 21 years old, single and has a son who is his top priority. He has four hectares of country property where he grows coffee. He has been working on this property for several years. He wants to buy fertilizer and pay workers so that the coffee is well prepared for the next harvest. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hopes to harvest more in order to supplement his income and to be able to cover the costs of basic needs with his mother. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: supplement the coffee, buy fertilizer and pay workers

loans.name: Karina Jahaira

texts.es:
El banco comunal Esperanza para superarse se reúne en el balneario San Jacinto en la costa norte en la Provincia de Manabí, la señora Karina tiene 4 ciclos formando parte del banco comunal.

El hogar de Karina esta formado por dos hijos y en espera del tercero, tiene 27 años está casada desde hace ocho, ella   se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos y para el cuidado personal hace seis meses lo hace visitando puerta a puerta a sus clientes que  son del  mismo sector donde vive, como sus ventas son por medio de catálogo  ella toma el pedido y cuando le llegan los productos entrega a sus clientes que le cancelan la mitad del valor de su compra y la diferencia a ocho  días plazo.

Con este nuevo préstamo va a comprar perfumes, labiales, cremas, maquillajes para damas y caballeros  que más se venden  ya que esta época  existen  buenas promociones y de esta manera pueden acceder a mejores facilidades de pago para satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes y  captar nuevos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Esperanza para Superarse” (Hope to Overcome) meets in the resort town of San Jacinto, which is located on the northern coast in the Province of Manabí. Sra. Karina has participated in four loan cycles as a member of this Communal Bank.

Karina’s family consists of two children with another one on the way. She is 27 years old and has been married for eight years. For the past six months, she has been selling cosmetics and personal care products. She goes door to door offering her products to customers who live in her same neighborhood. Her sales are made through a catalog. When she delivers the products to her customers, they must pay for half of the value of their order and then she collects the balance in eight days.

With this new loan, Karina will buy perfumes, lipsticks, crèmes, and makeup for women and men. She sells more around this time of the year because there are good promotions that exist during this season. Since she has access to better payment options, she can meet the demands of her existing customers and attract new ones.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Tav

texts.en:
Mrs. Tav K. is 44 years old. She lives in Ta Koam Village in Takeo Province. She breeds pigs and makes rice wine. Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets. With the rest of the loan, she will buy the rice to make her rice wine.  

Her husband, Mr. So Khlot, is a house builder who does not earn enough income to support his family. Mrs. Tav K. is a mother of three children. One of her children is an employee in the garment factory, one is a housekeeper, and the youngest is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and rice for her rice wine business

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
Rina, vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 65 años y tiene dos hijas (Edith y Mery). Rina alterna sus actividades del hogar con su trabajo de profesora del colegio “Inca Gracilazo de la Vega” de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia nos cuenta que la situación económica de su familia esta baja entonces decidió dedicarse a otra actividad pues vio la posibilidad de confeccionar chompas de lana. Ya son 26 años que se dedica a la enseñan y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su trabajo. Rina forma parte del banco Comunal “Yanapakuy” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo de los 100 dólares, que invertirá en comprar lana y hacer un curso de actualización de confección de chompas de lana. Rina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
