(Yanapakuy es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa “ayudemos”).
texts.en:
Rina is 65 years old and lives in the city of Cusco. She has two daughters (Edith and Mery). Rina alternates between her household duties and her work as a teacher in the “Inca Gracilazo de la Vega” school in Cusco. She tells us that her family’s economic situation is not very good, so she decided to pursue another activity. She saw the possibility of making and selling wool sweaters. She has been teaching for 26 years and, thanks to her dedication, she is doing well. Rina is a member of the “Yanapakuy” de la Asociación Arariwa” comunal bank. She needs a $100 loan which she will use to buy yarn and take a sweater-making class. Rina appreciates this opportunity and promises to repay the loan according to the repayment schedule. (The word “Yanapakuy” is a Quechua word, which translates to mean “We will help.”)

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in yarn and a sweater making class

loans.name: Friendship Club Group

texts.en:
Friendship Club is a group of five borrowers led by Matu S.. She is 37 years old and married with five children aged 2-20 years old.  Their educational levels are 2nd grade to 6th grade.  Matu is illiterate due to poverty.

Matu and her family live and work in the Coconut Plantation community, which is on UN drive in downtown Monrovia.  Matu sells cold water and fried plantain chips to residents of her community. 

She has been running this business for more than seven years, and started selling with one freezer but now operates with five freezers.  She gives her customers good service in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.  Matu will use this loan to purchase one more freezer to continue to grow her business.  She dreams of giving her children a better education as well as good health care.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Matu is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer, de 30 años, está casado con Jovana, también de 30 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una zona de la selva central del Perú.

Desde hace 6 años se dedica a cultivar café, plátanos, maíz y achote en sus terrenos propios; eventualmente le ayuda su esposa y también contrata operarios, principalmente para el plantado, mantenimiento y cosecha de sus tierras. La agricultura le gusta mucho y le es rentable porque le ha permitido construir su casa y comprar algunos muebles, pero sobretodo cubrir la educación de sus hijos y los gastos domésticos sin problema.
Para más adelante se proyecta a construir la otra parte de su casa, acondicionando los espacios para poder convertirse en un comerciante mayorista de frutas, además continuará con su proyecto de construir un vivero bien amplio.

Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, reconoce que los integrantes de su banco comunal son bastante unidos, es por eso que le gusta trabajar con ellos en busca de un futuro mejor para cada uno y para toda su comunidad. Con los dos mil soles que solicita comprará decenas de bolsas para empacar el café, también adquirirá 5 sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Wilmer, age 30, is married to Jovana, who is also 30. They have four minor children. They all live in their own house, which is in an area of the central jungle of Perú. For six years he has been growing coffee, bananas, corn, and “achote” (annato, a spice) on his own land. Sometimes his wife helps him, and he also contracts workers to primarily plant, maintain, and harvest his land. He really likes farming, and it is profitable for him. It has allowed him to build his house and buy some furniture. But, most of all, it covers his children’s education and the household expenses with no problem. Later he plans on building another part of his house and setting up spaces for him to be able to become a fruit wholesale merchant. Also, he will continue with his project of building a large nursery. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He realizes that the members of his communal bank are very united, and that is why he likes to work with them. They are looking for a better future for each one and for all of their community. He will use the 2,000 PEN that he is requesting to buy dozens of bags to pack the coffee. He will also get five sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and bags for packing coffee

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 33-year-old married man and father of one young child. Ten years ago, when he was young, he started learning the hairdressing occupation as a new career in his life. He became a talented hairdresser and in 2006, he started working on his own. He opened his own barber shop and receives clients from his village and its surroundings. He is the only provider for his family with his business. 

Today, Joseph is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy additionA. supplies needed, such as hair gels, shaving soap, etc., in order to expand his client base and increase his business productivity and income as a result.

loans.use: Buy additional supplies

loans.name: Celia Esperanza

texts.es: Celia Esperanza tiene 72 años de edad, Doña Celia tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa, golosinas y plásticos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio ella comercializa los productos de manera ambulante, ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ser una mujer muy independiente. Ella solicita este financiamiento  para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa en general y compra de bolsas. El gran deseo que tiene es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Celia Esperanza is 72 years old. Celia has four children, and they all work. She sells clothes, sweets, and plastic products. She has been in this business for over six years. She is a street vendor. She has always liked working and being a very independent woman. She is asking for this loan to buy general clothes and bags. Her big wish is to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Moa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Moa H. is a 38-year-old married woman and she is the leader of a group loan which consists of eight members, located in Champuh K’aek village in Kandal province. With their loans, the members will buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Moa H. is a grocery seller who can earn a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Nhor OE., is a construction worker, helping support his family with his small salary. This couple has two children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the younger one is 2 years old.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries

loans.name: Primaveras De German Busch Group

texts.es:
Dora C. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Primaveras de German Busch, cuenta que esta con la familia de Pro Mujer hace 6 años aproximadamente, ingresó por invitación de unas amigas de su zona, ella se dedica a la costura de deportivos, contactándose con padres de familia de estudiantes que están en etapa escolar o colegial y les muestra sus productos de esta manera consigue clientes. Dora compra su materia prima como tela, forro e hilos de la ciudad de La Paz, ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar los mismos.
Las demás integrantes de esta asociación tienen variados negocios del área de producción, servicio y comercio. Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o capital fijo. 
Ellas se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal German Busch.
texts.en:
Dora C. is a member of the Primaveras de German Busch (Springs of German Busch) communal association; she relates that she has collaborated with Pro Mujer for about 6 years. She became a member thanks to an invitation tended by some girl friends in the area. She sews sportswear. She gets customers by contacting parents of students that are in school or high school and she shows them her products. She buys her raw materials like fabric, lining and thread, in La Paz. She needs funding to buy these materials. The other members of this association have various commercial activities in production, service and retail. They all need funds to acquire merchandise, ingredients or to use as fixed capital. They meet every two weeks at the German Busch Focal Center.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material.

loans.name: Blanca Magali

texts.es:
Blanca Magali G. B. tiene 21 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Blanca es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Blanca trabaja en la agricultura, en la siembra de diferentes productos como maíz y trigo. Los compra y vende en los diferentes mercados del cantón. Solicita el préstamo para la agricultura y espera utilizarlo bien. Su sueño es incrementar su actividad para poder ayudar a su familia y seguir adelante con sus estudios. Los desafíos por cuales tiene miedo son enfermedades o también una mala administración del negocio.
Le gusta hace deporte como basket y bailar cuando hay programas.
texts.en:
Blanca is 21 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the hamlet of San Miguel, located in the Bolívar province. She is a member of the “Rural Window of Lotan Bajo,” which is located 30 minutes from the town of San Miguel. There are 13 members, most of who are dedicated to agriculture. Blanca raises different crops, such as corn and wheat. She buys and sells in different markets around the hamlet. She is asking for this loan and will use it wisely. She wants to increase her activity in order to be able to help her parents and continue with her studies. She is always concerned about plant diseases or poor management of her business. She likes sports such as basketball and dancing.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Mi Bankito ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mi Bankito esta formado por 11 socias que luchan día a día en sus trabajos para salir adelante y así crecer conjuntamente con su familia, viven en la comunidad del Aguacate, en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza arquitectónica, su gente, su cultura, su gastronomía.

La Señora Fanny León vive en la comunidad de Guagunchi perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, fue invitada por su hermana ha formar parte de este bankito de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, se dedica a trabajar en el taller  de su propiedad, lleva trabajando 10 años en su negocio laborando de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., se dedica a la confección de jeans, trabaja con empleados quienes le colaboran para crecer en su negocio.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años de edad, casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 3 hijos quienes tienen 16, 13 y 10 años de edad, su primer hijo se ha retirado del colegio por unos problemas que ha tenido pero este año de nuevo va a reingresar, su segundo hijo se encuentra estudiando en el colegio, y su última hija estudia en la escuela, su esposo trabaja en el taller de la familia, gracias al trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia, con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela y materiales para su taller, su meta es seguir creciendo en su taller.

La Señora Gladis A. vive en la comunidad del Aguacate, tiene 40 años de edad, casada, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos quienes ahora se encuentra de 20, 19, 18, 17 años de edad, su primer hijo estudio en la universidad, su segunda hija ha tenido que retirarse de sus estudio por quedar embarazada  y ahora vive en unión libre, su tercer hijo es casado y vive de manera independiente, su último hijo estudia en el colegio, su esposo es chofer de grúas, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica al arreglo de una casa en la cual va 8 años trabaja solo el medio día ya que el resto del tiempo se dedica al cuidado de un niño, también hay veces que se da  tiempo para lavar ropa de otras personas. Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, antes a pertenecido a otro grupo en la banca comunal y los créditos le han beneficiado para la estabilidad económica de su hogar, por las facilidades en el pago. Con su nuevo crédito lo va pagar  una letra de la computadora que adquirido para el estudio de sus hijos, su meta es de llegar a tener un negocio propio para no depender de otra persona.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Mi Bankito” (My Little Bank) consists of eleven members who struggle day after day in their jobs so that they can get ahead and grow alongside their families. They live in the community of Aguacate in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful architecture, its people, its culture, and its cuisine.

Sra. Fanny León lives in the community of Guagunchi, which is part of El Valle Parish. She is participating in her second loan cycle. Fanny was invited by her sister to become part of this Communal Bank made up of determined and enterprising women. She has has been operating her own workshop for ten years. Fanny works from 8am until 6pm making jeans. She has employees who work for her and help grow her business.

Fanny is 36 years old, married, and has three children (ages 16, 13, and 10) that resulted from her relationship with her husband. Her oldest child dropped out of high school because of a few problems, but he plans to return next year. The second child currently attends high school and her youngest daughter is in elementary school. Her husband works in the family business. Thanks to their mutual efforts, they were able to build their own home. With her new loan, Fanny plans to buy fabric and materials for her workshop. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

Sra. Gladis A. lives in the community of Aguacate. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children who are currently 20, 19, 18, and 17 years of age. Her oldest child attends the university. Her second daughter had to quit school after she became pregnant and is now in a common law marriage. Her third child is married and lives independently. The youngest child is a high school student. Her husband works as a crane operator. As a result of both of their jobs, they were able to build their own home.

Gladis has worked the past eight years providing housekeeping services at a residence. She only works half a day and spends the rest of the time caring for her child. There are times when she also does laundry for other people. Gladis is participating in her second loan cycle and was previously part of another Communal Bank group. The loans have been a great benefit because they have provided financial stability to her household and the payments are simple to make. Her new loan will be used to pay the bill for the computer that she acquired to help with her children’s studies. Gladis hopes to have her own business so that she does not have to depend on other people.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, zippers, buttons, and thread for making jeans

loans.name: Mich

texts.en:
Mrs. Mich T., age 49, lives in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.20 hectares of land to cultivate rice and vegetables, which allows them to earn a small income to support her family. She currently faces a problem because she does not have enough money to ensure successful crops. She has therefore decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to rent a water machine to water her crops. 

Mrs. Mich T. is a widow with three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Torn

texts.en:
Torn L., 64, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is a farmer and grows rice for an income of approximately $0.80 per day. Her husband is a three-wheeled cycle driver, earning an income of about $3 per day. 

L. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Oswaldo Ramón

texts.es:
En el barrio Carlos Fonseca   Municipio de Somotillo el  señor C. L. Realiza su trabajo como productor agropecuario en una finca ubicada en la comarca conocida como la ceiba atendiendo su ato ganadero y sus cultivos.
El nos dice que el crédito será utilizado Compra de una vaca parida para aumentar su ato ganadero.
Este es el curto crédito que nos solicita y nos dice que los primeros créditos la beneficiaron para dar mantenimiento a su finca y la compra de 4 vacas paridas.
texts.en:
In the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood of the town of Somotillo, C. L. works as an agricultural producer in a farm located in the district known as “La Ceiba” (a type of tree). There he tends his cattle herd and crops. He tells us that the loan will be used to purchase a cow that has recently calved to improve his herd. This is the fourth loan that he has requested from us and he tells us that the first loans benefited him with the maintenance of his farm and the purchase of four cows that had recently calved.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a recently calved cow to improve his cattle herd.

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin C. (in the photo), is 41 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Khim Sean, who is 40 years old, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1995 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of them are in school.

Mrs. Sophoin has been a silk weaver for 26 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a farmer; he grows green beans and bitter gourds on his farmland in the village. He does not have enough capital to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm, and so Sophoin is requesting her first loan of 400 USD to provide her husband with capital.

loans.use: To provide capital for her husband's farming business.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 55 años, es una madre  de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijas. Por las mañana se dedica a preparar diferentes comidas en el comedor popular del estado, en compañía de su vecina, a dos cuadras de su casa, y a cambio de su labor le dan 5 porciones de comida a cada una, como un pago por ayudar en este trabajo de ayuda social. Por las tardes ayuda a su esposo a lijar la madera que previamente son cortadas, de esa manera apoya en el trabajo de carpintería, que su esposo se dedica. Siendo este taller ubicado en su casa propia, puede trabajar tranquilamente, es así que han pasado 35 años, y se siente muy feliz por las actividades que realiza, manifiesta que le gusta mucho el trabajo. Espera en adelante mejorar y construir el segundo piso de su casa, así logrará ampliar su taller de carpintería. Este es su 33avo crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura será  muy puntual como en anteriores veces, en su grupo solidario es una socia muy respetada. Con este crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de madera y demás materiales de carpintería para implementar su taller.
texts.en:
Dina is 55 years old and she is a very hard working mother. She lives in her own home together with her husband and their two daughters. In the mornings, together with her neighbour two blocks away, she prepares various traditional and popular foods of the region. In payment for her work she and her friend are each given 6 portions of food. In the afternoons she helps her husband sand wood that has been shaped, her way of helping out with her husband's the carpentry business. The carpentry shop is in their house so they can work at their own pace. This has been their life for the past 35 years. She is very happy with the businesses she carries out and she loves her work. In the future she hopes to build a second story in their house, to move their carpentry shop there. This is their thirty-third loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she has been very punctual with her past loans. She is a well respected member of her group. This loan will be invested in the purchase of wood and other carpentry materials to stock the business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more wood to stock the carpentry business.

loans.name: Arlee Jane

texts.en:
Arlee Jane B. is a single woman who lives in Prk. Panaguikan, Brgy. Tapon, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a general store  business.  Arlee Jane joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Arlee Jane has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future and to improve her business. 

Arlee Jane B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Josefa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Sra. Josefa de Jesús G., se dedica la venta de verduras ofreciendo su producto en el mercado la terminal, iniciando sus labores desde las 5:00 am y finalizándolas a las 6:00 pm.

La Sra. Solicita el crédito para realizar compras de quequisque, chayotes, papas, cebolla, tomates, arroz, azúcar, aceite al por mayor, gracias a los créditos brindados por ceprodel ha logrado incrementar su inventario además de vender venturas hoy vende granos básicos.
texts.en:
Josefa de Jesús G. sells fruit at the terminal market.  She begins working at 5:00 AM and finishes at 6:00 PM.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy inventory such as chayote squash, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, rice, sugar, and cooking oil in bulk.  Thanks to the CEPRODEL loans, she’s been able to expand her inventory.  Aside from vegetables, she now also sells basic grains.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine V. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Katherine is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Katherine owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling biscuits, instant juice & daily use products like bath soaps and dishwashing liquids in the local community. Katherine has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Katherine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Katherine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Katherine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Pablo Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor  Pablo Alfonso C. E. es trabajador de una imprenta desde hace 3 años ha obtenido 5 creditos con CEPRODEL, ha sido muy cumplido con sus pagos.

Don Pablo C. solicito credito para alistar a su hijo que esta por culminar sus studios de primaria y necesita pagar colegiaturas, y preparle uniformes para su promocion.
texts.en:
Mr Pablo Alfonso C. E. has been working in a printing business for 3 years.   He has had 5 loans from CEPRODEL and has always made his repayments on time.

Pablo C. is requesting a loan to get his son ready.  His son is about to finish his elementary school education and he needs to pay his tuition fees and get him a uniform for his graduation.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa; tiene 41 años de edad, y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de carros, la socia también vende repuestos de vehículos, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de carros. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos de vehículos.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Carmen Rosa is 41 years old, married and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling cars.  She also sells spare parts for vehicles.  She works from 9.00am to 6.00pm and would like to improve her car sales business.  She is requesting this loan to buy spare parts.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for vehicles

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is an ambitious thirty-eight-year-old married man with eight children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been a farmer for eighteen years now and he is still yielding ever better results which have enabled him to pay school fees for his children. However his dream is to farm extensively and increase his yields. Charles needs the loan to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.use: Buying seedlings for planting

loans.name: Ka-La-Mayre Group

texts.en: Jatu S. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs.  Born in Rubureh village in northern Sierra Leone, she is 32 years of age, married to a teacher and  has three children, two of whom are attending primary school. For five years now, Jatu has been selling firewood. With her share of this loan, she will buy a truckload of firewood to sell.

loans.use: To buys firewood to sell.

loans.name: Wasim

texts.en: Wasim is a 32-year-old married man, who is the father of three children. Wasim has owned a pharmacy in Baalbeck since 2005. He’s requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to increase his capital. His clients are all kinds of people of different levels, cultures, and religions, because such a business is for everyone in need. Wasim is well known, and his special customer service distinguishes him among his competitors. Wasim hopes to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: To increase his capital.
